She has been in the animal husbandry business for more than 10 years. She has great experience and the ability to be successful in business.  Barchinoy wants to increase her working capital and asks for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy cattle. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: Derick

texts.en:
Derick is 38-year-old man who deals in supplying eggs. He owns a retail shop in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a married father of three, whose spouse is a housewife and he has been in this business for the last three years, doing well.

This marks his fifth borrowing, after successfully repaying his previous loan. Derick will use the money to purchase trays of eggs, cooking fat, and sacks of sugar for his shop. 

The anticipated profit will be used to service his loan and to expand his retail shop business. He hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase trays of eggs, cooking fat, and sacks of sugar for his shop.

loans.name: Yuliana Aide

texts.es:
Yuliana Aide tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Morrropon conocida como la Capital del Tondero, su población se dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería que pertenece a la Provincia de del mismo nombre, ubicado en la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella alquila su mototaxi para servicio de transporte público, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos de su mototaxi y de esta manera seguir alquilando su vehículo y generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yuliana Aide, 22, lives with her husband and kids in the Morropon district, known as the home of tondero music.  People in this area work in farming, selling products, and raising livestock.  The district is located in the province of the same name in the Piura region of the north coast of Peru.

Yuliana Aide rents her motorcycle taxi to provide a public transportation service.  She is an enterprising mom.  Yuliana Aide has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to buy parts for her motorcycle taxi so she can continue renting the vehicle and generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy parts for her vehicle

loans.name: Hermogenes

texts.en: Hermogenes is an industrious farmer. His work is very difficult but he is determined to continue and improve his business. He asks for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay labor costs. He wants his crops to grow well and earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a variety store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending and raising hogs.  Grace requests a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional soft-drinks and other groceries to sell in her variety store.

Grace has sustained her business activities with five  previous loans from NWTF and Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional soft-drinks and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 44 years old and married, with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Ma. Elena has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Ma. Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Marison

texts.en:
Marison works hard to support her family. She is married and has a manicure and pedicure services business in the Philippines. Marison has been in this business for five years now. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items for her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items for her manicure and pedicure business

loans.name: José Norberto

texts.es:
José es un campesino de 52 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos por quienes trabaja incansablemente para sacarlos adelante.
Aprendió el oficio de agricultor gracias a las enseñanzas que su padre le transmitió desde pequeño; esto le ha dado la posibilidad de aprovechar los conocimientos adquiridos para hacer uso de ellos y explotar la tierra que posee, allí tiene cultivos de café con 10.000 palos en producción, cultivos de plátano, árboles frutales y además tiene 3 hectáreas con sembrados de caña, la cual transforma en panela desde un trapiche que es propiedad de un amigo; de esta forma ha generado los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos familiares y del hogar.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas (abonos, pesticidas, larvicidas, fertilizantes), que requiere para reabonar su cultivo de café y así hacer más productiva la cosecha para tener la posibilidad de venderla a un mejor precio en el mercado y generar un mayor nivel de utilidades, lo que le permitirá reinvertir en su actividad agrícola que se ha convertido en su única fuente de ingresos.
José, como todo agricultor sueña con ampliar sus cultivos, especialmente el de café y caña de azúcar, así podrá aumentar la rentabilidad del negocio y estará en la capacidad de dar a sus hijos una educación universitaria de buena calidad y mejorará las condiciones de vida de todo el grupo familiar.
texts.en:
José is a married 52-year-old farmer. He has three children, and he works tirelessly to help them get ahead. José learned how to be a farmer thanks to his father, who taught him agriculture from a young age. José was able to take advantage of this knowledge in order to make use of the land he owns. He has coffee crops, with 10,000 plants in production, banana trees and fruit trees. He also has three hectares planted with sugar cane, which he transforms into brown sugar using a mill that belongs to a friend. With these activities, José has generated enough income to cover the expenses for his family and his household. 

José is currently requesting this loan in order to buy agricultural inputs (fertilizers, pesticides, larvicides and manure), which he needs in order to refertilize his coffee crops. This will make his harvest more productive and make it possible to sell the crops at a better price in the market, and generate a higher level of profits. José will be able to reinvest in his agricultural work, which has become his only source of income.

José, like all farmers, dreams of increasing his harvests, especially for his coffee and sugar cane crops. This would let him increase the profitability of his business and put him in a position to give his children a high-quality university education. It would also improve the living conditions of his whole family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs, such as manure, fertilizers, pesticides and larvicides.

loans.name: Miradija

texts.en:
Miradija is a 49-year-old mother of four children, two boys and two girls, all of whom are adults now. They are still all living together in an Ashkali community of Kosovo. 

Unemployment is high in these communities and she is fortunate that her husband is a taxi driver in his area, but he still doesn't earn enough to take care of all of the family expenses they have monthly. As a way to remedy this problem and ease some of their difficulties, Miradija and her husband have decided to start a new business. Working together as partners, they will sell used technical equipment that they will purchase in some of the bigger western European countries such as Germany. These products will include, but are not limited to, televisions, freezers, fax machines, scanners and even tires. For this reason she applied for a 2,000 EUR loan in order to buy technical equipment.

They will then sell this used equipment in a local market at a higher price to make a profit on each item.  Since they are able to purchase these things at a low price, they believe that this business will be successful and Miradija is very happy that her first job and work experience will be as a business partner with her husband, which leads her to feel confident and secure about their decision.

loans.use: To buy used technical equipment like televisions, freezers, fax machines, scanners, and even tires

loans.name: Venera

texts.en:
Venera and her husband live in the town of Masis. The couple runs a small farm with 6 chickens and  grows greens. After 8 years of operating a farm, they were able to have a sustainable farm which helps them to meet their daily costs. Realizing how important agricultural income is, Venera has applied for this loan to renovate the barn. This will help her to keep livestock  and enlarge her farm. 

This is Venera's first loan; it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who previously didn’t have access to credit products because they have no credit history. This loan is very important for Venera and her husband because they will be able to enlarge their farm and increase their income.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the barn

loans.name: Tsedendorj

texts.en:
Tsedendorj is 52 years old. He lives with his wife, daughter and son in Kherlen, an easternmost town in Mongolia. Tsedendorj has a disability and gets a state pension. His wife and daughter work at a milk factory and his son transports diary products to the capital city to sell. Tsedendorj’s family house has deteriorated over the years and needs some serious repair.

Tsedendorj is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy vacuum-insulated windows, hardwood floors, shingles, fiberglass and foam to renovate his house. He will use his loan to create a comfortable and warm place for his family to live. Less coal will be burned and fewer pollutants released into air.

loans.use: to renovate his house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sugar for making honey.

loans.name: Zulaa

texts.en:
Zulaa is 48 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Darkhan, the third largest city of Mongolia. Since 2009, she has been working as a container polisher at a private firm. Zulaa’s husband is currently unemployed and stays at home. Their children all go to high school. 

Zulaa is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy an electric car to start a taxi service. The advantage of an electric car is that it contributes to cleaner air because it emits less pollutants into air and wastes less fuel. Her car will be used by her husband to start a taxi service.

loans.use: to buy an electric car

loans.name: Munkhnaran

texts.en: Mrs. Munkhnaran is 27 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Kherlen, the easternmost town in Mongolia. She has been working as a product developer in a business center since May, 2013. Her husband sells vegetables at a grocery store and earns in proportion to his sales. Her elder daughter studies at elementary school and younger daughter goes to kindergarten. She and her husband recently decided to open a tire repair shop and for this cause she is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy necessary equipment such as a tire changer, wheel balancing machine and tire spreader. This new business will greatly improve her family's living standard if implemented successfully.

loans.use: to buy tire repair equipment

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is a married woman with six children. She is from Getafe, Bohol. For more than ten years, Virgilia and her husband have operated a fishing business. This is their main source of income.

Virgilia is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other supplies. She will use her loan to improve their catch to have more fish to sell in the market. Virgilia hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and supplies

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has a nine-year-old son. She is engaged in a rice-farming business with her husband.

Lydia is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, to pay for labor, and to pay for school fees. With this assistance, she hopes to be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus augmenting her harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, to pay for labor, and to pay for school fees

loans.name: Nieve Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Nieve, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos de 18, 16, 15, 12, 11 Y 9 años de edad, 4 estudian en colegio y los menores en  escuela. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Nieve con la finalidad de ganar algo por su cuenta desde hace 5 años arrendo un local en una avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad en la cual vende comidas rápidas como hamburguesas, papas fritas, sodas, jugos y batidos de frutas, entre otras cosas, con ella trabajan dos personas más a quienes les paga un sueldo por su trabajo. Le encanta su trabajo ya que además de ganar algo por su cuenta también ayuda a que las personas que trabajan con ella puedan ganarse algo por el bien de sus familias.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 ciclos  y le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que el pago de arriendos se le lleva gran parte de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, the members of the Jesús de Nazaret communal bank meet every fifteen days. This city has been known for many years as the city of the true tamarindos, due to the large quantity of this type of fruit that there was here.

Nieve, 34, lives here. She is married and has six children ages 18, 16, 15, 12, 11, and 9. Four of these children are in high school and the younger ones are in primary school. Her husband is a mechanic.

With the goal of earning something on her own, Nieve rented out a space on a busy street in the city five years ago to sell fast food such as hamburgers, french fries, soda, juice and fruit smoothies among other things. Two people work with her, whom she pays a salary. She loves her job because in addition to earning her own income, she also helps the people who work for her so they can earn money for their own families.

She will use this loan to buy supplies for making food. She has been with this communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes the help that the loans provide. Her dream is to have her own space because she now pays rent, which takes up a large portion of her profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman from Getafe, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Josefina is requesting a loan for additional capital for her business. With a loan, she will buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, candies, cookies, shampoos, soaps, toothpaste and others.  Josefina hopes of expanding her business and being a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, candies, cookies, shampoos, soaps, toothpaste and others

loans.name: Deicy Candelaria

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Deicy, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 11 y 8 años los mismos que estudian en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 
Doña Deicy junto al esposo tienen un negocio de venta de comida, todos los días instalan un pequeño local en las afueras de una institución pública lugar por el cual  pasan muchas personas que se sirven sus deliciosos platos, ellos solo venden desayunos y en ciertos días almuerzos también, son dos años que tienen este negocio el cual les permite salir adelante y darles lo necesario a sus hijos de una manera honrada.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 ciclos  y le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un buen restaurante.
texts.en:
The "Jesús De Nazaret" communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. This city has been known for many years now as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, for the great amount of this fruit that grows in this season.

Deicy lives here. She is 34 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship from which she has two children aged 8 and 11, who attend school. Her husband is a businessman. Deicy along with her husband run a business selling food. Every day they set up outside of a public institution. There are a lot of people passing and they sell their delicious meals. They only sell breakfast and on certain days also do lunch. They have had this business for two years. It allows them to get ahead and provide for their children in an honorable manner. 

Deicy will use this loan to buy supplies to make the meals. She has been a member of this communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes the support from the loans. Her dream is to own a good restaurant.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Erlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Erlinda is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in rice farming for several years now. 

Ma. Erlinda is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and more rice seedlings. She will use her loan to improve the productivity of her farm thus augmenting her yield and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seedlings

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Maricar works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Maricar is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Maricar has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina works hard to support her family. Divina is married and has a sound system business in the Philippines.

Divina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional lights and other equipment for the maintenance of her sound system.

Divina has been in this business for 16 years now, and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional lights and othe equipment for the maintenance of her sound system

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 60 years old and widowed with one kid. For the past ten years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from fattening pigs. Merlyn works hard to provide for her family.

Merlyn is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Ana May

texts.en:
Ana May is 29 years old and married with three children in school. For the past four years, she has been running a general store in the Philippines. Ana May works very hard to provide for her family.

Ana May is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs, noodles, and other items to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, rice, sugar, eggs, noodles, and other items

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is 57-years-old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Dominga is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation.

Dominga has been farming rice for twenty years and also earns additional income from farming coconut and raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation

loans.name: Raylen

texts.en:
Raylen is 42 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Raylen has a food vending business in the Philippines. Raylen has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Raylen has been in this business for two years. In the future, Raylen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Carlos Fredis

texts.es:
Carlos, es un padre de familia que vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 4 y 8 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de huevos de gallina por mayor y desinfectantes, en sus inicios lo hacía junto a su primo, pero desde hace ya cinco años que se independizó, lo hace en un horario de 7:00 a.m. has las 5:00 p.m., dependiendo de cómo estén las ventas. 
Utilizara el préstamo para comprar huevos de gallina por mayor para luego distribuirlos con sus  clientes, espera cumplir con los encargos de su producto en menor tiempo, tener más clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
 Aspira hacer crecer su negocio, dar su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Carlos is the father of a family who lives together with his wife and two children aged 4 and 8. He sells eggs wholesale and disinfectant. At first he worked with his cousin but five years ago he went out on his own. He works from 7 am until 5 pm depending on how sales are. He will use this loan to buy eggs wholesale, to later distribute them to his clients. He hopes to fill the orders for his product in less time, have more clients and increase his revenues. He hopes to expand his business and offer his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy eggs.

loans.name: Iryn

texts.en:
Iryn is 40 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, such as eggs, rice, charcoal, sugar, shampoo, and groceries.

Iryn has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Iryn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Loyda Raquel

texts.es:
Loyda, es casada, vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 16, 10 y 6 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando, se dedica a vender material escolar, productos de belleza, entre otro tipo de productos. Es un negocio que emprendió por iniciativa propia hace ya 11 años, lo atiende de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. 
Invertirá en la compra de material didáctico, canastas navideñas, lociones, cremas, etc., para dar más opciones de compra a sus clientes, espera atraer más clientes, aumentar sus ventas y mejorar su economía para cumplir con sus compromisos económicos y familiares.
Aspira tener un supermercado y trabajar con sus propias utilidades.
texts.en:
Loyda is married, and lives with her husband and three children, ages 16, 10, and 6 who attend school.  She sells school supplies, beauty products, and other types of products.  She started this business on her own 11 years ago and she works from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm.

She will buy school supplies, Christmas baskets, perfumes, creams, etc. so she can provide more options to her customers.  She expects to attract more customers, increase her sales, and improve her finances so she can meet her financial and family obligations.

She wants to have a grocery store and work on her own.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Les Scribes Group

texts.fr: Le client Raymond est un commerçant  et président du  collectif  d’affaires «Les scribes», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgé de 33 ans  et  célibataire. Le client est vendeur des produits d’alimentation. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une mini alimentation sur la route dans un Quartier animé, où, elle a su gagner sa clientèle.  Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de ses parents. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 sacs de farine de format, 2 cartons du lait Nido, 1 carton de vin, 3 cartons de jus, 2 cartons d’eau vive, etc. Ainsi, il souhaite  acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser ses petits frères et mieux préparer son avenir. Au finish, il remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits et petites entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout ; pendant ce moment difficile des conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Raymond is a shopkeeper and the president of the borrowing group "Les Scribes" ("the scribes.") He is a dynamic, 33-year-old unmarried entrepreneur who sells food products. He displays his products at a stand on the road in a busy neighborhood where he has acquired his customer base. 

Raymond began his business with initial funds received from his parents. Later, he received a loan from the microfinance organization Hekima. He has been in business for 4 years.

This new loan will allow him to purchase 3 bags of traditional flour, 2 cartons of Nido milk, 1 carton of wine, 3 cartons of juice, 2 cartons of water, etc. With this, he hopes to be able to purchase land and build on it, to educate his little brothers, and to better prepare for his future.

In closing, he sincerely thanks Hekima for their support of small business entrepreneurs not eligible for traditional banking, especially during this difficult period of conflict in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bags of traditional flour, 2 cartons of Nido milk, 1 carton of wine, 3 cartons of juice, and 2 cartons of water

loans.name: Chhabi

texts.en:
Chhabi is a 34-year-old differently able man who lives in a small village of Odisha, India, with his parents, wife and two children, who are studying in a government school near his village. 

He is engaged in transportation. He runs a auto-rickshaw and earns 6,000 INR per month, which is not sufficient for his monthly household expenses. 

Now he is planning to open a vegetable shop at a nearby market. He would run this vegetable shop in the morning and evening so he can make some more money. He wants to give a better standard of life to his family and also wants to educate his children. 

He is asking for a loan amount of 20,000 INR for purchasing of vegetables in bulk and for big baskets for keeping the vegetables.

loans.use: To pay for vegetables in bulk and big baskets for keeping the vegetables for his vegetable shop.

loans.name: Jorge Marcelo

texts.en:
Jorge dreams of becoming a lawyer. To achieve his goal, Jorge has enrolled in the Universidad Privada Del Valle. He plans on graduating in March, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

With this loan, Jorge plans to buy his school books. Up until now he has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With textbooks, he feels he will be able to get better grades. With a degree in law, he expects to earn $39 a day. With two younger brothers and three younger sisters, Jorge hopes to be a role model by being the first in his family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for school books.

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is interested in auto mechanics. He is currently attending Tecnologico Tarija, working towards his degree. He plans on graduating in June, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, he thinks that he may need to take time off to work and save until he can return to school. 

With a loan, Walter plans on spending the money towards purchasing his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them Walter hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. Walter currently works 30 hours a week as a mason and earns $12 a day. One of his biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a degree in automotive mechanics he expects to earn $17 a day.

Growing up, because Walter's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education, finances were always tight. With four other siblings Walter is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Urmila

texts.en:
Urmila is a 40-year-old widow living in a village in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. Since the death of her husband, she has engaged in a tailoring business to support her four children, who are all still dependent on her. Her shop caters to many of the people in her village, but it only supplies a monthly income of 5,000 INR for her family, which is hardly enough to live on.

In hope of increasing their living standard, Urmila’s two oldest daughters went to the nearby town to receive training in professional tailoring after they finished school. Now they want to join their mother and work alongside her in an expanded shop. Urmila is therefore taking a loan to purchase two additional sewing machines so her daughters can help her full time. They estimate this will bring in several thousand more rupees a month for the family.

loans.use: To pay for sewing machines for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Khyanaprabha

texts.en:
For 10 years, Khyanaprabha worked alongside her husband running a medium-sized restaurant, or as the locals say, a “hotel business” in their town in Odisha, a state in Eastern India. Together, they were well known and respected members of the community. 

Last December, however, her husband passed away, leaving her with the business to manage and four daughters to support on her own. She was devastated. Khyanaprahba is a strong woman, but it is a lot of pressure to run a business with six employees and support her daughters, especially in a community where most of the businesses are run by men.

Nevertheless, she is determined to fulfill the dream of her late husband to renovate and improve the hotel. They used to envision turning it into a full-service air-conditioned establishment. Through hard work and the help of her daughters, she has saved 70,000 INR for this project and is taking out this loan for 30,000 INR. With this, she will have enough to build new counters and buy an air conditioner. She is so grateful for Kiva and People’s Forum to reaching out to widows like her and helping them improve their livelihoods.

loans.use: To pay for an air conditioner and to build new counters for her restaurant.

loans.name: Sheyla Jimena

texts.en:
Sheyla dreams of becoming an agricultural engineer but needs a degree to make it possible. Sheyla was accepted into the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about her finances. She plans on graduating in December, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. 

Sheyla plans on using her loan to buy her school books. Up until now she has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades. In addition to her responsibilities at school, Sheyla currently works 25 hours a week and earns $14 a day. 

Sheyla hopes to be a role model for her younger sister by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Tojiniso

texts.en:
Tojiniso, a widow,  was born in 1950  in the North part of Tajikistan. Her husband died in 1996. Tojiniso has a higher education and graduated from the Pedagogical University. She is a seamstress and makes national-women dresses and shawls with beautiful flowers. She has many customers, including tourists. 

Tojiniso lives with her daughter-in-law and grandchildren. Her son works in Russia. She is going to send her grandchild to Russia because her grandchild wants to see his/her father. Tojiniso asks for 3,000 TJS to buy an airline ticket.

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase an airline ticket for her grandchild to see his/her father in Russia.

loans.name: Mumina

texts.en:
Mumina, born in 1977, is a  hardworking woman. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a master in repairing cars. Mumina is a cleaning woman in a local hospital. Mumina and her family live poorly because their income is not enough to meet their daily needs. 

Mumina wants to help her husband to buy a car for his business. He would use the car to provide service to his clients at their home or where needed. She asks for a loan of 4,000 TJS to buy a car. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a car for her husband's business.

loans.name: Juan De Dios

texts.es:
Juan de 53 anos padre soltero con tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estos están estudiando, es originario del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  comprar un lote de cerdos en pie para engorde y luego venderlos, ya que los están ofreciendo a buen precio. Juan agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juan is 53 years old and is the father of three children who he is responsible for.  They attend school and he is from Sauce, an area located in the northern part of the country.  He is known for being a hardworking, responsible person with a desire for personal success.  Unfortunately he was not able to study for a career because he had to go to work at an early age to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to his efforts and desire to get ahead, he buys and sells pigs on the hoof.  He works eight hours a day and his business is located in his home.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a lot of pigs on the hoof to raise and resell.  They are being offered at a good price.  Juan is grateful for the help from the Kiva lenders who help people from poor countries like Nicaragua have a dignified source of work.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
Muyassar is a hardworking woman. She is a widow and has a son. When her husband died, she began her business of sewing because she needed money. Muyassar has been busy with this business more than six years. Her daughter-in-law helps her with managing the business. 

Muyassar little by little develops her business. She sews dresses in her house. Now she is going to buy a workshop near a local bazaar because there are many people. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy a placement for workshop. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a workshop for her sewing business

loans.name: Mia

texts.en:
Mia's dream is to work as a public accountant. To achieve her goal, Mia has enrolled in the BS - Accountancy program at Stella Maris College. She had payed her school tuition fees last semester from her previous loan.  

Mia has four siblings, so attending college is not easy. Currently, she took a new loan from GDMPC Microfinance to pay the retreat fee and other school expenses. 

Mia is thankful to GDMPC for helping deserving students pursue their ambition.

loans.use: to pay the retreat fee and other school expenses.

loans.name: Zivko

texts.en:
Zivko is a 63-year-old father of two sons, ages 15 to 17 years old. He lives together with his family in one of the minority communities of Kosovo, which has suffered devastating effects on the economy from the war. 

As a result, many people who live there are unemployed or are engaged in some type of agricultural business in order to make a living. Zivko is among those that own some land on which he has been planting corn and wheat to sell  at a profit for many years now. He is also able to make some money by working on the fields and lands of others, which adds to their income and demonstrates how hard he has had to work in order to improve his family’s living conditions.  

He is also fortunate that his wife works in a high school doing administrative work and they consider themselves very lucky to be in such a positive situation. At this time, Zivko is in need of a loan in order to purchase some tools and equipment for his tractor so that he can continue to plow and harvest the crops and fields. He hopes to have a brighter future for his family and to give his children a better education. He promises to pay the loan on time and in full.

loans.use: To purchase  tools and equipment for his tractor so that he can continue to plow and harvest the crops and fields

loans.name: Rena

texts.en:
Rena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell native products business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell for her buy and sell native products business.

Rena has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from food vending and manicure and pedicure. Rena has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Victoria is 57 years old and has one child who is in school.

Victoria has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of vegetables to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carlos De Jesús

texts.es:
Carlos, a sus 48 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo.
Siempre trabajó como empleado en diferentes empresas, pero, hace 6 meses inició su propio negocio, un restaurante vegetariano, con la idea innovadora de brindar a sus clientes una comida deliciosa y saludable; la idea surgió de su esposa, ya que ella y una de sus hijas son vegetarianas. Allí trabaja todos los días y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa, el negocio ha tenido buena acogida en el sector y ha ido creciendo poco a poco pues recibe la visita de los habitantes de la zona y de los turistas que llegan al municipio.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (verduras, carve, frutas, entre otros), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y ofrecer más variedad de alimentos nutritivos y saludables a sus comensales, logrando aumentar las ventas y el margen de utilidades.
Carlos manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es hacer que su negocio sea reconocido y pueda posicionarse en el mercado, logrando que cada día más personas adopten un estilo de vida sana y visiten su negocio, esto le permitirá mejorar la rentabilidad del mismo y podrá brindar un mejor bienestar a su familia y educación de buena calidad a su hijo mejor.
texts.en:
48-year-old Carlos lives with his wife and their 3 children whom he has helped to get on in life with a great deal of effort. He always worked as an employee in various companies but 6 months ago he started his own business, a vegetarian restaurant, with the idea of giving his customers delicious healthy food. His wife came up with the idea, since she and one of their daughters are vegetarian. He works there every day with help from his wife. The restaurant has been well received in the area and has been gradually growing, as it gets visits from local residents and tourists who visit the municipality. 

The loan he is asking for will be used to buy supplies wholesale (vegetables, Carve [brand of soy protein], fruit and other items). This will enable him to continue with his work and offer a better variety of nutritious and healthy food to his diners, thus increasing his sales and his profit margin. 

Carlos says his biggest dream is for his business to receive recognition and be able to position himself in the market, so that more and more people adopt a healthy lifestyle and visit his business. This will enable him to improve the profitability of the business, improve the wellbeing of his family and provide a good quality education for his youngest son.

loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (vegetables, Carve [brand of soy protein], fruit and other items).

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, a sus 48 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador y dinámico, dedicado a su familia y apasionado por su labor.
Desde hace más de 26 años se capacitó en latonería y pintura automotriz y comenzó a tener experiencia laboral trabajando en una empresa durante 10 años, allí complementó sus conocimientos y perfeccionó sus técnicas pero, luego del fallecimiento del dueño de la empresa, ésta cerró dejando sin empleo a muchas personas. Por ello, hace 16 años inició su propio negocio de manera independiente, aprovechando que tenía muy buenos contactos a los que a les había prestado sus servicios; trabaja en un espacio al aire libre lo que dificulta su labor en temporada de lluvias, sin embargo sigue adelante, trabaja solo todos los días de 6 am a 6 pm y así logra generar recursos para llevar el sustento a su familia.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de un compresor y herramientas de trabajo, además cancelará el saldo de un crédito que tiene vigente, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y optimizar el tiempo de trabajo, logrando entregar el vehículo de manera oportuna a sus clientes; esto le abre las puertas para fidelizar la clientela actual y para darse a conocer por medio de referidos, aumentando así los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Daniel manifiesta que su proyecto para un futuro cercano, es adquirir una casa que tenga un garaje amplio en el que pueda trabajar cómodamente aun cuando haya temporada de lluvias, pues esto le permitirá generar mayor rentabilidad y estará en la capacidad de dar a su familia un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Daniel at 48 years old, is described as being a hardworking and dynamic man who is dedicated to his family and passionate about his work. More than 26 years ago, he trained in automotive bodywork and painting and began to get experience working at a business for 10 years. There he added to his knowledge and perfected his techniques. However, after the death of the owner of the business, it closed and many people were left unemployed. Because of this, 16 years ago, he started his own independent business, taking advantage of the contacts he had from the services he had provided. He works in an open air space which makes his job difficult during the rainy season. Nonetheless, he continues to go forward. He works every day from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. and that is how he is able to generate resources to support his family. 

The loan he is asking for is to buy a compressor and work tools. He will also pay off a debt that he has. This will allow him to continue with his work and optimize his work time, being able to deliver the vehicles to his customers in a timely manner. This opens the door for him earn the loyalty of the customers he has now and to become better known through word of mouth. This will increase the income that he gets from his work. 

Daniel says that his project for the near future is to acquire a house that has a large garage where he can work comfortably during the rainy season. This will allow him to generate more profits and he will be able to give his family a better well being.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and work tools, as well as to pay off the balance on a debt he has.

loans.name: Narmandakh

texts.en: Narmandakh, 32 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been providing taxi services to local people since 2004. His wife runs a grocery store. Narmandakh is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy spare parts to repair his automobile. Recently, his car has deteriorated due to inadequate road maintenance and snow. It is necessary for him to repair his automobile, as it is the main source of income for his family. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to repair his automobile

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en: Fabian is married and the father of nine adult children. He lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol, with his wife. Fabian has been engaged in fishing for 25 years. He also makes clay pots to earn additional income. He is applying for a loan to buy fishing nets and gasoline for his boat. Fabian hopes to make his fishing and pottery businesses successful.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and gasoline for his boat

loans.name: Adriana Asencion

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Adriana, tiene 49 años de edad, actualmente  mantiene una relación de unión libre, ella tiene dos hijos de 22 y 17 años los mismos que son de otro compromiso el menor estudian en colegio. El marido es maestro soldador. 
Doña Adriana es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un taller de soldadura en su casa allí elabora puertas, ventanas y cualquier tipo de estructuras con el metal,  el trabajo casi nunca  le falta ya que es muy bueno en lo que hace y responsable razón por lo cual le buscan para que él les realice sus obras. Ella por su parte en las tardes y noches traba en un local de venta de comidas rápidas con lo cual se gana algo por su cuenta que le sirven para los estudios de su hijo.
Este crédito es para comprar metal, pinturas, soldaduras y otros materiales para elaborar sus obras. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos sonde mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Jesús De Nazaret" communal bank meets every fortnight in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí. This city has been known for many years now as the city of the Royal Tamarinds, for the great amount of this fruit that grows in this season.

Adriana is 49 years old and lives here. She lives in a common-law relationship. She has two children aged 17 and 22 from another relationship. The younger one is in High School. Her husband is a master solderer. Adriana as a good wife is requesting this loan for her husband to use in his work. He has a soldering workshop in their house where he makes doors, windows and other structures made out of metal. Work is rarely lacking as he is very good at what he does and is responsible. People search him out to do their work. 

Adriana for her part works in a fast food business in the afternoons and evenings where she makes some money to help with her child's studies. This loan is to buy metal, paint, solder, etc. She has been a member of the communal bank since it's inception. She likes it as the loans are a great help. Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy metal, paint, solder, etc.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is 28 years old and lives with his parents in a traditional Mongolian ger, a portable felt dwelling, on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His mother works as a nurse in a health center and his father is currently unemployed and staying at home. Since 2010, Narangerel has been providing taxi services to local people. 

Narangerel is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to buy land to be used by his future family to grow vegetables and raise livestock. He is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to buy land to grow vegetables and raise livestock

loans.name: Petita  Del Carmen

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar vive la señora Petita, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos  mayores de edad, dos de  ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja de conserje y en las noches de taxista.
Doña Petita al ver que a su esposo no le alcanza con lo que el gana decidió dedicarse a un negocio para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa  por catálogos y productos de Avon,  Yanbal, Belcorp (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta. También los fines de semana administra el bar en el lugar donde el esposo trabaja de conserje con lo cual le quedan mejores ganancias. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar ropa y cosméticos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado en los momentos difíciles de su vida. Sus sueños son tener salud ella y su familia.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, in the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds for the large quantity of this fruit that have been produced over time, there is a group that meets every two weeks called the "Group of Credit Jesus of Nazareth." 

In this place lives Petita, who is 53 years old and married.  She has six children with her husband and they are all over 18, but two still live with her.  Her husband works as a custodian, and at nights as a taxi driver.  

Petita, upon seeing that her husband's income was not sufficient to meet household needs, decided to begin a business in order to help meet household expenses.  She works in sales, selling clothing via catalogue and Avon products, as well as Yanbal and Belcorp (beauty and cosmetics items along with perfume and accessories for women).  

Her form of sales is going door to door.  On the weekends she also helps in the bar where her husband works as a janitor, which also provides more income.  

This credit will be used to purchase clothing and cosmetics.  Petita has been part of the communal bank from its beginning and she likes that it helps people through difficult moments in life.  Her dream is for everyone in her family to have good health.

loans.use: To buy clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Tsedenjav

texts.en: Mr. Tsedenjav, 46 years old, lives with his wife, two daughters and one son in Darkhan, second largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as builder since 1988 and has accumulated vast amount of experience in the construction field. His wife and older daughter both earn a living by providing taxi service to local people. He is requesting a loan for 3,000,000 MNT to buy furniture, including a sofa, closet and chest of drawers. His goal is to give his family a more comfortable place to live. He is very hardworking and strives to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 53 years old and married with two children. Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Elisa has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, soap, shampoo and other groceries. 

In the future Elisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of eight children, Felina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Felina is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell in her dried fish business.

Felina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is 34 years old and married with three children. For the past two years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from selling eggs. Rubilyn has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF. She works hard to provide for her family.

Rubilyn is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, she aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Rizan

texts.en:
Rizan is 31 years old and married. For the past two years, she has run an internet café in the Philippines. Rizan is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rizan is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy computer supplies for her internet café. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies

loans.name: Rose Eden

texts.en: Rose Eden is 49 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and is requesting a loan for PHP 6,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming rice  for two years, and is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dough maker.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en:
Working in business administration is Orlando's dream. Orlando was accepted into the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias, and now  with the chance to achieve his dream  he is concerned about financing his education. He plans on graduating in November, 2015, but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

Orlando plans on spending the loan money to purchase his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Orlando hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. 

Orlando currently works 30 hours a week and earns $8 a day. The income from his job is crucial for Orlando, but one of his biggest challenges is making time to work and go to school. With a degree in business administration, he expects to earn $10 a day. Orlando's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family of eight, finances have always been tight. With three younger brothers and four younger sisters, Orlando hopes to be a role model by being the first in his family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 38 years old and married. Together with her spouse, she has been blessed with five children. She has been running a school in Nairobi's Thika Road area for the past six years. 

She plans to use this loan to buy learning materials such as books, pens and writing materials for use in the school. She will also use part of the amount to buy building materials such as iron sheets and cement to renovate the classes.

This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hopes are to buy a plot of land and build a school and residential houses.

loans.use: To buy learning materials and renovate the school.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 35 years old. She is a resident of Mutundwe, a suburb of Kampala, and is married with two children, aged 2 years and 1 month. 

Josephine deals in the business of the sale of shoes, which she started in 2012 with the aim of acquiring daily income.  

Josephine wants a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings to purchase more stock of shoes for her business so as to boost her income. She faces a challenge of inadequate capital, competition and changes in demand.
 
Her customers are the neighboring shops, people from various towns and mostly, ladies and children.

Josephine is such a hardworking lady, with the capacity to make more money if she gets enough capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of shoes

loans.name: Yuleidy

texts.es:
Yuleidy es una joven emprendedora y dinámica de 21 años de edad; también es madre soltera de dos hijos de 6 y 3 años a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Luego de culminar sus estudios secundarios, realizó diferentes cursos de belleza en el municipio donde vivía, allí comenzó a realizar domicilios a sus familiares y amigas para corte, cepillado, manicure y pedicure, con el fin de generar ingresos para sostener a sus pequeños hijos, pero, con el ánimo de especializarse y convertirse en una profesional de la belleza, se trasladó para la ciudad. Ya radicada en la casa de su hermana desde hace dos meses, también comenzó a prestar sus servicios a domicilio, para aportar a la economía del hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de herramientas de trabajo (secador, plancha para el cabello, tijeras, silla de peluquería, entre otros), esto le permitirá comenzar un pequeño salón de belleza en la vivienda, para ser productiva y al mismo tiempo estar pendiente de sus hijos.
Yuleidy, con su espíritu de superación y motivada por el amor a sus hijos, sigue trabajando arduamente en busca del cumplimiento de sus sueños que son, convertirse en una estilista profesional y tener un salón de belleza muy bien acreditado y ubicado en un sector comercial de la ciudad, así podrá dar a sus hijos un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yuleidy is a young and dynamic entrepreneur. She is 21 years old and the single mother of two children, aged 6 and 3, whom she has gotten ahead with a lot of hard work. After finishing her secondary schooling, she took several beauty courses in the town where she lived. She started to offer at-home haircutting, styling, manicure and pedicure services for her relatives and friends in order to generate income to support her young children. However, in order to specialize and become a beauty professional, she moved to the city. She has been living in her sister's house for two months and has started to offer at-home services to contribute to the household finances.

The loan she is asking for will be invested in buying work tools (a dryer, a hair iron, scissors, a barber chair, and more). This will allow her to start a small beauty salon in the house, in order to be productive and to care for her children. 

With her get-ahead attitude and motivated by her love for her children, Yuleidy continues to work hard in to make her dreams come true. These are to become a professional stylist and to have a well respected beauty salon in a commercial area of the city. This way, she will be able to give her children a better well being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy work tools (a dryer, a hair iron, scissors, a barber chair, and more).

loans.name: Hazifa

texts.en:
Hazifa is a 23-year-old married youth client from Iraq. He lives with his parents and his four brothers. Hazifa, along with two of his brothers and his father, provides the family income.

Hazifa owns a shop where he repairs electrical equipment like refrigerators, washing machines and air conditioners. In 2010, Hazifa established his business. Thanks to his wide experience in this field, Hazifa became highly known in his neighborhood and has an excellent reputation.

Hazifa is applying for a youth loan of $2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy specialized equipment for his work, as well as to buy more goods to add to his inventory. Hazifa is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may provide good income for his family.

loans.use: to buy specialized equipment for his work, as well as to buy more goods to add to his inventory

loans.name: M. Riaz

texts.en:
The person shown in the picture is M. Riaz.  He is 43 years old and lives in the populated area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has run a small general store for many years and it is not working very well due to low inventory. His shop is situated in a populated area with a lot of customers interested in the miscellaneous items available in the general store. He wants to offer a variety of items, however due to lack of funds, he is unable to buy items in demand such as flour, detergent, rice and cooking oil. He wants to sell more products and increase his income. 

M. Riaz requests a loan from Kvia’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy flour, detergent, rice and cooking oil, etc.

M. Riaz will be very glad to receive this loan and hopes that he will successfully fulfill his customer's requests and not disappoint them.  

He is very thankful to the Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the general store.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 65 years old and married to Priscila. Together they are supporting one child aged 13 years old.

Patrick is in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru, which he has practiced for 35 years. He has applied for his 10th loan from VisionFund Kenya after paying his previous loans on time. His past loans enabled him to buy a cow. With the anticipated profit from his expanded business, he plans to buy another cow.

In the near future, he hopes to apply for bigger loans from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to boost his farming business and also improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to  buy a cow.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 56-year-old single mother of four children, supporting two who are in school.

She has a retail shop in the Naivasha Gilgil area that she has been running for the past two years. She has applied for a second loan from Vision Fund Kenya, after paying her previous loan on time, to enable her to buy stock of sugar, flour, rice, etc. With the anticipated profit from her expanded business, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to own the biggest retail shop in Gilgil market.

loans.use: To buy stock of sugar, flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses,  et enfants dans le quartier  TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 4eme prêt. Les 3 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de SARAN qui est la 2éme femme   dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 200Kg de  céréales avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of four women, all married, who average 42 years of age and six children each. The women live in traditional families with their husbands, co-wives, and children in the TORAKABOUGOU district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity for running their businesses better, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where they are now on their fourth loan. The three previous loans were correctly paid back. 

This group of women does commerce in grains, as does SARAN, who is the second woman from the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 200 kg of grains from Bougouni wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail to a customer base composed essentially of women at the market and out of her home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her work and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel se dedica a la fabricación y venta de escobas, está  casado con la Sra. Clemencia, tiene hijos con ella, que aun van a la escuela, y por quienes esta pareja está luchando para poder ayudarlos a ser personas de bien.
Él se dedica hace 20 años a este trabajo, el cual aprendió de sus padres, y hoy con ello ayuda a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Él es una persona muy trabajadora y que lucha por salir adelante y seguir mejorando.  Solicita este crédito para la compra materia prima ya que tiene una buena oferta y no abastece con lo que tiene, y quiere comprar pajas, palos y alambres para seguir haciendo sus escobas.
texts.en:
Miguel makes and sells brooms. He is married to Clemencia and has children who go to school. They struggle to help their children become good people. He has done this work for the past twenty years. He learned it from his parents and today it helps his family, giving it what they need to live day by day. 

Miguel is a hard-working person who struggles to get ahead and continue improving. He is requesting this loan to buy raw materials as he has a good offer and not enough material to fill it. He wants to buy handles, straw and wire to continue making brooms.

loans.use: to buy handles, straw, wire etc to make brooms.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a married woman with two children. She is very hard working, 38 years old and has both of her children enrolled in school. Sarah earns a living by running a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 6,000 from NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall. Sarah has been in this business for 13 years, and her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old, and a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Virginia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Virginia has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling cashew nuts in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Marites is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of cashew nuts to sell in her cashew nut business.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 69 years old and married with seven children. Estelita works very hard to provide for them.

Estelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Estelita has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, sardines, seasonings and other groceries. 

In the future Estelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Diako Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DIAKO est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles nucléaires dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO CENTRE de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles adhérent à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1ér prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  de fruits tels les pommes à l’image de KOROTOUMOU qui est la femme  assise au milieu dans la photo. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 cartons de pommes avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group DIAKO is composed of six women, all married, who average 32 years of age and four children each. The women live in nuclear families in the HEREMAKONO CENTRE district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity for running better businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where they are now on their first loan. 

This group of women does commerce in fruit, such as apples, as does KOROTOUMOU, who is the woman sitting in the middle in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 2 boxes of apples from Bougouni wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base at the market and out of her home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her work and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase apples

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: As the married parent of two children, Marivic works hard to support her family. She earns a living by buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income by buying and selling charcoal. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 from NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. Marivic has sustained her business activities through 12 prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 50 years old and married with two children.

Lourdes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Lourdes has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years.

Lourdes aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Lucinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lucinda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Lucinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Norhanena

texts.en:
Norhanena is 55 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming coconuts in the Philippines. Norhanena is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norhanena has been farming coconuts for 20 years and also earns additional income from raising cattle and a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now is requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Roselita

texts.en:
Roselita is 45 years old and single. Roselita works very hard to provide for herself.

Roselita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Roselita has been in this business for fourteen years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Roselita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel works hard to support her family. Razel is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Razel is borrowing PHP 4,600 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Razel is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa is 51 years old, married and has four children. 

Ma. Luisa is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Ma. Luisa requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more livestock to raise.

Ma. Luisa has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Luisa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling ready-to-wear items in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for PHP 30,000 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell. Ruth has been in this business for 10 years, and supplements her income by raising pigs and farming coconuts. She has sustained her business through hard work and loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Émilienne est une femme de 51 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle possède et gère une boutique de vente de boissons hygiéniques et produits alimentaires dans un quartier de la ville depuis 4 ans. afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter ses ventes, elle sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock de marchandises en achetant 30 casiers de bières et des produits alimentaires pour 150 000 francs. les bénéfices générés vont être réinjectés dans son activité et subviendront également aux besoins de sa modeste famille
texts.en: Émilienne is a 51-year-old woman who is a married mother of five. She owns and has been running a shop selling bottled beverages and grocery items in a district in the city for four years. To satisfy her customers and to increase her sales, she is requesting this loan to bolster her stock of merchandise by purchasing 30 cases of beer and other supplies for 150,000 francs. The profits generated are going to be reinvested in her business and to meet the needs of her modest family as well.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her pub

loans.name: Bermet

texts.en:
Bermet is a freshman in the Economics Program. Here is her story:
Choosing a future job is a very important step in our lives. That's why choosing a good university is one of the most crucial steps. My dream is to become a good specialist in economics and I believe that American University of Central Asia will help me to become a well-rounded, educated, and socially conscious person.

I want to study at AUCA because it is the first university in Central Asia to offer US accredited degrees in liberal arts through a partnership with Bard College in the United States. In addition, AUCA is one of the most popular universities among students in Kyrgyzstan for both education and social life.
AUCA teachers also have more experience. The teachers in this university are from foreign countries with good education and are highly qualified. They teach with modern techniques that allow students to compete for good jobs around the world. 

Finally, AUCA has no corruption. As I know, in almost every university of Kyrgyzstan corruption exists. But at AUCA students have to study and do their own work.

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Hermenia

texts.en: A loan of $1000.00 is offered to Hermenia to improve her business. She is married and she has a kiosk where many people come to buy food every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as  flour, sugar and kerosene. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2010. She feels very comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Hermenia independent because she can be responsible for herself as well as also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to by flour, sugar and kerosene

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah has a food stall, which she has been running for seven years now. She is 35 years old and married, and together with her spouse, she has been blessed with two children. Her spouse also produces additional income. Right now her monthly income is 15,000 Kenyan shillings.

She plans to use this loan to buy foodstuffs for use in her business. These include cooking pans, maize, beans, green grams and flour. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya, and her future hope is to have her own premises.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Alae

texts.en:
Alae is a well-known barber from Iraq. He is a youth client of 26 who is married, and has a single child.

Alae has been in this business since 2009, and has great experience in this field. He uses modern cutting methods to enhance his performance in this field. He has an excellent reputation in his neighborhood, and has earned the respect of many.
