Alae is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his barber shop and to buy a hair-cutting chair. 

He is aiming to grow more in this field, and increase his profits so he may provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop and to buy a hair-cutting chair

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz, a sus 30 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos de 11,9 y 4 años y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su ex esposo, quedando con toda la carga económica ella sola.
De desempeña como estilista desde hace muchos años, prestando sus servicios a domicilio y trabajando por días en diferentes salas de belleza, en las que debe compartir las ganancias que obtiene con el propietario del establecimiento, disminuyendo su margen de utilidad. Es por ello que se motiva a solicitar el crédito con el ánimo de montar su propio salón de belleza, que ubicará en un espacio de su casa, con el fin de trabajar y al mismo tiempo cuidar de sus hijos; el dinero será invertido en la compra de un lavacabezas, un módulo de trabajo, espejos, secadores, planchas para el cabello, pagar la instalación y la decoración del espacio; así podrá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera mejorar la economía familiar.
De esta forma, Beatriz estaría cumpliendo uno de sus principales sueños, pero es consciente que el desafío más grande es posicionar su negocio y darse a conocer en el sector, logrando atraer nuevos clientes y fidelizando los que ya tiene con la prestación de un servicio de calidad; así estará en la capacidad de brindar a sus hijos un mejor bienestar, educación y calidad de vida, además pasará más tiempo con ellos.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 30 years old. She is the mother of three children, aged 11, 9 and 4. She has been the main breadwinner since she separated from her ex-husband, and she bears all of the financial responsibility alone.

She has worked as a stylist for several years, offering her services at -home and working different days in different beauty salons, where she must share her earnings with the proprietor. This decreases her profit margin. That is why she is motivated to ask for a loan in order to open her own beauty salon which she will locate in a space in her own home, so she can work and care for her children at the same time. The money will be invested in buying a shampoo chair, a work station, mirrors, dryers, and hair straightener, as well as to decorate the space. This way, she will be able to start her productive project with which she hopes to improve her family's finances.

In this way, Beatriz will be making one of her main dreams come true. She is aware that the biggest challenge is to position the business and become known in the area, attracting new customers and earning the loyalty of the ones she has with quality service. She will be able to offer her children a better well being, education and quality of life. She will also spend more time with them.

loans.use: to buy a shampoo chair, a work station, mirrors, and hair straighteners, and to pay for the installation and decoration of the space.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a mixer, a work table, kitchen utensils and wholesale raw ingredients (flour, eggs, dairy products, baking powder, yeast and other items).

loans.name: Mario De Jesús

texts.es:
Mario tiene 58 años de edad, 16 de ellos dedicados a trabajar como mecánico automotriz de manera independiente. El oficio lo aprendió por herencia familiar y gracias a la trayectoria y a la experiencia que tiene cuenta con muy buena clientela fija, su taller está ubicado en la casa donde reside, pero además realiza el servicio a domicilio según las necesidades de los clientes, razón por la que no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el crédito para comprar un compresor de mayor capacidad y algunos repuestos e insumos al por mayor, esto le permitirá optimizar el tiempo de trabajo y mejorar la calidad del mismo, pues tendrá disponible todo lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, logrando aumentar sus servicios y por ende, los ingresos que recibe al realizar su labor.
Mario manifiesta que su edad no le impide seguir soñando y luchar para cumplir sus metas, pues tiene como propósito independizar el taller de su vivienda y generar oportunidades de empleo, así podrá disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida y tendrá la satisfacción de ver crecer su negocio.
texts.en: Mario is 58 and has been working as an independent auto mechanic for 16 years.  He learned his trade from his family, and thanks to his background and experience he has a good, fixed clientele.  His workshop is located in his home but he also pays house calls when his customers need it so he doesn't have a fixed work schedule.  To strengthen his business, he requests a loan to buy a larger compressor and some parts and supplies in bulk.  This will allow him to optimize his time and improve the quality of his work, since he will have everything he needs available to meet his customers' needs.  He will be able increase the services he provides and ultimately the income he earns from his work.  Mario says that his age has not stopped him from dreaming and working to meet his goals.  He plans to separate his workshop from his home and generate opportunities for employment.  This way he can enjoy a higher quality of life and have the satisfaction of seeing his business grow.

loans.use: to buy a larger compressor and some parts and supplies in bulk

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es:
La  Sra.  Gladis tiene 50 años, es madre separada de dos hijas ya mayores, y que por medio de su trabajo y esfuerzo hoy ya son personas de bien.
Ella es comerciante muy conocida en la ciudad, tiene una mercería hace más de 20 años, vende todo tipo de ropas, y gracias a este trabajo pudo salir adelante con sus hijas y a la vez hacerle estudiar ya que se separó de su esposo cuando sus hijas eran pequeñas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y por sobre todo emprendedora.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de camisas, remeras, shorts, y otros que en esta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes, y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo y luchando por crecer.
texts.en:
Gladis, age 50, has two grown daughters.  She is separated, and, through her work and effort, her daughters are now good people.

She is a well-known merchant in the city.  She has had a haberdashery for over 20 years.  She sells all types of clothes.  Thanks to this work, she was able to get her daughters ahead and give them an education.  She separated from her husband when her daughters were little.  She is a very hard-working person.  Above all, she is enterprising.

She is requesting the loan to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and others for this season.  Her customers request these items a lot.  This way she will be able to continue with her work and continue struggling to grow.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell

loans.name: On

texts.en: On is 49 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish paste for more than five years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is employed in the agricultural department. He makes an income of $4 each day. All of her children are employed. They earn about $13 daily. To improve her business, On is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more fish paste to resell. By doing so, she would be able to generate more profit. In the future, she would like to purchase a piglet to breed and rebuild her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more fish paste to resell

loans.name: Kanou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    KANOU est constitué de 6 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de29 ans et3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 1er prêt.  Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  lait en poudre à l’image d’ASTAN qui est la 1ére femme  debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 50Kg de lait en poudre avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group KANOU is composed of six women, all married, who average 29 years of age and three children each. The women live in traditional extended families in the HEREMAKONO NORD district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity for running their businesses better, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where they are now on their first loan. 

This group of women does commerce in powdered milk, as does ASTAN, who is the first woman standing from the left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 50 kg of powdered milk from Bougouni wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base at the market and out of her home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her work and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase powdered milk

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    BENKADI est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le quartier  DIALANIKORO de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 6éme prêt. Les 5 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  charbon de bois à l’image de DADON qui est la 1ére femme  dans la photo fe la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 35 sacs de charbon de bois avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group BENKADI is composed of four women, all married, who average 30 years of age and three children each. The women live in traditional extended families in the DIALANIKORO district of Bougouni City. They know one another through ties of community, friendship, and commerce. To bolster their financial capacity for running their businesses better, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, where they are now on their sixth loan. The five previous ones were correctly paid back. 

This group of women does commerce in charcoal, as does DADON, who is the first woman from the right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to purchase 35 sacks of charcoal from Bougouni wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales retail to a mixed customer base at the market and out of her home.

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be invested in her work and used to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Luis Meliton

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, por la gran cantidad de este fruto que había en aquella época, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Jesús De Nazaret. 
En este lugar conocimos al señor Luis, tiene 62 años de edad, está divorciado y de esa relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas vive con él.
Don Luis es mecánico electricista y tiene un pequeño almacén en su casa en el cual se dedica a vender todo tipo de materiales eléctricos,  a pesar de que su negocio es pequeño su clientela puede encontrar todo lo que necesitan razón por lo cual su clientela es muy buena y prefieren comprar en su local, el lleva más de 40 años con este negocio el cual le permitió sacar adelante a sus hijos y que estos hoy en día sean personas de bien.
 Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más materiales electicos y surtir el negocio con lo que le hace falta. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 3 ciclos  y le gusta la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The members of the “Jesus of Nazareth" Credit Group gather every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabi -- known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds for the great quantity of this fruit that existed in past epochs. 

Here in this location we meet Luis, who is 62 years old, divorced, and from that former relationship they have 3 adult children. One of his daughters still lives with him.

Luis is an electrical repairman and in his house he has a small store in which he sells all types of electrical supplies. Despite the small size of his business, his customers can find everything they need and, for that reason, his clientele is very good and prefer to buy from his shop. Luis has had this business for more than 40 years, and it has permitted him to advance his children and make of them respected people today.
 
This loan will be used to purchase electrical supplies to restock his business with what he currently lacks. Luis has been in his Credit Group through 3 loan cycles and he especially likes it for the help offered by these loans.

His dreams are to continue in good health.

loans.use: to buy electrical supplies to restock his small store.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina runs a pottery business from her place in Talibon, Bohol. She works hard to support her husband, especially in dealing with their pot-making business. Marcelina has been in the business for almost 20 years.

Marcelina wants to improve her business. She is asking for a loan to buy materials such as clay to make pots. With this assistance, she hopes to be able to improve her business, thus augmenting her income.

loans.use: to buy materials such as clay to make pots

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is 42 years old and has three children. Celia is married and has two children who are in school. Celia is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Celia has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Celia has been doing this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Celia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Eden

texts.en: Eden is 31 years old and married with three children, one of whom in school. Eden works very hard to provide for them. Eden runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods etc to sell. Eden has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like softdrinks, biscuits, canned goods etc to sell

loans.name: Vanielyn

texts.en:
Vanielyn is 21 years old and married with one kid. Vanielyn works very hard to provide for them.

Vanielyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Vanielyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future Vanielyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en: As a married mother of two children, Estrelita works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Estrelita is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF in order to buy additional blouses to offer for sale. Estrelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional blouses to offer for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 39 years old and married with five children.

Agnes works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Agnes has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Agnes aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar and canned goods to sell.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en:
Generosa is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Generosa is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Generosa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita works hard to support three children. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Pacita requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light-source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Pacita is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ronnie

texts.en:
Ronnie works hard to support his family. Ronnie is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ronnie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Ronnie has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Ronnie would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en: Carmelina is 49 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Carmelina is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Carmelina has been running her pig fattening business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store and food vending business. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Shirley works hard to support her family.

She has a butcher shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Shirley is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional pork, beef and chicken to sell in her butcher shop business.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional pork, beef and chicken to sell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 63 years old and married with four children.

Angelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Angelina has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from clothing sales.

Angelina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is 29 years old and married with two children.  With two children in school, Amalia works very hard to provide for them.

Amalia runs a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Amalia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future Amalia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell.

loans.name: Sanjar

texts.en:
Sanjar is a freshman in the Economics Program. This is his story:
Economics is one of the strongest programs at AUCA, and I sincerely want to study economic principles from around the world, and use them to help the economy in Kyrgyzstan grow. American University of Central Asia is a good place to do this, because students get to learn not only about economics, but also a variety of different subjects that help us to know all different parts of the world.

In high school I had the opportunity to take some subjects with teachers from the United States and other countries. I was always very impressed with their level of knowledge, and the things they taught us were very interesting. One of my teachers was Mr. Lustig, who also teaches at AUCA. He taught economics at our school, and I after I completed the course I decided that economics should be my profession.

I hope that I will be a good international economist, and that I will be able to make a contribution to the field of study. I am happy to be studying at AUCA, and I want to thank the university for giving me financial aid and such an opportunity to get the best education.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: A $600.00 loan is being offered to Joana to improve her business. Joana opened her food stall in 2010 with her own working capital $ 150.00. She will use this loan to buy chicken, beef, pork and yellow rice. Joana is generating a good income from selling food. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. Joana is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, pork and yellow rice

loans.name: Biobida

texts.en:
Biobida is 45 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to progress in life. Her husband is a builder, and they have four children. They live in the house he has succeeded in building, thanks to his great dedication.

She is going to start a new business in animal husbandry because she needs money. She will feed the cattle at her house. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy cattle to start a new business. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 68-year-old single mother and she is supporting two children.

Gladys has a green grocer business, in the Naivasha Gilgil area, that she has been running for the past five years. She repaid her previous loan on time, and has applied for a second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her buy additional stock of tomatoes, potatoes and bananas.  With anticipated profit from expanded business, she plans to pay school fees.

In the near future, she hopes to expand her business and also educate her children.

loans.use: To buy stock of tomatoes, potatoes and bananas.

loans.name: Antik

texts.en:
Antik lives in Uyts village of Syunik region. She lives with her husband, who is 62 years old and has a retirement pension. 

This hard-working couple has been involved in agriculture for 20 years. Over these years of hard and tireless work, they were able to run their farm in a sustainable way. The livestock that they currently own includes 18 cows, oxen, chickens, turkeys, and beehives. Antik also cultivates wheat, emmer wheat, and potatoes. Antik milks the cows and gathers milk sells to local resellers; and the other part is used in the production of cheese and other milk products. Antik and her husband work very hard to have a good income and sustain their living. 

By applying for this loan, Antik asks for financial support to purchase an ox, a pig, and forage for feeding the livestcok. This will greatly help her to enlarge the farm.

Antik has taken a loan from local financial institution before, but because of hard financial conditions wasn't able to pay it back on time. However, Antik and her husband were able to become financially stable due to their farm. Ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments of a new loan, Antik has now applied for this loan. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

This loan is very important for Antik and her husband, and they both wait for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for an ox, a pig, and forage for feeding the livestcok

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz es madre soltera de un hijo, por quien lucha incansablemente para brindarle educación y sustento.
Lleva más de 25 años trabajando como confeccionista independiente, prestando sus servicios a terceros, el negocio lo inició con algunos ahorros que tenía luego de haber trabajado como operaria en diferentes empresas de la ciudad, en las que obtuvo experiencia y conocimientos que hoy en día sigue aplicando en su labor diaria, cuenta con el apoyo de dos empleadas y trabajan todos los días de 8 am a 5 pm.
El mayor propósito de Beatriz, es ampliar su taller y poder generar más oportunidades de empleo, por ello sigue trabajando arduamente para fortalecer y acreditar bien su negocio y, encuentra en el crédito un apoyo para capitalizarlo, pues con el dinero comprará insumos al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, cierres, entre otros) y realizará mantenimiento a sus máquinas, especialmente a una plana que está dañada; esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de insumos para terminar la producción y además podrá optimizar el tiempo de trabajo, logrando así un incremento en sus ventas y en los ingresos que percibe con su labor, con los que puede ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Beatriz is the single mother of one son who she constantly struggles to educate and feed. She has been working as an independent seamstress for 25 years, working for third parties. She started her business with savings she accumulated working as an operator in various companies in the city. She gained the experience and knowledge that today she uses in her daily labor. She has two employees and works every day from 8 am until 5 pm. 

Beatriz's plan is to expand her shop and be able to generate more employment opportunities. So she continues to work hard to strengthen and position her business. She finds the loans useful as an aid for capitalization. She will buy supplies wholesale (fabric, thread, zippers, etc.) and do maintenance on her machines, especially one flat bed machine that is damaged. This will allow her to have supplies ready to be finished and she can minimize her production times. Which would increase her sales and the income she receives from her labor. She could then offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (fabric, thread, zippers, etc. ) and to do maintenance on her machines.

loans.name: Carlos Augusto

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 47 años de edad y es padre de 2 hijos de 9 y 6 años, por quienes lucha día a día para sacarlos adelante.
Actualmente tiene un taller de confección en el que presta el servicio de ensamble de morrales y bolsos, además realiza arreglos de prendas de vestir. El oficio lo aprendió por medio de la observación, pues se involucró en este campo cuando trabajó como empleado en un taller en el que revisaba las prendas terminadas, allí veía a las operarias realizando la labor y poco a poco pudo aprender.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de una máquina plana, con ella podrá mejorar la calidad de los acabados en el producto y podrá incrementar la producción, dando como resultado un incremento notable en sus ventas.
Carlos manifiesta que la motivación para seguir trabajando la encuentra en el amor que siente por sus hijos, es por ellos que lucha para poder cumplir el sueño de tener su línea propia de morrales, maletines y bolsos, que puedan ser comercializados y así generar mejores ingresos para dar sustento a sus hijos y una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 47 years old, has 2 children aged 9 and 6 and he works hard every day to help them get on in life. He currently has a sewing workshop where he makes satchels and bags. He also carries out clothing alterations. He learnt the trade through observation, since he worked in this field when he worked as an employee in a workshop where he checked the finished garments. There he watched the operatives at their work and gradually he was able to learn.

The loan requested will be used to buy a flat sewing machine, which will enable him to improve the quality of the finish on his products and increase his production. As a result this will give him a significant increase in his sales.

Carlos says that the love he has for his children is what motivates him to continue working. They are the reason why he is striving towards fulfilling his dream of having his own line of satchels, briefcases and bags, which he will be able to sell, thus generating a better income to support his children and give them a quality education.

loans.use: to buy a flat sewing machine.

loans.name: Mano Group

texts.en:
Mano Group is a four-member group from Hodeida, Yemen. All the members are women. They have requested a group loan of YER 120,000. 

Suad is 32 years old. She knows how to read and write. She decided to help her husband, who works very hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothes. She has been selling perfumes, incense, and other materials. 

Suad intends to expand her business, to increase her profits. Therefore, she has asked for a loan of YER 30,000 to buy perfumes and incense  for her business. She hopes that she can earn good profits by selling a lot of products to new clients in different parts of her city. She thanks Kiva lenders for providing her loan.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfumes to resell.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saul continua dedicándose a brindar servicio de reparación de automóviles y motocicletas, el tiene un taller donde repara y esta implementado básicamente con herramientas y maquinas, él desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como pistones, lubricantes, aceites y otras cosas más.  

Saul agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el apoyo brindado y desea seguir participando en este proyecto pues le ayudo a incrementar el capital del negocio.
texts.en:
Saul continues to provide automobile and motorcycle repair services. He has a repair shop and makes use of basic tools and machines.

Saul has been a member of the Communal Bank "Chacoq" for several years. He is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy work supplies such as pistons, lubricants, oils, and other items.

Saul appreciates the Kiva lenders for this loan and is pleased with the support that has been given. He wants to continue his business with the help of increased business capital.

loans.use: to buy pistons, lubricants, oils, and other items.

loans.name: Ann Grace

texts.en:
Ann Grace is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale  region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Ann Grace has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks and ground nuts. 

To help expand her business, Ann Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks such as soda, water, and milk to sell, and will help Ann Grace to generate greater profits and take care of her child and herself. 

Ann Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch of the same business. 

Ann Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, such as soda, water, and milk to sell

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en:
Micheal is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kajjansi in the region of Kampala west in Uganda. He is married and has six children; four of them are currently in school. For the past 8 years, Micheal has been working hard to manage his carpentry shop, which makes doors, beds, chairs, and tables. 

To help expand his business, Micheal has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more furniture for making more beds and chairs for sale, and will help Micheal to generate greater profits and bridge the financial gap in his business and also pay school fees for his children. 

Micheal hopes that in the future he will be able to provide better quality in his business. 

Micheal is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Micheal who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more furniture for making more beds and chairs for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a lady of seventy two years. She is married to Samson and a mother of two children. She is a dairy farmer in Limuru and has been in this business for thirteen years now. She gets a monthly income of sixty thousand shillings.

This will be Mary's sixth loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to buy a calf. She hopes to own more cattle in future.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Kipkorir

texts.en:
Kipkorir is a 46-year-old, married man and his spouse adds additional income to the total family income. They have four children aged 8, 12, 15 and 23 years old. It has been ten years since he started his agriculture business. The monthly income he gets is KES 30,000. 

He has asked for loan to purchase animal feed and to improve his farm. He will use his anticipated profits, to increase the livestock and improve the dairy facility. This is his fifth loan after he paid the previous loans successfully.

His hopes and dreams are to grow in his business and family in the future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and farm input.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es:
Alexis tiene 18 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha. Cada día Alexis trabaja en una pequeña pollería de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y apoyar con algunos gastos de su familia.

Alexis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para poder realizar mejoras en el cuarto donde habita y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia y estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Alexis is 18 years old and lives in the city of Chincha. He works each day at a small chicken shop in the city. This enables him to earn income so that he can move forward and contribute toward some of his family's expenses.

Alexis is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help they have provided, he will be able to buy construction materials for making improvements to the room that he occupies. This will improve his quality of life. Alexis continue to strive to fulfill his greatest wish of having a house of his own and studying for a university degree.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for improving a room.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 27 years old and a single man. He has been in the agriculture business for three years and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

This is his first loan with KADET LTD. He will be using this loan to purchase farm products including seeds and fertilizers as well as pay for labor.  His dream for the future of his business is to operate a large farm.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mercedes Concepción

texts.es:
En la parroquia Quiroga de la  ciudad de Calceta, localidad donde la gente se dedica en gran parte a la agricultura, cría de animales  y a la venta de sus productos, se reúne cada quince días  El Grupo De Crédito Quiroga.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 56  años de edad, está casada y  de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos mayores de edad, una de ellos es madre soltera y vive en su casa junto a su pequeña hija. Su esposo es chofer de taxi.
Doña Mercedes es un ama de casa que para ayudarle a su esposo y a su hija se dedica a la cría de animales, tiene una pequeña granja con pollos y chanchos, ella compra tanto los pollos como los chanchos cuando están pequeños los cría por tres a cuatro meses y cuando tengan un peso adecuado los vende a los comerciantes que los llevan a entregar en los diferentes mercados de la provincia, ella lleva más de 17 años dedicada a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su familia a salir adelante. 
Este crédito para comprar alimentos y medicinas tanto para los pollos como para los chanchos. Es socia del Grupo De Crédito hace más de 9 años y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son seguir adelante y gozar de buena salud.
texts.en:
In Quiroga parish of the city of Calceta, a place where a great number of the people make their living in agriculture, animal raising and the sale of their products, the Crédito Quiroga group meets every fifteen days.

Mercedes lives here, she is 56, she is married and from this relationship she has four children who are adults. One of them is a single mother and lives in her house with her small daughter. Mercedes' husband is a taxi driver.

Mercedes is a housewife who works in animal raising to help her husband and her daughter. She has a small farm with chickens and pigs. She bought both the chickens and the pigs when they were small. She raises them for three to four months and when they have an adequate weight, she sells them to the merchants who take them to sell in the different markets of the province. She has been working in this activity for more than 17 years, which helps her family get ahead. 

This loan is to buy feed and medicine for both the chickens and the pigs. She has been a member of the lending group for more than 9 years and she likes it for the help the loans provide. Her dreams are to get ahead and enjoy good health.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elisa is 57 years old and has three children who are in school.

Elisa has a furniture making business in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture.

Elisa has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her furniture

loans.name: Alnaida

texts.en:
Alnaida is 30 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Alnaida works very hard to provide for them.

Alnaida runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Alnaida would like to save money to expand her business and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.en:
Enriqueta is 57 years old and married with two children.

Enriqueta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, milk, sugar, egg, noodles, etc.

Enriqueta has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from buy and sell rice.

Enriqueta aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Elvira works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon and boardwalk products. Elvira is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock  to sell for her buy-and-sell frozen foods business. Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past 39 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like hotdog, longganisa, tocino etc for resale

loans.name: Lani

texts.en: Lani is a 50-years-old married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lani has a business selling tobacco in the Philippines. Lani has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of tobacco to sell. Lani has been in this business for ten years now. In the future, Lani would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma is 49 years old and has four children who are in school. Emma has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines. Emma has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell. Emma has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 51 years old and married with five children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Melinda has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from selling rice. Melinda aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito is 57 years old and married with five children. Charito works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries etc to sell in her sari-sari store. Charito has borrowed and repaid 13 previous loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for ten years now, and also earns an income from E-load (prepaid mobile load). Charito aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries etc to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Analyn is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Analyn has been farming sugarcane for three years and also earns additional income from a general store and motorcycle transport services.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 24 years.

Carmelita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients, like sugar, milk, eggs, etcetera.

In the future, Carmelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, like sugar, milk, and eggs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 51 years old, married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Evelyn has a food stall business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more snack foods to sell.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Alosious

texts.en:
Alosious is a permanent resident of Rwabumburi village. He is aged 40 years, and is married with six children. All his children go to school. 

His business is cattle fattening and trade. He has been in this business for eight years and has created a large market for his business.

He applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to help him buy farmland to provide more feeding grounds for his cattle. His challenge is the dry season, which dries up all the grass and water, hence leaving his cattle helpless. He intends to use a balance of the money to construct a dam for storing water for his cattle during the dry season.

Despite these challenges, Alosious is a very hardworking and determined man ready to succeed in his business.

loans.use: to buy farmland.

loans.name: Ahmed Yusuf

texts.en: Ahmed Yusuf is a 23 years old. He studies at Alpha University College in the faculty of Public Health. His problem is the lack of a laptop to watch video tutorials and read medical lessons when given in soft copy. Being without a laptop is his major problem because he needs one to prepare his assignments, download books and to make class presentations. He requested a laptop from Kaaba Microfinance Institution. Now he is on the waiting list and Kaaba will provide him the laptop as a loan.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: A 600 USD loan is offered to Sabina to improve her business. She is married and she opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $300. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like water, oil, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, bread, fish and body lotion. She generates a good income from selling and she has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in this business. Sabina lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy water, oil, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, bread, fish and body lotion.

loans.name: Adilet

texts.en:
Adilet is a freshman in the International and Business Law Program. This is his story: 

"I decided to apply to the International and Business Law Program because I always felt that I want to help other people learn their rights, and because it is a respected profession in our country. I think it is vital to know our rights because it can assist in the fight against injustice and lawlessness. Unfortunately, Kyrgyzstan is very corrupt and lacks order. It does have laws, but they work ineffectively and a lot of officials in government change and use the law for their own personal purposes. All of these problems have slowly led Kyrgyzstan into total chaos. I am concerned with such troubles, and thus I want to try to change it for the better. It may sound ridiculous, but I really want to influence politics. To achieve my goal I need to become a lawyer to understand the basics of law creation. 

I want Kyrgyzstan to prosper and I want to try to stop or at least decrease the level of corruption and lawlessness. If we will not struggle for law and rights, we will end up like Afghanistan or Somalia because the chaos will lead to the destruction of education, economics, government, and finally the country. Kyrgyzstan suffered from two revolutions, and the reason for both of them was that no one, including the leaders, obeyed the law. 

That's why I want to study at the International and Business Law Program: to protect my own rights and to help other people to protect theirs. The knowledge of law is one of the keys of survival in our tough world. I also hope that I can use this knowledge to help Kyrgyzstan. Probably it is going to be of little help, but I'll be glad to know that I am doing the right thing."

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Blanca Nidia

texts.es:
Blanca de 46 años de edad, sin hijos es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente  por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. 

Gracias a su esfuerzo  y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulperia es una pequena tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequenas como arroz, frijoles, azucar, aceite,jugos, gaseosas,huevos, detergeente. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10  horas diarias ofreciendo su producto en su casa de habitacion con un bulto de unos 20 kg, actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto ya que es su forma de vida. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Blanca agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Blanca is 46 years old, has no children, and is from Sauce, an area located in the northern part of the country.  She is known for being hardworking, responsible, and with a desire for personal success.

Unfortunately she was not able to study for a career due to lack of resources and she had to go to work at an early age.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead, she has a small grocery store where she sells foodstuffs, such as rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, juices, soft drinks, eggs, and detergents.  She works 10 hours a day out of her home, with a 20 kg bundle, which she does with lots of enjoyment, since this is how she earns a living.  She will use the money from this loan to stock her store with foodstuff so that she can have a better income in the near future.  Blanca is grateful to the Kiva lenders who provide persons of limited resources in poor countries such as Nicaragua with a dignified source of work.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly is married with eight children, and three of them are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grand children). She has a business making brushes and has been in this business for five years.  She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more raw materials for making brushes.  She generates additional income from part-time teaching. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a wholesale basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and increasing prices of raw materials. She aspires to own a big factory for making brushes and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making brushes.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is married with four children and three of her children go to school.  She also takes care of one additional family member (a grandchild).  She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works at the market six days each week and sells on a retail basis.  Her major business challenge includes seasonality and thieves.  She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start going to villages to sell charcoal.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expense includes school fees, paying for utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more  bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret runs a retail shop in Nairobi's Thika Road area and has been in the business for the past three years. She is 32 years old, married, and together with her spouse they have been blessed with two children. Her spouse also produces additional income.

She plans to use this loan to buy more stock of goods for resale. These include sugar, maize and wheat flour, cooking oil and bar soaps. She will use the anticipated income to expand her business as well as repay the loan.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to own a wholesale shop and buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize and wheat flour, and other goods.

loans.name: Christian Andrés

texts.es:
Christian es un joven emprendedor que no se deja vencer por las adversidades que se le presentan. Debido a la dificultad para vincularse laboralmente, decidió emprender su propio negocio de comidas, el cual ubicó en un pequeño local que una amigo le facilitó, trabaja solo y ofrece carnes, chorizos y otros productos asados, para el montaje del negocio recibió asesoría de su madre y cuenta con la ventaja de no poseer competencia cercana.
Su espíritu de superación, dinamismo y empuje le han permitido salir adelante y desde hace un año ha generado ingresos que le permiten aportar a la economía familiar.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una freidora, utensilios de cocina que le hacen falta y abastecerse de insumos al por mayor (carnes, chorizos, arepas, papas, salsas, gaseosas, entre otros), esto le permitirá aumentar la oferta de productos y estará en la capacidad de atender grandes pedidos que le realizan por temporadas, además podrá satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus clientes, mejorando notablemente las ventas y el margen de utilidades que percibe.
Christian tiene como proyecto obtener capacitación en cocina, pues su mayor anhelo es fortalecer su negocio con nuevos platos para ofrecer, dándose a conocer por la calidad y el excelente sabor de sus productos y, por el servicio que ofrece, así mejorará las condiciones de vida y el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Christian is an enterprising young man who does not allow himself to be beaten by difficult circumstances. Following difficulties in finding a job, he decided to start his own business selling food, which he runs out of a small building which his friend helped him to find. Christian works alone, selling meats, chorizo and other roasted foods. In order to set up his business, Christian's mother helped him with advice and Christian has the advantage of there not being much competition nearby. Christian's dynamism, his desire to be better, and his drive have allowed him to get ahead. He has been earning sufficient income to support the family economy for a year now.

This loan will be used to buy a fryer, kitchen utensils that he needs, and to buy supplies (such as meat, chorizo, "arepas" , potatoes, sauces and fizzy drinks) in bulk. These items will allow Christian to offer more products and he will be able to fulfil any large orders. He will also be able to satisfy his customers' different tastes, improving his sales and his profit margin.

In the future Christian wants to do training as a cook. His biggest desire is to strengthen his business offering new dishes and becoming known for the quality and excellent flavours in his dishes. He also wants to be known for his excellent service and then he can improve his living conditions and look after his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy a fryer, kitchen utensils that he needs, and to buy supplies (such as meat, chorizo, "arepas", potatoes, sauces and fizzy drinks) in bulk.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta lives in Shaghat village in the Syuniq region. She is a farmer with 20 years of experience running a farm.

Mareta lives with her two children and her husband, who is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. Mareta has been involved in agriculture for 20 years already. The farm that she runs is very big. It includes cows, calves, 13 sheep, pig, piglets and 20 colonies of bees. Near the village where they live, Mareta also owns arable land where she cultivates barley, emmer wheat, potato and grass. Her elder son helps his mother to take the gathered harvest to an open market and sell it. It is very difficult for Mareta to run such a big farm, but, due to her hard work over these years, Mareta was able to run it in sustainable way, ensuring monthly income for her family. 

She has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase 3 more calves and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Mareta's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.
The loan will greatly assist Mareta to enlarge her farm and provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to pay for 3 calves and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Marta Elcy

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer pujante y activa; se dedicaba a prestar el servicio de atención de banquetes por contrato, labor que realizó durante 10 años; el oficio lo aprendió en cursos de capacitación que realizó y poco a poco fue adquiriendo la experiencia y perfeccionando sus técnicas; sin embargo, desde que tuvo que afrontar la separación de su ex esposo, dejó de realizar la actividad.
Hoy en día, a sus 55 años de edad, desea reiniciar su labor, con el fin de generar ingresos para solventar los gastos del hogar, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará manteles, artículos de decoración, algunos utensilios de cocina y los insumos que requiere para elaborar los alimentos; esto le permitirá dar inicio nuevamente a su proyecto productivo con el que desea generar ingresos tanto para solventar los gastos del hogar, como para seguir reinvirtiendo en su negocio, ya que para un futuro a mediano plazo, desea adquirir un local en el que puede ofrecer su servicio completo, logrando una mayor rentabilidad del negocio y un mejor posicionamiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
Marta is a strong and active women. She is a caterer, whose services people have been hiring for ten years. Marta learned to run this business at training courses and, little by little, she has gained experience and perfect her skills. Since separating from her husband, however, Marta stopped this work.

Now, at 55 years old, Marta wants to start up the business in order to earn an income to cover household costs. In order to start the business Marta is applying for a loan in order to buy tablecloths, decorative items, cooking utensils and supplies for preparing food. This will allow Marta to start up her business and earn a living to pay her household costs and to continue reinvesting in her business. In the medium-term, Marta wants to buy or rent premises where she can offer her service, have a more profitable business and be better established in the market.

loans.use: to buy tablecloths, decorative items, cooking utensils and supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her work equipments and to buy stock (meat, "arepas", fizzy drinks, sauces and more) in bulk.

loans.name: Joaquin Mauricio

texts.es:
Joaquin es un hombre pujante y trabajador de 38 años de edad, dueño de una tienda de abarrotes que se encuentra ubicada en la vía de acceso al barrio donde reside, por lo que diariamente se ve gran flujo de personas y le beneficia las ventas en el negocio, además no posee competencia cercana, lo que garantiza una entrada de recursos permanente, por más mínima que sea.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor (arroz, aceite, lácteos, gaseosas, cerveza, entre otros), esto le permitirá abastecer su inventario con más variedad de artículos para ofrecer, así podrá satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes y mejorará notablemente las ventas e ingresos.
Joaquin manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, conformada por su esposa y sus 3 hijos, y lograr que su negocio tenga una permanencia en el tiempo, generando recursos que le garanticen una estabilidad económica favorable para dar mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Joaquin, 38, is driven and hard-working and is the owner of a grocery shop. This is situated on the access road of the area where he lives, so there is a large number of people passing every day and this benefits his business sales. He also has no competition nearby, which guarantees him a permanent source of income, however small it may be.

Joaquin will use the requested loan to buy stock wholesale (rice, oil, dairy products, fizzy drinks, beer and other items). This will enable him to stock his shop with a wider range of products and so satisfy the tastes and requirements of his customers. This will significantly improve his sales and income.

Joaquin says his main wish is to be able to improve his family's quality of life (he has a wife and 3 children) and to establish his business in the long term. This will provide an income which will give him financial stability so he can give his children a better education.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (rice, oil, dairy products, fizzy drinks, beer and other items).

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María es una campesina de 56 años de edad, madre de un hijo y cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo.
Desde que era pequeña aprendió todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y, hoy en día le ha permitido generar ingresos para su familia, pues se dedica a la cría y comercialización de cerdos y pollos, además tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes con la que complementa los ingresos.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de lechones y adecuación de las cocheras, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y mejorar las condiciones de mantenimiento para los animales, logrando mejorar las ventas y el margen de utilidades que percibe.
María manifiesta que su propósito es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y fortalecer sus negocios para dejar un buen legado el día que Dios disponga de su vida.
texts.en:
María is a 56 year old farmer. She is a single mother and the head of the family since she has been separated from her husband. Since she was young she has learned about working the fields, thanks to the teaching given her by her father.Today this allows her to generate income for her family. She raises and sells pigs and chickens. She also has a small grocery store which compliments her income. 

María will use the loan to buy pigs and modify the pig styes. This will allow her to increase her production and improve the living conditions of the animals. Her sales will increase and so will the profits she can realize. María says that her aim is to improve the quality of living of her family and to strengthen her business, leaving a good estate for the day that God calls her to his side.

loans.use: to buy pigs and modify her pig styes.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy used her previous loan to buy cosmetics in bulk to boost her business. She was even able to get the trust of local suppliers with her increased stock, which saved her transport costs and also cash payments. This has in turn increased her profits. 

She will use this loan of 2,000,000 to purchase more stock for her business so as to earn more income.

Prossy’s major customers are ladies, manicure providers. However, she faces a challenge of inadequate capital, competition, and sometimes, climatic conditions.

Prossy has the possibility and capacity of working if she gets enough capital because she is such a hard-working lady.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Vwawa Group

texts.en:
Waeli, who is married with a daughter who is in school, has been running a restaurant selling breakfast,lunch and sometime dinner foods. Waeli is aged early 30s and has been in her business for four years now. She starts working from 6:00am to 5:00pm per working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to buy other food-cooking supplies and replaced a few cooking items like saucepans and pots. She has paid back all her previous loans successfully. Waeli's profit used to finish building her house and reinvested back into business; she is thankful for the deduction of interest. She will use this loan to buy new business chairs and other working equipment. Waeli dreams to own a hotel. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Vwawa," which totals five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new business chairs and other working equipment.

loans.name: Yowasi

texts.en:
Yowasi is 35 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the region of Jinja, Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Yowasi has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, soap, soda water, and other items. 

To help expand his business, Yowasi has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to expand his inventory and purchase more salt, soap, and sugar. It will help Yowasi to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Yowasi hopes that in the future he will be able to set up a wholesale business.

Yowasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yowasi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: expand his inventory and purchase more salt, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is a married woman and a mother of five children from Talibon, Bohol. She is engaged in a tailoring business. She has been doing tailoring for almost five years now. She accepts dressmaking and dress adjustments. Celsa is asking for a loan to buy cloth and various sewing materials such as needles, thread and others. With this, she will be able to sew more as well as accept more repairs and orders. In the future, Celsa hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy cloth and various sewing materials such as needles, thread and others

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary  is married and has  three children. All of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business, frying edibles like samosa, cassava, donuts and chapatti. She has been in this business for five years and works at her shop seven days out of every week. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan  to buy more tomatoes, green bananas, sweet potatoes, cow peas, and cassava. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing prices of foods and seasonality. She aspires to buy a van to transport food from villages to the market, and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy a sack of cassava, and more tomatoes, green bananas, sweet potatoes, and cow peas

loans.name: Vibian

texts.en:
Vibian is doing well in her milk sale business.  As a result of the loan advanced to her, her income has increased by a big margin from KES 10,000 to KES 20,000. She currently supports four people in her family.


She has borrowed KES 60,000, being her second loan. She intends to use the whole amount of money to buy milk and vegetables to sell.

She anticipate of getting profits of which she will use some to expand her business and save some for future use.

loans.use: to purchase milk and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is 40 years old and married, and he supports six members of his family. 

He runs a motorcycle transport business in Kapsabet town.  He has been in this business for the last ten years.  He gets an average monthly income of KES 27,000. 

He plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 20,000 to pay for the service charges for the repair of his motorcycle. He will use the profits from the business to expand his business and provide for his family.

loans.use: To pay for service charges for his motorcycle to be repaired.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 28-year-old single lady blessed with a four year old son. She sells secondhand clothing in Kapsabet Town. This has been her income-generating business for the last two years she gets an average monthly income of KES 15,000. 


She plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 40,000 to buy more clothes for resale. She will use the profits from the business to purchase a piece of land for her family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Hottensiah

texts.en:
Hottensiah is a 28 year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as an enterprising person. She operates a retail stall where she sells sandals.  She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are ladies.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of sandals. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to add stock of sandals. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to sustain her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: add stock of sandals

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 38 years old. He supports five adults and his spouse adds additional income. They are blessed with three children 13, 11, and 8 years old. He has been in business for 15 years and his monthly income is 60,000 Kenyan shillings. He is taking a loan to pay his rent and pay the workers digging and shaping the blocks. He will use the anticipated profits he gets from the business for farming.

loans.use: to pay rent and dig and shape blocks for sale

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 44-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a restaurant where he cooks food for selling. He has been involved in this business for three years. 

His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough furniture for his restaurant. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy tables and chairs for his restaurant. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be economically stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs for his restaurant

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 29 years old, single and supports two members of her family. She runs a boutique business in Kapsabet town. She has been in this business for the last three years, and from this business she gets a monthly income of KES 18,000. 

She has borrowed KES 73,000, which she will use to pay school fees for one of her dependants. She will use the anticipated profits to increase her business stock and make loan repayments. Her dream is to live a happy and prosperous life.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber for making furniture

loans.name: Zoila Gaby

texts.es:
Zoila Gaby tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su hija y madre en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad con clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura de frutas, café y arroz siendo los más resaltantes, comercio de los mismos y ganadería a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de bocaditos, helados, los cuales ella misma los prepara y los vende en las afuera del colegio de su distrito, es una madre emprendedora que se esfuerza para darle lo mejor a su familia, en su domicilio también se dedica a la venta de cerveza desde hace tres años cuenta con clientela considerable.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para invertir en la compra de cerveza en mayor cantidad para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Zoila Gaby is 27 years old. She lives with her daughter and her mother in the District of Pucará, a community with a warm climate. Its people engage in the cultivation of fruit, coffee, and rice since these crops have the most outstanding results. They also sell these crops and raise livestock. This community is located two hours away from the city of Jaén, which is in the northern mountains of Peru.

Zoila sells snacks and ice cream that she prepares herself. She offers her products outside of a school in her district. Zoila is an enterprising mother who strives to provide the best for her family and her home. She has also been selling beer for three years to a considerable clientele.

Zoila is requesting a loan of 800 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of beer in bulk quantity that she can offer to her customers. This will enable her to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a bulk quantity of beer.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en: Kevin is a 35-year-old married man. He has two children aged three and eight years. He describes himself as an industrious person. He operates a farm where he keeps pigs for selling. He also operates a garbage collection business. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be nonpayment or irregular payment by customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to add a cart for garbage collection. His business goal is to have a fleet of garbage collection carts within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add a cart for garbage collection

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith works hard to support her family. Faith is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Faith has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar etc. Faith has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Faith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar etc

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Eden requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional ingredients, like vegetables, meat, and spices.

In the future Eden would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients, like vegetables, meat, and spices.

loans.name: Muzafaru

texts.en:
Muzafaru is a 20-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates a video library and a saloon in order to raise money to support his family. 

Inefficient electricity supply and a high cost of rent limit his business profits. His desire is to open up at least three outlets in different towns since the business is very lucrative. He would also like to install solar systems. 

Muzafaru intends to use the loan facility to buy speakers and a public address system to rent to his clients for different functions.

loans.use: to buy speakers and a public address system to rent to his clients for different functions.

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita is 46 years old and married with two children.

Helenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

Helenita has borrowed and repaid twenty loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Helenita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Meet Solomon is a farmer residing in Ndaragwa with his wife and two children. He has practiced farming for 10 years where he produces and sells milk, eggs, and vegetables. He loves farming as it is his main source of income and by it he is able to sustain his family, but he says that it is very expensive because of the costs of managing a farm.

Solomon chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they have good loan terms and low interest rates on repayment. Juhudi Kilimo also offers training to small scale farmers before giving out loans to them. This loan will help him purchase dairy goats for more milk production and thus increase his income. This will help him educate his children better, and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase dairy goats.

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Flordeliz works hard to support her family.

She has a coffee shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and food vending. Flordeliz is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase coffee, milk, sugar, etc. for her coffee shop business.

Flordeliz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, milk, sugar, etc. for her coffee shop

loans.name: Joycel

texts.en:
Joycel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Joycel has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from clothing sales.
