Joycel has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Jona is 51 years old and has three children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Jona is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nyota Group

texts.fr: La cliente Syauswa est une commerçante et membre de l’association d’affaires « Nyota », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des planches de constructions. Elle stocke sa marchandise dans un dépôt des périphéries de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son grand frère. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 18 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 200 planches. Ainsi, elle souhaite étendre son projet, acheter une parcelle et construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique poste conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Syauswa, is a merchant and a member of the business association "Nyota". She is an energetic entrepreneur, 38 years old, and a married mother of four children, all students. This client is a vendor of lumber. She stocks her merchandise at a suburban warehouse. She started her business with assistance from her older brother. Later on, she benefited from a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in this business for eighteen years. 

This new loan is going to be used to purchase 200 boards. Thus, she would like to expand her plans, buy a parcel of land, build a house, and provide education, food, and clothing for her children. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for promoting autonomy for unbanked women entrepreneurs, especially during this critical time of post-conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase 200 boards

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.fr:
Mme RASMATA représente le groupe SHALOM. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 40ans et le moins âgé a 34ans. 02 vont à l’école (université)  et elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des légumes depuis 40ans. Elle s’approvisionne à la cité AN II. Ses clients sont  ceux qui fréquentent le marché où elle vend.
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs  de légumes ( choux, persil, ail, tomates, etc.).
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne  aider à l’épanouissement des enfants.
texts.en: Ms. RASMATA represents the group SHALOM. She is a married mother of six children. The oldest is 40 years old, and the youngest is 34. Two of them are in school (university). She has four persons to support. Ms. RASMATA has been selling vegetables for 40 years. She gets her supplies from the AN II settlement. Her customers are those who frequent the market where she sells her goods. She wants to purchase 2 sacks of vegetables (cabbage, parsley, garlic, tomatoes, etc.)  With her profits, she wants to provide for her children's education. Her ambition is to help her children to thrive.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables (cabbage, parsley, garlic, tomatoes, etc.)

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.

Emma requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more clothing to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines.

Felicitas requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of hotdogs, tocino, chorizo, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Felicitas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of hotdogs, tocino, chorizo, etc. to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a 42-year-old married woman with five children. Four of her children are in school, and she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Elsa has a dry goods business in the Philippines. She requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more dry goods to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items like soap and oil

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 48-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She requested a loan for her husband’s fruit shop. Her husband owns a fruit shop, and her son also is involved with his father's activities. Both of them equally participate in household expenses.

With the increase in the household expenses, he wants to increase sales as well, so that he could generate more profit. Yasmeen is the mother of five children. She wants to save the profit amount, so that she could arrange dowry for the marriage of her daughters. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for her family and that she will be able to save a reasonable amount soon.

Yasmeen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Note: Yasmeen is identifying herself in the photo, by hand-raising.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is applying for a loan of 1,000 USD from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 25 years old and she is a single. She runs a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko drinks, beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, water, body lotion and fish. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. 

Sonia is living in a town near by the school and her kiosk is located in strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko drinks, beer, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, water, body lotion and fish.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a 38-year-old client. She is widower looking after three children. She applied for a loan of UGX 2,000,000 to improve her business of stone quarrying. She has a challenge of little business turnover from her business of stone quarrying, so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to employ more workers so that she can triple her output. In the photo is the Ugafode credit officer and the client (right to left) at the house she built with profits from her business.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Fardous

texts.en: Fardous is living in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a new member of BRAC and is taking her first loan. She is taking a loan for her husband; in fact, her husband drives an auto rickshaw. He has been driving this auto rickshaw for many years with petrol, which is very costly nowadays. Due to an increase in the cost of petrol, he wants to convert his auto rickshaw over to LPG gas but his rickshaw does not have a CNG kit. Therefore, Fardous contacted with Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan amount, her husband will buy a CNG kit for his auto rickshaw, so that he can minimize fuel expenses and grow his income. Fardous seems very happy after taking this loan; she thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy CNG kit for an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 29 years old and married to Seth and with one child aged 3 years. She is a business woman who has been dealing in clothing sales since 2009 in Kagadi town where she resides.

She has approached Ugafode for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to buy cosmetics, jewellery, and clothes, since there will be a high demand during the festive season. Her main challenges are seasonality of demand which is always high only in the festive season and low in other times.

Her dream is to grow her business and start importing clothes from other countries like USA and United Arab Emirates so that she can make more profits. She describes herself as trustworthy and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy jewellery and clothes

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Paula, to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy, every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as water, coffee, sugar, salt, noodles, cigarettes, candles and Fanta. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2012, with her own working capital of $500. She feels so comfortable to run her business, because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Paula independent, because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy some additional supplies, such as coffee, noodles, candles and Fanta

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en: Muhabbat is a kind woman. She was born in 1967. She is married and has three children. Muhabbat has been busy with animal husbandry. She has been running this business for more than eight years. Muhabbat began her business with one cow. She developed her business little by little. She sells milk and kefir to her neighbors. Her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. He returned home some months ago and now he is going back to Russia but he doesn't have the money to buy an airline ticket. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy a ticket to Russia for her husband. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an airline ticket to Russia for her husband

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with three children, and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling chapatti.  She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, and a bag of charcoal. 

She has been in this business for two years. She works in a shop and sells via retail seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of wheat flour and baking powder. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler of chapatti and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of wheat flour, cooking oil, and a bag of charcoal.

loans.name: Dios Proveera Group

texts.es: el grupo Dios Proveera esta compuesto por cuatro integrantes habitan en el municipio del Viejo Chinandega tiene sus negocios, trabajan fuerte para sacar el sustento de su familia, una de ellas es la señora Vilma Veronica Jimenez quien es la señora propietaria del taller de tortilla  laboran de lunes a domingo desde la seis de la mañana a seis de la tarde, es madre soltera, tiene bajo su cargo tres hijos en edad escolar se esfuerza por sacarlos adelante, solicita el financiamiento para comprar mercaderia al por mayor para su taller de tortilla.
texts.en: The “Dios Proveera” group is made up of four members who live in the town of Viejo Chinandega and has its businesses and sources of income to support their families.  Vilma Veronica Jimenez is one of the members who has a tortilla shop and works seven days from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm.  She is a single mother with three school-aged children under her care, whom she strives to get ahead.  She is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her tortilla shop in quantity.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a single mother. She has three children, all of whom attend school.

For the past five years, Betty has run a food stall. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She is applying for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO. The loan will be used to buy tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, cassava, and green bananas. Betty aspires to own a fully-stocked food stall and buy a plot of land to grow some of her own ingredients.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, sweet potatoes, cassava, and green bananas.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen lives in Armavir town with his wife and two children. Armen has been making furniture for many years. He receives orders from locals in Armavir town and makes different types of furniture. Due to his hard work, Armen has gained many customers who value the good quality work that he provides. 

Now, Armen asks for this loan, so he can purchase materials needed for making furniture. For completing current orders, this loan will be a huge support for Armen and he would be very grateful to his lenders. 

As this is Armen's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for materials for making furniture

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 35 years old, married, and runs a retail shop in Kangundo town. She has been in this business for seven years now and she makes a monthly income of 30,000 KES. Together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children.

She plans to use this amount to buy more stock of goods for resale. These include rice, maize, beans, soap, sugar and salt. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

This is her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be a successful business lady and offer a good life to her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of goods for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, 50, is married and blessed with two children. She is a farmer in Kangundo, where she raises livestock and plants cash crops to sell. 

Veronica is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed. The anticipated profit will be used to educate her children. This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya. In the future, Veronica hopes to expand her business and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and animal feed.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Ann is a fifty-eight-year-old woman. She is married and a mother of four children. 

Ann operates an M-PESA (money transfer) service and sells shoes. She has been engaged in these businesses for five years. Each month, she earns ten thousand five hundred shillings.

This is Ann's first loan from Vision Fund Kenya. She plans to use the loan to buy a new stock of shoes. The profits will go towards expanding her business. In the future, she plans to build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of shoes

loans.name: Diego Alberto

texts.es:
Diego se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre trabajador y activo, bueno para los negocios; con más de 26 años de experiencia laboral, ha trabajado como empleado, administrando diferentes salsamentarías y bares de la ciudad, adquiriendo los conocimientos necesarios para tomar la decisión de independizarse y montar su propia salsamentaría, desde hace 12 años que inició como independiente, trabaja todos los días a partir de las 2 pm y hasta la madrugada, cuenta con el apoyo de dos empleadas y así genera los recursos suficientes para dar sustento a su esposa y sacar adelante a sus dos hijos.
Actualmente solicita el crédito para fortalecer su inventario con cervezas, licor, gaseosas, mecato, dulces, entre otros, esto le permitirá tener más variedad disponible para satisfacer los gustos de los clientes que visitan su negocio, mejorando así el margen de utilidades que recibe por las ventas realizadas.
A sus 51 años de edad, Diego manifiesta que tanto su vida familiar, como su negocio están estables y no presenta mayores desafíos, sin embargo, sueña con mejorar aún más y en un futuro quiere adquirir un local y una casa que sean de su propiedad, para mejorar las condiciones de vida y dejar un buen legado para sus hijos cuando Dios disponga.
texts.en: Diego is a hardworking and active man, good in business. He has worked for more than 26 years, many of those as an employee and manager of various sausage shops and bars in the city. After learning the business by working, 12 years ago he made the decision to become self-employed and start his own sausage store. He works every day from 2 p.m. until dawn with the help of two women employees, in order to earn enough income to support his wife and to educate his two children. Currently he is requesting a loan to buy more stock for his store: beer, liquor, sodas, snacks, sweets, among others. This will allow him to satisfy his customers with more available products and improve the profit margin on his sales. At 51 years old, Diego states that his family life as well as his business are stable and do not present many challenges. However, he dreams of improving his life, and in the future be able to own a store and a house as legacy for his children.

loans.use: To buy more stock: beer, liquor, sodas, snacks, sweets, among others

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Milcah is a farmer living in Kitale, a high poultry producing area.  She is married, with 2 children of school going age, and has been practicing farming for 10 years.  Milcah produces and sells eggs, maize, and vegetables.  She loves poultry farming as it brings in more income.  Her greatest challenge in poultry farming is poultry diseases that easily kill her chickens.

Milcah chose Juhudi Kilimo to fund her poultry project because their loans have low interest rates and are usually processed quickly.  Her highest monthly expense is school fees, and through the use of this loan she will be able to pay for her children's school fees and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Abdul Kareem

texts.en:
Abdul Kareem is a 40-year-old married father of 4 children from Iraq.  He works hard to provide income for his family and pay for his children's tuition expenses.

Abdul Kareem has a garage where he specializes in repairing motorcycles and selling their spare parts.  He has been in this field since 2010 and has a hired employee. He has good experience in this field and is well-known in his neighborhood.

Abdul Kareem is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD in order to expand and to renovate his workplace.  He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide a better income for his family and provide them with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to expand and to renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer trabajadora y activa de 44 años de edad, que se ha dedicado hace varios años a la actividad de la confección a terceros, inició trabajando como operaria en diferentes talleres donde obtuvo la experiencia y el conocimiento en el oficio, pero, desde hace 6 años decidió independizarse y, con unos ahorros que tenía compró sus máquinas y comenzó su propio taller, poco a poco fue adquiriendo clientes y su negocio fue creciendo, por lo que hoy en día recibe el apoyo de una empleada directa, trabaja todos los días desde las primeras horas de la mañana y así es como genera los recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará unas guías y materia prima al por mayor (telas, hilos, botones, entre otros), esto le permitirá agilizar el proceso de producción y optimizar el tiempo, logrando entregar los pedidos de manera oportuna, esto le abrirá paso para adquirir nuevos contratos y mejorar los ingresos familiares.
Luz manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es fortalecer y acreditar su negocio para hacerlo crecer y poder generar nuevas oportunidades de empleo, mejorando así la calidad de vida no sólo de su familia, sino también la de sus colaboradoras.
texts.en:
Luz is a hard-working and active 44 year old woman. She has worked a number of years sewing for third parties. She started working as an operator in various workshops but 6 years ago decided to go out on her own. Her business grew and today she has the help of an employee and works every day from early in the morning. This is her way to generate resources to help her husband with the finances of the family. 

Luz is requesting the help of a loan to buy some patterns and raw materials wholesale (fabric, thread, buttons, etc.) which will allow her to speed up her production process. She'll be able to fill her orders quicker and this will open the way to acquire new contracts and increase the family's income. Luz says that her greatest wish is strengthen and position her business to make it grow. She can create new employment opportunities and improve not only her family's quality of living but also that of her workers.

loans.use: to buy some patterns and raw material wholesale (fabric, thread, buttons, etc.)

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is a 21-year-old young woman from Kutaisi. She lives with her mother and two brothers. Kristine's father lives abroad. Her mother is involved in a trading business and generates 200 GEL per month of income. Her brothers are temporarily unemployed. Kristine wasn’t able to get an education and so she has no university degree, which is one of the main reasons of her unemployment. She has a great desire to be involved in a selling business.

Kristine couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions, because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue, until the Start Up program began, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows rural poor like Kristine to get a chance for starting or re-starting a business. She requested a loan of 1,000 USD to begin selling jewelry and accessories. 

She plans to purchase the products at wholesale prices and then resell them among her friends and neighbors. This will give her a chance to earn income and become financially independent. In regards to the Start Up program, Kristine will be able to make savings and provide a better future for her family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of jewelry and start selling them

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Алишеру 24 года. Он женатый молодой человек, является отцом двух маленьких детей. Алишер со своей семьей живет в родительском доме в районе Джиликуль. Он занимается растениеводством и дополнительно предоставляет услуги мастера по ремонту дома. Уже 7 лет как Алишер выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры. Он научился этому делу у родителей, когда в юности помогал им с посевом и сбором урожая. Сейчас Алишер активно готовится к посеву пшеницы. Он просит кредит для приобретения минеральных удобрений и семян пшеницы. За счет прибыли он хочет провести ремонт в коровнике.
texts.en: Alisher is 24 years old.  He is a married young man who has two children.  Alisher and his family live in his native village of Jilikul.  He works in agriculture and supplements his income as a handyman repairing homes.  For seven years, Alisher has been growing crops.  He started in this line of work as a child, helping out with the sowing and harvest when he was younger.  Now Alisher actively prepares to sow his own wheat.  He is asking for a loan to buy mineral fertilizer and wheat seeds.  He plans to use the proceeds to make repairs to his barn.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer and wheat seeds

loans.name: Silvia Priscila

texts.es: La señora Silvia Priscila de 24 años de edad  tiene 2 hijos (4 años y 1 de un mes de nacido) cuenta con un pequeño local ubicado a cercanías de la escuela, es una librería  la cual cuenta  con una gran variedad de útiles escolares (libros, crayones, papeles, tijeras, adornos etc.) y ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para invertir en la compra de útiles (cuadernos, marcadores, libros, lapiceros etc.) y otra parte del crédito lo quiere invertir en regalos ya que es una buena temporada navideña (lociones, peluches, cremas, arreglos, ropa para dama, niño, caballeros) ya que en este mes de diciembre la mayoría de sus clientes necesitan comprar la lista de útiles escolares y regalos navideños y es un mes que ella aprovecha para invertir y lograr tener más ingresos y lograr ahorrar para los estudios de sus hijos ya que su meta es poderles dar una mejor educación a sus hijos en un futuro y no padecer de penas economicas, es su segundo credito en kiva y a pagado puntual yno a caido en mora.
texts.en:
Sra. Silvia Priscila is 24 years old and has two children (a four-year-old and a one-month-old). She has a small bookstore near a school where she has a wide variety of school supplies (books, crayons, paper, scissors, decorations, and other items). Silvia is requesting a loan once again so that she can invest in the purchase of school supplies such as notebooks, markers, books, pens, and other items. She also wants to invest part of the loan in gifts for the Christmas season such as lotions, plush toys, crèmes, arrangements, and clothes for women, children, and men. With this being the month of December, most of her customers need to buy school supplies and Christmas gifts. Therefore, she wants to take advantage of this time to invest so that she can generate more income and save for her children's education. Her goal is to provide the best education for her children in the future and be free of financial obligations.

This is her second loan with Kiva. Her previous loan was repaid on time without falling behind.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell in her bookstore.

loans.name: Harrison

texts.en: Harrison is 47 years old and married. He has six (6) children that he supports. They are 18, 16,14,12, 10 and 6 years old, respectively. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer and he has a welding workshop. He has been in this business for 15 years. His business is located at Timboni. In his business, he earns a monthly income of KSHS 3,150. He is taking his first loan of KSHS 10,000 to buy welding materials. Harrison will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hope and dream for his future business and family is to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy welding materials

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a 30-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as an ambitious person. 

He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a conducive environment, and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy clothes to sell and buy materials to build a clothing store.

His business goal is to expand the business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell and buy materials to build a clothing store.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a manicure (service) business in the Philippines.

Genalyn requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials needed for her manicure business. She has been in this business for two years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed for her manicure business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 55 years old and a married woman. She has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, who has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Jane works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from dried fish vending.

Jane is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy ingredients for her prepared foods business.

Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie is 38 years old and married. She has two children, who are in school. Jovie works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy additional stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, and eggs.

In the future Jovie would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell at her store, like canned goods, coffee, and eggs.

loans.name: Khadar Saleban

texts.en:
Khadar Saleban is 19 years old. He studies at Gollis University College, in the school of Telecommunication Engineering. 

Khadar needs a laptop to prepare his university assignments and lessons. He applied to Kaaba for a laptop loan and now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop, and Khadar will pay monthly repayments. After university, Khadar hopes to work as a telecommunication engineer.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Kogle N Kondo Group

texts.fr:
Mme TKUILGA représente le groupe KOGLE N KONDO. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 10ans. 03 vont à l’école.
Mme vend des habits pour enfants depuis 14ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont  les hommes et femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 13douzaines d’habits.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Mme ambitionne ouvrir un grand magasin.
texts.en: Ms. TKUILGA represents the group KOGLE N KONDO. She is a married mother of three children. The oldest is 14 years old, and the youngest is 10. Three of them are in school. She has three persons to support. Ms. TKUILGA has been selling children's clothing for fourteen years. She gets her supplies at the Sector 10 market. Her customers include both men and women. She wants to purchase 13 dozen pieces of clothing to sell. With her profits, she wants to help with her children's education. Her ambition is to open a large store.

loans.use: to purchase 13 dozen pieces of clothing to sell

loans.name: Sulayman Abdilahi

texts.en:
Sulayman Abdilahi  is 21 years old. He studies at Alpha University College, faculty of Public Health. Being without a laptop is his major problem. He needs a laptop to watch video tutorials, read medical lessons, prepare assignments, download books, and to make class presentations. 

He requested a laptop from Kaaba Microfinance Institution. Now he is on the waiting list and Kaaba will provide him the laptop as a loan.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Dimeya Group

texts.fr:
Mme HABIBOU représente le groupe DIMEYA. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 32ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. 02 vont à l’école et elle a 03personnes en charge.
Mme vend des fruits et légumes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Boulbi un village environnant. Ses clients sont  les revendeurs du marché de Songnaaba.
Elle veut s’acheter 10 paniers de fruits et légumes (choux, tomates fraiches, poivrons, pastèques,  etc.).
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut s’occuper de sa famille. Mme ambitionne s’occuper de la scolarité de ses enfants et accroître son activité.
texts.en: Ms. HABIBOU represents the group DIMEYA. She is a married mother of five children. The oldest is 32 years old, and the youngest is 14. Two of them are in school. She has three persons to support. Ms. HABIBOU has been selling fruit and vegetables for ten years. She gets her supplies in Boulbi, a nearby village. Her customers are  retailers at the Songnaaba market. She wants to purchase ten baskets of fruit and vegetables (cabbage, fresh tomatoes, bell peppers, watermelons, etc.) With her profits, she wants to take care of her family. Her ambition is to see to her children's education and to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase ten baskets of fruit and vegetables (cabbage, fresh tomatoes, bell peppers, watermelons, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like bar soaps, powder soaps, wheat flour, clothes, etc

loans.name: Mohamed Osman

texts.en:
Mohamed Osman is 20 years old. He studies at the University of Hargeisa, in the school of accounting. Mohamed needs a laptop. 

Buying a laptop on his own is the biggest challenge he has faced in his learning process. Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students the soft copy of the lessons. Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. Now he is waiting for a laptop that Kaaba will provide, which he will pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Alcina

texts.en: Alcina is taking a loan of $ 1000 (US) to improve her business. She is married, and she has three children. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as body lotion, noodles, cigarettes, salt, milk, eggs, coffee, sugar, bread, fish, water, Fanta and Sprite. She opened her kiosk in 2000, with her own working capital of $500. She is a hard-working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. And her husband is a police officer.

loans.use: to buy stock to keep in her store, such as body lotion, noodles, milk, coffee, and fish

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 60-years-old. He describes himself as a dedicated father, grandfather, husband and friend. He lives in a town called Mongu, located in the western province of Zambia. Charles sells Coca-Cola products to local retailers in his community.

Charles has been running his business for ten years. On any given day, Charles can be found at his shop shipping containers filled with crates of Coke, Fanta, and Sprite. He enjoys running his business because it gives him the chance to interact with other small business owners in his hometown. He says his business is the only source of income that his family has.

Charles has applied for this loan to purchase more stock such as Fanta, Coca-Cola and Sprite for his shop. The loan will help him to expand his business activity and earn more income. This is very important in order for him to be able to cover the family's basic costs and ensure a better life for them.

loans.use: To order more soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Pascal

texts.en:
Pascal is a 28-year-old male and lives in Hoima, Uganda. He works in the transport business, and farming supplements his income base. He wishes to furnish his house. He faces a challenge of poor roads that increase on his expenditure due to mechanical break downs. His dream is to buy his own mini bus and complete his residential house.

Pascal intends to use the loan to furnish his house.

loans.use: furnish his house.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 50 years old married to Mary, and together they are blessed with six children, aged between 30 and 16 years old. Two of them are in school.

He is in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru. He has practiced farming for twenty years and has applied for his fifth loan from Vision Fund Kenya after repaying his previous loans on time. This loan is to enable him to buy a cow. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his farming business.

In the near future, he hopes to use modern methods of farming to improve his family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 25-year-old single young man from Deir Al-Balah. He lives with his parents in a very simple house. For the past six months, Tamer has been working as a driver using an old rickshaw he owns. He transfers goods for the local traders. It is a good business, and he earns a good income. Tamer would like to improve his business.

Tamer took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods instead of the old one. By taking this loan, Tamer will be able to take more orders and increase his income. This will help Tamer to improve the family's living conditions. 

Tamer appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods instead of the old one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband to improve his bakery and buy all the needed raw materials.

loans.name: Majidah

texts.en:
Majidah is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Majidah is a 43-year-old, married woman from a small village near Nablus city. She is a mother of six sons and two daughters. 

Majidah's husband has a small fruits and vegetables store in the city. He buys his products from local farmers and resells them in the market. Majidah's hsuband would like to improve his business and expand it.

Majidah took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her husband to improve his store by buying a pickup truck to transport his products. By taking this loan, Majidah's husband will be able to bring more products and distribute them to the customers in the city.

loans.use: to help her husband to improve his store by buying a pickup truck to transport his products.

loans.name: Zeyad

texts.en:
Zeyad is a 27-year-old single young man from Rafah city. He lives with his family in a simple house in the city. Zeyad works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. He would like to improve the family's living conditions so he decided to buy a new rickshaw to transfer goods for the local traders.

Zeyad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a rickshaw to use for work. By taking this loan, Zeyad will be able to work and improve the family's living conditions.

Zeyad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nadia. It consists of six women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen.  All of them are friends . The group took a loan of 300,000 Yemen rials (YER). Fatima is the leader of their group in this loan. She is 47 years old and lives in Hodiedh, Yemen. Her main business is sewing ladies' fabrics. She has been in business for seven years. 

She has a good command of her activity. She is taking a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB and intends to use her loan to better develop her business by purchasing  a sewing machine to use for her business that will lead to increased profits. Her profits will allow her to help meet her family’s needs. In the future, she would like to have a big sewing factory.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to use for her business that will lead to increased profits.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Luchadoras está en su ciclo número 6  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran mejorando su calidad de vida.
La Sra. Evelia es la Secretaria del grupo, ella es Docente pero también vendedora de Bebidas, y comenta que es ella misma es quien maneja el negocio. Es una persona por sobre todo emprendedora, que siempre esta con mucho entusiasmo para poder ir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de su familia, ya que por medio de su trabajo les da todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas, cervezas, jugos en gral. Y otro tipo de bebidas. Todas están muy agradecidas por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder mejorar la calidad de vida de todas.
texts.en:
The group "Mujeres Luchadoras" (Determined Women) is in its sixth loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. All of the members work and help one another so that they can move forward. Through their efforts and continuous work, they continue to apply the vital behaviors that are characteristic of successful women. This enables them to improve their quality of life.

Sra. Evelia is the group secretary. She is a teacher, but she also sells beverages. Evelia says that she is the one who manages her beverage business. She is an enterprising person and always has a high level of enthusiasm, which allows her to improve her quality of life and that of her family. Through her work, she is able to give her family everything that she was not able to have.

Evelia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of sodas, beer, juices, and other types of beverages. All of the members are very grateful for this opportunity that has been given to them so that they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beer, juices, and other types of beverages.

loans.name: Oygul

texts.ru: Ойгул трудолюбивая и жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась в 1970 году. Ойгул является повторной клиенткой ИМОН. Она имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Ойгул имеет собственный бизнес. Она более 7 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур как пшеница, шала и т.п. Ойгул имеет дополнительный доход от скотоводства. Ойгул имеет 4 детей и является основной кормилицей своих детей, так как ее муж электрик и имеет маленький доход. Она хочет купить мебель для своего домохозяйства, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки мебели. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Oygul is a hard-working and cheerful woman.  She was born in 1970.  Oygul is a repeat client of IMON and she has a good borrowing record.  She has her own business; for more than seven years, she has been involved in growing crops like wheat, unrefined rice, etc.  Oygul supplements her income by raising livestock.  She has four children and she is the main breadwinner in her family, as her husband is an electrician and only earns a small salary.  Oygul wants to buy furniture for her home, but she doesn't have enough money.  She is asking for a loan of 3,500 somoni to buy furniture.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her household

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 42 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Calca pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella antes se dedica a la venta de frutas pero actualmente se dedica a la venta de regalos. en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar regalos como por ejemplo perfumes y peluches. 

Sonia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sonia is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She was born in the city of Calca, but now lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. Sonia previously sold fruit, but now she sells gifts. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy gifts, such as perfumes and plush toys.

Sonia is pleased with the loan that has been granted, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy gifts, such as perfumes and plush toys.

loans.name: Halima

texts.ru: Халима всегда старается для благополучия своей семьи. Она живет в маленькой селе на северной части Таджикистана, где местные жители занимаются в основном выращиванием сельхоз культур и скотоводством. Халима как и другие жители, занимается скотоводством уже более 15 лет. Она имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Халима трудится упорно, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж и ее дети помогают ей введению бизнеса. Халима запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить оборотный капитал. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Halima always strives to improve her family's well-being. She lives in a small village in a northern part of Tajikistan, where local residents are engaged mainly in farming and animal husbandry. Like other residents, Halima has engaged in cattle breeding for over 15 years. She has extensive experience in this field of business. Halima is working hard to provide for her family. She is married and raising three children. Her husband and her children help her with the business. Halima has requested a loan of $3,000 USD for the purchase of cattle to increase working capital. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to increase working capital

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, живет на Юге Таджикистана. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Она начала свой бизнес скотоводством 6 лет назад, так как она нуждалась в деньгах. Ее муж не имеет достаточной зарплаты. Дилбар постепенно развевает свой бизнес. Она покупает скот, откармливает несколько месяцев и продает на местном рынке по более высокой цене.  У нее большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Она продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Она должна провести свадьбу своей дочери, но не имеет достаточно денег. Дилбар запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This person (Dilbar) has an enormously kind heart and a wonderful soul.  She lives in the south of Tajikistan and she is married with five children.  She started her business raising livestock six years ago, as she was in need of money.  Her husband does not make a sufficient salary, so Dilbar began to increase her business little by little.  She bought livestock, fattened them up for a few months and sold them o at the local market for a higher price.  She has a big garden where she grows hay for the animals.  She also sells milk to her neighbors, who are very satisfied with the natural dairy products they receive.  Dilbar needs to put on her daughter's wedding, but she does not have enough money.  She is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni to buy the necessary wedding items for her daughter.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's wedding

loans.name: Katherine Rose

texts.en:
Katherine Rose is 27 years old and married. She has one child. Katherine Rose works very hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items, such as sardines, shampoo, soft drinks, and other groceries.

She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional groceries to sell.

In the future Katherine Rose would like to save money, to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 54 years old and married with one child.

Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Lorna has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Lorna aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Maribeth is borrowing PHP 1,800 through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a good light source that is waterproof during the rainy season.

Maribeth is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 26 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for one year. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jean requested a 4,600 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Jean is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a retail egg business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 7,000 PHP  through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of eggs to sell.

She has been in this business for two years.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She would like to build and expand her business to  secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Ninfa has been in this business for twenty years. She earns more income from tailoring.

Ninfa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling home products in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more home products to sell.

Nena has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from selling frozen foods. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Anne  works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Anne  is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Anne  has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has an E-loading (mobile prepaid load) business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional prepaid load to sell to customers.

She has been in this business for six years.  In the future, Ofelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional prepaid load to sell to customers.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Marilyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Bendita

texts.en:
Bendita is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business. She is married.  She is running a business in front of her house, offering motorcycle services.  

She is making a good income from  motorcycle services and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan and pay for the mechanic who works for her. She is living in a town near the main road; so many people come to fix their motorcycles. She opened her business in 2002 with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy inner tubes, tires, adhesive, and mechanical services

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank is a male Ugandan, aged 34 years. He is married to Juliet, with whom he has four children aged between 4 and 12 years. Only two of them are attending school. Frank is a farmer in a rural area, producing coffee. He has been doing this job since 2002 as his source of livelihood. He also grows other crops, like beans and maize.

Frank has approached Ugafode for a loan of 1,300,000 UGX. He will use it to hire labourers. He has borrowed 800,000 previously. He intends to pay back the loan, out of revenues from his farming activities. His main business challenges include weather changes, which affect crop productivity. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

He dreams of building a good, residential house for his family, and of acquiring more land for his family, which is growing big.

loans.use: to hire labourers for picking and drying coffee

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 44 years old and a married woman. She has two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur, who owns a rice-retailing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Myrna requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock of rice to sell.

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mary Cris

texts.en:
Mary Cris is 42 years old and married. She has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, a business she has been in for 17 years. She earns additional income from farming rice and sugarcane.

Mary Cris requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell at her general store, like shampoo, groceries, etcetera.

Mary Cris has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF, before this loan. She aspires to save money, to enable her to expand her business and to repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store, like shampoo, groceries, etcetera.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 58-years-old and married with five children.

She earns a living by raising ducks in the Philippines. Sofia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

Sofia has been raising ducks for three years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream -  to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her ducks.

loans.name: Amina's Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kangela est une brave commerçante d’une expérience 7 ans et membre d’une Association d’Affaires  « Uhaki » âgée de 43 ans  et mère de 5 enfants qui  tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse  de divers articlés de boutique. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle va acheter 1 sac du sucre,  1 sac de farine de format, 2 cartons de savons, 2 sacs de sel iodé, 3 cartons de tomates en boite. Au début, elle avait reçu de fonds de son ancien mari. Son conjoint, c’est un infirmier dans un centre hospitalier de la place. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, devenir grossiste, scolariser et assurer les mieux êtres de ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur donnant de microcrédits sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du system bancaire classique, surtout, dans la période de conflits a l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
This client, Kangela, is a good and honest merchant with seven years of experience. She is a member of the business association "Uhaki" and is the mother of five children, all students. She sells a variety of shop goods. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her enterprise. She is going to purchase a bag of sugar, a bag of wheat flour, 2 boxes of soaps, 2 bags of iodized salt, and 3 boxes of canned tomatoes. At first, she had received funds from her former husband. Her husband is a nurse at a local hospital. She would like to increase her capital, become a wholesale merchant, educate her children, and ensure their well-being further. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of women entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system by giving them no-collateral micro-loans, especially during this time of conflict in the country's east.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, soaps, iodized salt, and canned tomatoes

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married and has five children.  She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as fish, Fanta, beer, Sagiko, Sprite, Coca-Cola, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap, water and a refrigerator. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  She is a hard-working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish, Fanta, beer, Sagiko, Sprite, Coca-Cola, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, shampoo, soap, water and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando dreams of becoming a science teacher, but without a teaching degree knows it may never be possible. Rolando was accepted into the Universidad San Francisco De Asís, and now with the chance to achieve his dream, is concerned about affording tuition fees. 

He expects to graduate in December 2014, but without a loan, is unsure how he will be able to continue to afford his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. For Rolando, it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a loan, Rolando plans on using the funds to pay his tuition while he saves his salary from his part-time job. Rolando currently works 30 hours a week, but making time to work and go to school has been one of his biggest challenges. 

For his family of three, finances have always been tight. This loan will allow him to afford his education and focus on his schoolwork.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Hashi Mohamoud

texts.en:
Hashi Mohamoud is 25 years old. He is a senior student and he studies at Golis University College, faculty of Telecommunication Engineering  . He needs a laptop to write his thesis and he cannot pay the money all at one time. 

His good news was when he got the Kaaba MFI laptop loans. He approached Kaaba MFI and then Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help her husband fix the car engine

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is a 47-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is the father of seven sons and four daughters. Kamel works as an employee in a local firm where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. One of Kamel's sons has finished his studies in the university but he has not found a job yet. He would like to work and help his family and also prepare himself to get married. 

Kamel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a rickshaw for his son to work on it. By taking this loan, Kamel's son will be able to work and improve the family living conditions.  Kamel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw for his son to work on it.

loans.name: Davlatpocho

texts.en:
Davlatpocho is a hardworking woman. She is a widow. Davlatpocho has a son. She lives with her son in the South part of Tajikistan. She has been working at her own business. She grows greens and cucumbers in a greenhouse. Davlatpocho works in the land at her house. She sells her products in a local market. 

Davlatpocho manages the business alone. She wants to develop her business. She needs to cellophane her greenhouse. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy cellophane. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cellophane for her greenhouse

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen is a 27-year-old, married woman and she is in the business of selling bed sheets and bed covers in her community, with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. She always has a great collection of bed sheets to offer. She is greatly appreciated in her community and she has a good list of customers. Her husband also assists her by making sales door-to-door.  

Yasmeen is a mother of three children and she is always worried about their future. She dreams to provide them with a better education, to improve their standard of living. 

To make a greater variety of bed sheets available for sale, Yasmeen is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000. This will enable her to purchase more designs of bed sheets, spreads, and bed covers to offer to her customers. She desires to spend part of the income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more designs of bed sheets, spreads, and bed covers.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 49 years old and married to Ruth. Together they are blessed with two children, aged 19 and 17 years old.

He is in the farming business in Ndunyu Njeru. He has practiced farming for five years and has applied for his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya after paying his previous loans on time. 

This loan is to enable him to buy fertilizer, seeds and spraying chemicals. With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his farming business.

In the near future, he hopes to expand his farming business so he can be the leading horticultural crop farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and spraying chemicals.

loans.name: Makhgula

texts.en:
Makhgula is a 62-year-old married woman from the village of Talaveri. She lives with her husband, and both are involved in agricultural activities. Makhgula is extensively engaged in cultivating potatoes and beans. Her husband sells the agricultural products in the local market. This is the main source of the family’s income. 

Her agricultural business needs some investments to continue developing in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 5,000 will be a huge support to this hardworking woman and her husband, enabling her to purchase a milk cow and cattle. After the cattle grow, Makhgula will sell them at a good price. She will also increase her daily income with the help of the milk cow.
 
She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up program provides loans to people who want to start or re-start businesses. Makhgula will be thankful to all the lenders for helping maintain her agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and cattle.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 46-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She, along with her husband (shown in the photo), has been providing a flour grinding service in their community to contribute in the family income. They have gained four years of experience in this field, and over that time they have become famous for providing fine quality flour. 

In order to purchase a new grinding machine, Shamim contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. The purchase of a new grinder with the loan proceeds would help them cater to more customers over time, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. Shamim wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine.

loans.name: Mohamad Yehia

texts.en:
Mohamad Yehia is a 27-year-old married father of two children.  He works two jobs to cover his precious family's needs since his wife doesn't work and he has to make sure that all their needs are acquired.

Since four years ago, Mohamad Yehia has been employed in a company where he is responsible for clearing all of the company's transactions. 
 
He also runs a convenience store where he is a partner with his father.  Mohamad Yehia is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary display refrigerators for his shop to start selling dairy products and diversify his items, which will increase his income and develop his livelihood.

He will also use part of the loan to increase his business merchandise with special product offers that will attract customers' attention and increase his selling.

He hopes that in the future he can open another branch and cover a wider region.

loans.use: to buy display refrigerators for his shop to start selling dairy products.

loans.name: Barohat

texts.ru: Барохат молодая, красивая  трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 22 года. Она замужем, но еще не имеет детей. Барохат более 5 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур, а также она откармливает скот у себя дома и продает молоко и сметану. Барохат очень трудолюбивая и общительная. Благодаря хорошему сервису и общению она имеет своих регулярных клиентов. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и с такой целью она обратилась за займом. Барохат запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Barohat is a young, beautiful hardworking woman. She is 22 years old. She is married, but does not yet have children. For more than 5 years, Barohat has engaged in farming.  She also fattens cattle at home and sells milk and sour cream. Barohat is very hardworking and sociable. Thanks to her excellent service and communication, she has her own regular customers. She wants to increase working capital and, to do so, has applied for a loan. Barohat has requested a loan of 2000 Somons to buy cattle. She is waiting for your kindness and hopes for your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to increase her working capital

loans.name: 03.05.01 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Hằng is operating a business selling snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase material to make processed food to resell. Hằng is 41 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Hằng is the group leader of the 03.05.01 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 4 members.  Hằng supports 2 dependents with her business in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2005, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hằng has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hằng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material to make processed food to resell

loans.name: 01.07.04 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lễ has a retail business selling general things. Lễ has been involved in this business for seven years. 

She is requesting a loan to to purchase general things such as milk, candy, and dry food to sell.

Lễ is 59 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 01.07.04 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of five members.
 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent; another child is grown up.

In 2005, Lễ joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lễ has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main hardship that Lễ faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lễ hopes her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase general things such as milk, candy, and dry food to sell.

loans.name: 01.07.05 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên has a retail business selling general merchandise. She is requesting a loan to to purchase general merchandise such as milk, candy and dry food to resell.

Liên is 50 years old and she is married with 2 children.

Liên is the group leader of the 01.07.05 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 1 dependent and another child is grown-up.

In 2005, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liên has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Liên has been involved in this business for eight years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase general merchandise such as milk, candy and dry food to resell.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children.  She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business and sells various items like sugar, soap, cooking oil, canned goods and noodles. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Cecil is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell like beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and also to pay school fees. In the future, Cecil hopes of making her business a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell like beverages, seasonings, soft drinks and also to pay school fees

loans.name: Ma. Cynthia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of four children, Ma. Cynthia works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Ma. Cynthia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy supplies for her sewing machine.

Ma. Cynthia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Alicia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, milk, chips, and soft drinks. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she is requesting an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, milk, and soft drinks

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Phoebe works hard to support her family.

She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. Phoebe is borrowing 7,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation.

Phoebe has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle transportation

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean is 37 years old and married, and she has six children. Five of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and she has been doing this work for three years.

Mary Jean requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her sewing machine.

In the future, Mary Jean would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her sewing machine.

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is 45 years old. He lives with his sister and pensioner aunt in the small village of Meskheti in Tskaltubo district. His sister is a homemaker, and Elguja's salary is the only source of income for the family. 

Elguja works as an electrician and also works hard on the family-owned land, growing greens. He sells the harvested greens seasonally at local markets. Elguja decided to expand this business and requested a loan. The Start-Up program enables him to have a loan of 4,000 GEL to build a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built, he will grow tomatoes and cucumbers there. 

Elguja is very motivated to work hard and ensure a good harvest. He will sell the harvested tomatoes and cucumbers locally. With the increased income, he will improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse.

loans.name: Fadxi Ali

texts.en:
Fadxi Ali is 20 years old. He studies at Gollis University College in the faculty of Telecommunication Engineering. He needs a laptop to prepare his assignments, read his lessons when given as a soft copy, and download extra lessons.  Lecturers use a projector during classes and give the students the soft copy of the lessons.

Getting the laptop will help him to improve his lesson preparation. Now he is waiting for a laptop that Kaaba will provide, which he will pay for in monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for educational purposes

loans.name: Giga

texts.en:
Giga is 26 years old. He lives with his father, brother and his family in Baghdati district. Giga's father is provided with a retirement pension and his brother works as a security guard. Giga is unemployed at the moment despite having a higher education.

In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living. So, Giga decided to start his own business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Giga’s credit requests were rejected several times as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. Giga received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, a Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses.

Giga needs 2,000 GEL to build a greenhouse. He will grow tomatoes and cucumbers there. Giga is very motivated to work hard and ensure a good harvest. The harvested products will be sold locally. The Start Up program will be a great support for the family.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Altynay

texts.ru: Алтынай 26 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Дети все дошкольного возраста. У Алтынай - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Алтынай занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 25,000 сом KGS. Алтынай с мужем на протяжении 6 лет живут в кошаре. Благодаря упорному труду Алтынай, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 2 нетели, 1 лошадь, 2 бычка, параллельно обрабатывают 2,80 ГА земли, где в основном выращивают фасоль и многолетнюю траву. Алтынай доит коров и реализует молоко за наличный расчет. Супруг Алтынай работает чабаном, пасет скот местного населения за определенную плату. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Алтынай обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Алтынай планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Altynay is 26 years old, married, and raising three children. All children are too young to attend school.  Altynay has a secondary education. To provide income for her family, Altynay has worked in farming and raising livestock.  She started six years ago, with the purchase of cattle for 25,000 KGS. Altynay and her husband have been living in a shed for six years. Through her hard work, Altynay's household now has 3 dairy cows, 2 heifers, 1 horse, and 2 bulls.  At the same time, she has cultivated 2.8 hectares of land, where she grows beans and perennial grasses. Altynay milks the cows and sells the milk for cash. Altynay's husband works as a shepherd, herding livestock for other local residents for a fee. Their monthly income is 10,000 KGS. In order to further grow her business, Altynay has turned to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan in order to buy a cow for breeding. Altynay plans to invest the loan income into further increasing the amount of domestic animals, and plans to save enough money to pay for the higher education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old; she is married, and is now applying for a loan of $600 to improve her business.  She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as carrots, onions, garlic, ice, and fish.

She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $200. She earns a good income from her business.

Rosa is a very hard-working woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy carrots, onions, garlic, ice, and fish

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 34 years old, married to Mary, with 3 children ages 4, 7, and 10. Two of them attend school; Nathan is the sole provider of school fees and other necessities for them.

He wants a loan of UGX.1,500,000. 

Nathan is a farmer. He grows mainly maize and bananas, but he is also a civil servant; he works with the District Local Government. Nathan says he started farming to supplement his salary because his family was growing and he needed to take care of them.

His dream are to acquire a tractor and start farming on a large scale, educate all his children to the university level, and build a modern family house.
