His main challenges include unpredictable weather changes and a poor transport network in the area, which hinders transportation of his products to market areas. He is hardworking and shrewd.

loans.use: To buy farm tools and pesticides

loans.name: Susanita

texts.en:
As a widow mother of nine children, Susanita works hard to support her family. She has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. 

Susanita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her cafeteria.

She has been in this business for 17 years.

Susanita's goal is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Nawal is a 48-year-old married woman from a small village near Nablus city. She is a mother of two sons. Nawal's husband works as a farmer in his land. This is the only source of income for the family. Nawal has a problem in her gland and she must have an urgent surgery.

Nawal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the hospital expenses for doing the gland surgery for her. By taking this loan, Nawal will be able to pay part of these urgent expenses.

loans.use: to pay the hospital expenses for a gland surgery

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 47 years old and married to Dorothy. Together they are blessed with five children aged between 20 and 10 years old.

Peter is in a shoe-selling business in Naivasha. He has been running the business for two-and-a-half years. He has applied for a second loan from VisionFund Kenya after repaying his previous loan on time. 

This loan will enable him to buy a stock of shoes for sale. With the anticipated profit from his expanded business, he plans to invest more in his business.

In the near future, he hopes to build rental houses and also his own residential house.

loans.use: to buy a stock of shoes for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a lady of 35 years old, and she is married to Joseph. She is a mother of four children, and she does dairy farming in Kiambaa on the outskirts of Limuru town. She has been in this business for 12 years now and gets a monthly income of 7,000 shillings.

This will be Gladys' fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya; she plans to use the entire money to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she wants to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a man of 57 years, married to Margret and a father of four children. He makes soap and detergents in Kangemi. He has been in this business for six years now and gets a monthly income of 23,000 shillings.

This will be Peter's second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy chemicals used in soap-making. In the future he wants to educate his children and be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy chemicals for making soap and detergents.

loans.name: Vahram

texts.en:
Vahram lives in Qarakert village in the Armavir region. He lives there with his wife and three children (ages 10, nine and four). Vahram is a farmer. He keeps six pigs and 20 piglets, as well as cultivates grass as forage for them. 

Vahram also owns an apricot yard where 100 apricot trees are grown. As the only working hand in the family (his wife takes care of the children and household), Vahram works hard to be able to run his farm successfully and gather a good income for his family. Vahram has now requested this loan of USD 3,000 to be able to purchase two pigs, two oxen, and forage for feeding the livestock. 

Vahram has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of hard financial conditions and bad times for agribusiness, he wasn't able to pay it back on time. However, Vahram was able to become financially stable due to his farm. Ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments of the new loan, Vahram has now applied for this loan. 

He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

Vahram hopes for lenders' support, and the loan is very important for his agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two pigs, two oxen, and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. Along with her husband, she has been doing agricultural work for many years. She grows crops of different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market. Her son also assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. 

Ruqia has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Ruqia applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 31-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband assists her by purchasing a stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Shabana is a mother of five children, and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Basheeran

texts.en: Basheeran is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of selling milk. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, Basheeran has gradually improved her business: recently she requested a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. Basheeran is in her 7th loan cycle and has good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 33 years old and has been in business selling scrap materials for many years. She buys used plastic Pepsi, Coke, Mirinda (an orange soda), and similar bottles in a variety of sizes: 500 mL, 1 L, 1.5 L, and 2.25 L. 

After properly crushing and recycling these bottles, Shamim sells them to the people of her community.Through her business she makes enough money to contribute to the family's income. She has seven children and is able to provide them with good food, health and education, so she needs to earn more to keep supporting her family well. 

Shamim is in her 7th loan cycle with the Kashf Foundation, Kiva's field partner in her community, and she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy additional bottles in different sizes to boost her sales. She expects this to then boost her earning and wishes to spend part of the proceeds to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy different sized plastic bottles to sell for scrap.

loans.name: Gul  Fareen

texts.en:
Gul Fareen is a 41 year old married woman. She runs a business selling milk, with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. 

She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread-winner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and so did her income. Now she has two buffalos and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, Gul Fareen is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

Gul Fareen has some savings and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 6th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Hanifan

texts.en: Hanifan, age 42, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another calf. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Dúo Calvario Comalapense Group

texts.es:
DUO EL CALVARIO COMALAPENSE
La señora María Elena de 45 años de edad, Casada  desde hace 12 años, ella posee una Tienda ubicada en la zona 4 de San Juan Comalapa, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y así mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de señorita María Elena es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a kiva y mejorar su negocio; con el préstamo quiere comprar más productos de consumo diario  para seguir creciendo con su tienda, a trabajado un credito y no cayo en mora, espera que le puedan seguir ayudando con su negocio.
texts.en:
TWO WOMEN FROM SAN JUAN COMALPA
Sra. Maria Elena, 45, has been married for 12 years.  She has a grocery business in Zone 4 of San Juan Comalapa.  Income from the business paid for her house and helps to support her family.  
Sra. Maria Elena hopes that she can continue to make the most of micro-lending and Kiva loans to grow her business and build a better life for herself and her family.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her grocery with the everyday products that her customers want.

loans.use: to restock her grocery business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa nació en la ciudad del Cusco  y tiene un hijo, ella agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contenta por el crédito, ella continua dedicándose a la tienda de abarrotes y también se dedica a la venta de ropa de niño. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar ropa para niños. La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Teresa was born in the city of Cusco and has one son.  She wants us to thank you for your loans and says that she is grateful to have access to this form of credit.  Teresa still operates a grocery business and makes extra income selling children's clothing.  She will use this latest loan to buy children's clothing that she will resell.  Teresa is pleased to receive the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
As Vahe planned, he is taking his second deal/loan with Kiva. The first one helped him buy liquefied gas, oxygen cylinders, and other supplies for his work as a welder. 

All the skills and secrets of welding he learned from his father, who used to be an excellent master in welding. 

Vahe is still unmarried, and he lives in Vanadzor in the Lori region. His elder brother and father now are temporarily in Russian Federation and from there, they support him and his business financially. 

Vahe works on orders; if he has an order, he buys material and makes the order. He works smartly, and with good designing taste.
 
He asks a loan of 150,000 Armenian drams to buy a lot of iron rods, which are very important materials in his work.

loans.use: to buy a lot of iron rods, which are very important materials in his welding work

loans.name: 01.01.10 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Minh is 30 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Minh has a business tailoring clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase cloth for her tailoring business. 

Minh is the group leader of the 01.01.10 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of eight members. In 2010, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Minh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profits, Minh hopes for her business to do well. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase cloth for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Kory Chaska Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KORY CHASKA”; Este banco se ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina ella es conviviente , tiene 36 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia altera sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de bar restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia vende diferentes tipos de platos como chicharron,arroz con pollo, sopas entre otros, a la vez la socia vende bebidas como gaseosas, cerveza,otros ,la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como arroz,aceite y cerveza.

Los otros socios  se dedican a la venta de ropa para bebes, cabina de internet, restaurante, picantería turismo, brindando el servicio de taxi.

La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the community bank "KORY CHASKA." This group is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and the department of Cusco. The leading partner is Luz Marina. She is 36-years-old and married with three children. She has altered her daily activities to dedicate herself to her bar/restaurant business. She spends a lot of time working on this business which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts every day. She sells different types of dishes such as pork cracklings, chicken with rice, soups, and others. She sells drinks like soda, beer, and others. She wants to continue working on this business to support her family. 

The other partners in this group make their livings selling clothing for babies, running an Internet cafe, a restaurant, a tourist restaurant, and providing taxi services.

The partner whose photo is attached asked permission to be late to this meeting because of her work.

They are grateful to those who are a part of this dream though this medium. The agree to comply with the payment of the quotas by their deadlines.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like rice, oil, and beer for her restaurant.

loans.name: Zarima

texts.ru: Зариме 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. Дети все учатся в школе. У Заримы - среднее образование, она оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Зарима знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. Зарима в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Заримы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 дойных коров, 3 нетели, 5 бычков, есть небольшой надел на котором выращивают фасоль и многолетние травы. Для содержания скота имеются все условия: сарай для содержания скота, отгонные пастбища. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. Супруг занимается перевозкой пассажиров. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зарима обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом -на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Зарима планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zarima is 35 years old, married, and raising three children. All of her children are in school.  Zarima has a secondary education. She travels through life optimistically, knows exactly what she wants and achieves it all through her own efforts. Zarima knows how to properly use and plan funds to achieve her goals. Zarima is the main income source for her family.  She has engaged in livestock raising and farming, starting 15 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 10,000 KGS. Through her hard work, Zarima's household now has 7 dairy cows, 3 heifers, 5 steers, and a small plot where she grows beans and perennial grasses. She has all the necessary conditions to raise cattle: a barn for keeping cattle, and distant pastures. She procures all the necessary hay and fodder. Her spouse works in transporting passengers. Their monthly gross income is 11,000 som (KGS). In order to further grow her business, Zarima has appealed to the Microfinance Bank "Bai - Tushum and Partners" for a loan to buy a cow for cattle breeding. Zarima plans to invest the loan income into increasing the amount of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Bobur

texts.ru:
Бобур молодой парень 23 лет. Бобур трудолюбивый, спокойный и пунктуальный человек. В данное время не женат. Но скоро собирается жениться. Но сперва Бобур решил  встать на ноги, самостоятельно зарабатывать деньги для своей семьи, а после связать свою жизнь брачными узами. Ведь создание семьи святое и ответственный шаг. Бобур не хочет стать обузой для своих родителей. Для этого Бобур работает усердно днем и ночью. Он занимается выгрузкой товаров в железнодорожной станции, которое находиться в Спитаменском районе. У Бобура своя бригада работников.Они все работают очень дружно.
Бобур еще параллельно занимается животноводством. Он разводит дома мелко рогатых скотов. Бобур свое дело начал недавно, но увидев что это занятие прибыльное, он  решил умножить поголовье скота, тем более у Бобура имеется место где можно без всяких трудностей разводить скот. Узнав о МДО "Арванд" Бобур обратился в организацию за денежными средствами. На полученный кредит Бобур планирует купить скот. Он надеется на поддержку организации и заранее выражает свою благодарность!
texts.en:
Bobur is 23-year old young man. Bobur is a hardworking, calm and punctual person. At this time, he is not married. However, he is soon going to marry. But first, Bobur has decided to get on his feet, independently earn money for his family, and afterwards, tie the knot through marriage. After all, the creation of a family is a holy and responsible step. Bobur does not want to become a burden to his parents. Thus, Bobur works hard day and night. He unloads goods at a train station, which is located in the Spitamen region.  Babur has his own team of workers.  They all work very amicably.
At the same time, Bobur is also engaged in raising livestock. He raises sheep and goats at home. Bobur has recently started his business, but seeing that this occupation is profitable, he has decided to increase the number of livestock, especially because he has a place where he can raise cattle without difficulty. After learning about MDO "Arvand", Bobur has turned to the organization for funds. Bobur plans to use this loan to purchase cattle. He hopes for the support of the organization, and expresses his gratitude in advance!

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three sons. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family’s expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Lubna has applied for a loan, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and pay for some engine maintenance needed for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transportation service for his passengers. 

Sajida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and pay for some engine maintenance needed for her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 34 years old. 

She is running a secondhand clothes business in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy shirts, shorts, pants, short-sleeve shirts, long-sleeve shirts, and bags for school children. 

She is making good money from selling, and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. Jacinta is living in a town nearby the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, pants, short-sleeve shirts, long-sleeve shirts, and bags for school children.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is a 40-year-old married woman. 

She has been doing embroidery through a machine at home for the past eight years to support her family. In fact, her husband also does the same work at home, but earns an insufficient income. So, she helps her husband with his tasks related to embroidery.  She sells embroidery dresses in her town. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. She has become an expert in embroidery, through a machine, and wants more raw materials for embroidery so that she can easily cope with the increasing demand for her arts. 

She is a mother of five children.  She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of the revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

Nagina thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Serah is a lady of 32 years. She is married to Joseph and is a mother of two children. She is a tailor and also sells ready-made clothes. She has been in this business for six years now, and she generates a monthly income of 13,500 shillings.

This will be Serah's third loan with VisionFund Kenya. She plans to use the entire loan to buy materials for making clothes and to buy ready made clothes for selling. She wants to educate her children and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making clothes

loans.name: Maqsooda

texts.en:
Maqsooda is a 53-year-old married lady, and she has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, she requested a loan for PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. Once appropriately stocked at this level, she will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand of her customers. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Nazran

texts.en:
Nazran is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been running an animal purchase and sales business for many years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices and raises them, and then her husband sells them out near the occasion of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

Nazran has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Her current request for a loan of PKR 50,000 will be used to purchase two more calves. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Eliecer De Jesús

texts.es:
Eliecer, con 33 años de edad, se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente, inició vendiendo crispetas de manera ambulante, oficio con el que pudo ahorrar durante los años que lo realizó y, desde hace 4 años cambió su labor para dedicarse a prestar el servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, actividad que ha generado los recursos económicos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar y para dar sustento a su esposa y a sus dos hijos, trabaja todos los días de 8 am a 6 pm y genera dos empleos directos.
Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de comprar varios repuestos que requiere para arreglar dos lavadoras que tiene dañadas, con esto podrá mejorar la capacidad instalada y podrá satisfacer la demanda de sus servicios, mejorando así los ingresos para su familia.
Eliecer manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es dejar a sus hijos un buen legado para que no pasen necesidades, por ello quiere acreditar bien su negocio y extender sus servicios a otros barrios aledaños, lo que le permitirá mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio y garantizar una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Eliecer is 33 and has worked as an independent salesman. He started off by selling popcorn as a street vendor, a job where he could save some money during the years he did it. Four years ago he changed his job to do washing-machine rental. This work has generated enough income to meet his household costs and to support his wife and their two children. He works every day from 8am to 6pm, creating two direct jobs.

Eliecer is now asking for a loan in order to buy various spare parts that he needs to repair two damaged washing machines. With the loan he will be able to improve the installed capacity and satisfy demand for his services, thus improving his family's income.

Eliecer states that his great dream is to leave a good legacy to his children so that they are not in need. In order to do this he wants to provide his business with good credit and extend his services to other neighbouring districts, which would allow him to improve the profitability of his business and to guarantee a favourable economic stability to provide his children with better life opportunities.

loans.use: to buy various spare parts that he needs to repair two damaged washing machines.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. 

She is motivated to provide for her family so she wants to grow her business. Currently she's requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. Having this increased stock would help her meet the her customers' increasing demand consistently. Jamila is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 22-year-old married woman. For many years, she has run a business buying and selling livestock. She buys the animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and sells them near the time of Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event in Muslims countries). 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation, Kiva's field partner in the community, and is requesting a loan of 40,000 PRK to purchase two more calves. Farzana is in her 6th loan cycle with good repayment history. She hopes to grow her business, and she dreams of improving her standard of living through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 44-year-old married woman and with her husband has run a business selling milk for many years. She has two cows, a buffalo, and two goats. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk. Every day, Shamshad looks after the cattle and collects their milk, while her husband sells the milk door to door each day. 

Shamshad is the mother of three children and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make greater profits, she requested for a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo so they can cater to more customers. She hopes to increase the milk production capacity, which ultimately helps generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Abid Hussain

texts.en:
Abid Hussain is a hardworking and zealous man; his age is 56 and he lives with his children and parents in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Abid Hussain wants to establish his general store as he has been investing with the help of a previous loan. He is very inspired by Kiva’s field partner’s procedure so he has requested  another loan. His wish is to convert this general store into a utility store. Until his dream comes true, he will constantly depend upon Kiva's support. He is moving towards his achievements step by step; he believes that his destination is not far through the support of Kiva.

He requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so he can expand the space of his general store and can place more sacks of inventories. He hopes that he will make sufficient saving from the profit and he will  succeed in making his dream come true . 

Abid Hussain  thanks  Kiva and hopes that the lenders would support him for his noble aim.

loans.use: To expand the space of his general store.

loans.name: Shanaz

texts.en: Shanaz is 36 years old and is in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. Shanaz makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Shahidah

texts.en: Shahidah is a 44-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their needs - including food, health, clothing, and education. Along with with her husband, Shahidah has been doing the work of agriculture for many years. She harvests wheat and rice and then sells her crops in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Shahidah has applied for a loan of Rs. 50,000 through Kashf foundation. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera is a 37-year-old married woman and the mother of two. She has been running a school for many years. She has gained a good number of students and is respected a lot in her community. She is contributing much to the family income through all of her great efforts. 

In order to accommodate more students in her school, Sumera requested a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase a couple of school benches and chairs along with a new blackboard. She expects more admissions as her school becomes famous in her town. She desires to spend part of the revenues on the expansion of her school.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of school benches and chairs along with a new blackboard.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 46-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. They have two buffaloes for milking and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with the butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happy doing it together to support their family.
 
Suriya and her husband have four daughters and two sons. Five of their children are in school. They need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, Suriya requested a loan of Rs 60,000 to buy another buffalo in order to cater to more customers. They hope to increase their milk-production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo.

loans.name: Nooran

texts.en: Nooran is a 57-year-old married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Nooran’s son, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to cover the family expenses, but now the rickshaw requires proper maintenance to keep it functional. For this reason, Nooran has applied for a loan of Rs 40,000 for her son, who wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Nooran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her son's vehicle.

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en:
Pathani, age 53, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income, however she needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Dúo Lirio De Los Valles Group

texts.es:
DUO LIRIOS DE LOS VALLE
La señorita Floridalma de 39 años, casada,  desde hace dos 2 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en la Alameda, Los Aposentos de Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de la señora Floridalma es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a KIVA; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en:
DUO LIRIOS DE LOS VALLE (Lilies of the Valley Duo)

Floridalma, 39, is married. For two years she has had a tortilla shop located in Alameda in Los Aposentos de Chimaltenango. Due to her efforts, she has been able to establish and improve her housing through her business and has kept moving her family forward.
Floridalma dreams to improve the quality of life for herself and her family through the loan she is requesting from Kiva. She wants to buy corn to continue expanding her tortilla business.

loans.use: to purchase corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Bifotima

texts.en:
Bifotima is a young and purposeful woman. She is married and has a child. 

Bifotima is hardworking and always wanted to organize her own business. She took part in a course, ‘To Get Ahead' from a women’s organization, and got enough skills. She got a certificate. 

Bifotima is going to organize a new business with sewing because she can sew national women’s dresses. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy a sewing machine. She will manage the business alone and provide her service in her house. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Maximilla

texts.en:
Maximilla is a 31-year-old lady from Kakamega. She is a single woman with one child who is two years old.

She operates a grocery, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is applying for her first loan of KES 5,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stock of fruits for sale.

The anticipated profits will be used to buy more sacks of fruits and repay her loan. Her dream is to become a wholesaler and bring up a stable family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits for sale.

loans.name: San Jose De Paullo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE PAULLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de la Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felipa ella es soltera y tiene 48 años y tiene 7 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y también la socia vende verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de agricultura.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the SAN JOSE DE PAULLO community bank live in Calca, a district in Urubamba province.  

Our member, Sra. Felipa is 48-years old, single and the mother of 7 children.  She buys farm animals and produce--onions, carrots and tomatoes, for example--and resells them for a profit.  She buys and fattens guinea pigs and chickens and sells them at local markets.  Sra. Felipa supports her children with the income she makes buying and selling and her hope is that she can grow her business, possibly with a shop where she can meet her customers.  Sra. Felipa is applying for a loan that she will use to buy animals and animal feed.

The other members of the community bank have their own businesses: animals sales; produce sales; grocery businesses; and farms.  

Sra. Felipa wants us to thank you for supporting her goals and says that she is committed to repaying your loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for her animals sales business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items including beer, soda, water, and soap for his retail store.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta nació en la ciudad del Cusco  y vive en la misma ciudad, ella es madre y padre para sus cuatro hijos, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia por lo tanto ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas, hamburguesas, tortas, gaseosas en una academia de la ciudad del Cusco, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo golosinas como por ejemplo galletas, dulces y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Jacinta was born in Cusco and continues to live in this same city. She acts as mother and father to her four children. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who continues to bring her family forward. For this reason, she makes her living selling sweets, hamburgers, cakes, and sodas in an academy in the city of Cusco. For this opportunity, she needs a loan to buy goods such as sweets like cookies, candies, and other things.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as cookies, candy, and more.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es: Emiliana nació en la ciudad del Cusco  y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 47 años de edad y tiene un hijo, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia por lo tanto ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite y ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más.
texts.en: Emiliana was born in Cusco and lives in this same city. She is 47-years-old and has a son. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who brings her family forward through her business selling staple products such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and oil. For this opportunity, she needs a loan to buy merchandise such as bags of rice and other things.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as sacks of rice.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Shushanik and her husband have been involved in retail business for two years. They run a small store where they sell different types of fruits and vegetables, which they buy from nearby villages. Besides selling products in the store, Shushanik's husband also takes their goods to nearby open markets and sells the goods there. 

By applying for this loan, Shushanik asks for financial support to be able to purchase products for their store and also to pay for renovation of the truck, which is seriously damaged. Shushanik has already taken a loan from local financial institution before, but because of the hard financial conditions of her family, wasn't able to pay it back on time. 

However, Shushanik and her husband were able to become financially stable due to their business, ensuring that they will be able to cover the monthly payments of a new loan. Shushanik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

The loan is very important for Shushanik and her husband, and they hope for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for products to resell (fruits and vegetables) and to renovate the truck for transporting the products

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is 20 years old. He has a bright future ahead of him and he dreams of seeing his business established. He lives in Sana`a, Yemen. 

This business is a grocery store, where he has sold groceries in general for many years. He's determined to get ahead and he's dynamic as far as his business goes. 

Walid currently needs to get a loan, because he needs capital in order to stock up his business with various products demanded by his customers. He intends to keep his customers satisfied and, therefore, expand his clientele, which is his main goal. 

He wishes to get a loan of YER 500,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) in order to buy canned foods and soft drinks for his grocery store. That way, he'll increase his profits, so he can support his family and cover household expenses.

loans.use: to buy canned foods and soft drinks for his grocery store.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BENKADI  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  48ans, 3enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, une des -préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution.
Mme DJENEBOU  (1ère à gauche sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt 5 colis de condiments et 100kg de riz. Elle vend quotidiennement au à BOUGOULA et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Benkadi group are married women who, on average, are 48 years old, have three children and all live in large polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their businesses at all times. They are on their seventh loan with the institution. Ms. Djenebou (first to the left in the photo) expects to buy five packages of vegetables for sauces and 100 kilograms of rice. She sells daily in Bougoula and is very sought after, especially on the day of the fair. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for a food-serving business.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BADEYA  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  35 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FARAKO une des -préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités à tout moment. Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution.
Mme AFOU  (1ère à gauche sur la photo) compte acheter avec son prêt 2 colis de condiments. Elle vend quotidiennement au marché et est très sollicitée surtout le jour de foire.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 9.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Badeya group are married women who, on average, are 35 years old, have three children and all live in polygamous families in Farako, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They work with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to run their businesses well at all times. They are on their first loan with the institution. Ms. Afou (first to the left in the photo) expects to buy two packages of vegetables and spices for sauces with her loan. She sells daily at the market and is very sought after, especially on the day of the fair. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 9,000 CFA francs. This profit will allow her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase spices and vegetables for making sauces

loans.name: Laert

texts.en: Laert lives in the village of Akunq in the Aragatsotn region of Armenia. He has been involved in agriculture for many years running a farm, which includes 3 cows, 10 piglets and 40 chickens. Laert also cultivates wheat and grass for feeding the livestock. Agriculture is the only source of income for Laert that helps him to sustain his family's living. Laert lives with his mother, wife and two school-age children. It is very important for him to run his farm successfully and ensure stable monthly income. For that purpose, Laert has applied for this loan to purchase 8 piglets and forage for feeding the livestock. As this is Laert's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. The loan is very important for this hard-working and enthusiastic farmer to enlarge his farming activities and make his farm more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for 8 piglets and forage for feeding his livestock.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra, age 34, is a married woman and the mother of seven children. She has been running a business selling animals with the support of her husband. She buys animals such as baby goats & calves at low prices and after raising them a year or two, she sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her 6th loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. A mother of a 17-year-old daughter, she is engaged in a retail store business. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Rosita is asking for a loan to buy additional commodities to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, and toiletries. With this, she will be able to augment her stock and sell more goods to her customers. Rosita hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional commodities to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, and toiletries

loans.name: Triphine

texts.en: Triphine is 30 years old. She is married with four children. She sells foodstuffs in her stall. With the loan, she would like to add more items such as rice and sugar to her stall.  The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
Mavlyuda is a hardworking woman with higher education. She was born in 1964. She is widow and has four children. 

Mavlyuda has worked for more than six years works at a medical college. She teaches students chemistry and biology. She is smart, and she is one of the best teachers at the college. 

Mavlyuda always wanted her children to get higher education. Her son is a student at the university, and she must pay for her son’s education. She is asking for a loan of 1,500 USD to pay for his education. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education.

loans.name: Maria Rina

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene 46 años casada con dos  hijas una de 10 y 6 años, ella se dedica a la venta de poster, cuadros de variedad de artistas, películas de terror anime, etc., ella vende sus productos en distintas ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la señora Maria,  va a usar este préstamo para compra cuadros al por mayor y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, la señora Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Sra. Maria, 46, is married and the mother of two daughters, 10- and 6-years old, respectively.  She operates a business buying and selling paintings, posters, videos, etc.  She sells her merchandise in various markets around the city of El Alto.  This loan is Sra. Maria's second from the bank and she will use it to buy wholesale stocks of the merchandise she sells.  The investment will increase her income because she can buy larger quantities of merchandise from a wholesaler at a discount and better compete with other similar businesses.  Sra. Maria says that she is grateful for the opportunity that this form of lending delivers.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz, age 55, is from the village of Abuketa. She lives with her husband, grown son and daughter-in-law. The family earns their main income from an agricultural business. Specifically, Nargiz breeds one milking cow and makes cheese for selling as well as for family consumption. She also grows various kinds of vegetables in her greenhouse and sells the harvest at the local open market.

In order to generate a stable monthly income, Nargiz decided to start a grocery store in her village and sell various food products. The family has already built a store and now requests a loan to buy merchandise such as meat and dairy products, oil, pasta, rice and other products. Nargiz and her husband will work as salespersons and serve their clients in a friendly way. The family will earn a monthly income and they will be able to cover household expenses, as well as improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to start a grocery store.

loans.name: Hanya

texts.en: Hanya is a married woman who was born in 1962. She is a mother of 5. Her husband works in construction. She decided to help her husband financially by selling clothes, which she has been doing for 3 years and has found to be profitable. Now she wants to buy a larger quantity of winter clothes to raise her sales as winter is coming to help her husband in covering their children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more winter clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fixed assets and wholesale merchandise to start her business.

loans.name: Diera

texts.en:
Diera is a freshman in the Journalism and Mass Communications Department. This is her story: 
There are many good universities in my city, but I decided to apply to AUCA because I am sure that only this university can give me an unforgettable experience. Many AUCA students that I talk with love the teaching methods, being around motivated students, AUCA’s opinionated president, and that students perform lots of extracurricular activities. 

Journalism and mass communications has always interested me, but I really fell in love with Public Relations because you get to communicate with people of different professions, make new contacts, be creative, go on business trips, and work on interesting and different assignments. Moreover I like that PR-specialists are always looking for new opportunities. I am an active person and do not like to sit in an office with documents and papers. I need to be out and moving around with interesting people.

loans.use: to pay for higher education

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon, tiene 27 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene un hijo y reside en el municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua. Marlon tiene 15 años de dedicarse a la comercialización de cal y piedra de enchape. Vende la cal para uso domestico y para construcciones. además tiene una mini pulpería donde recibe otros ingresos. Con el préstamo que ha solicitado que es por 10,000 Lempiras va pagar mano de obra para la elaboración y preparación de la cal para vender, la vende por libras y por mayor. Tiene como meta hacer un horno con mayor capacidad de producción de cal para aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Marlon, age 27, is in a common-law marriage.  He lives with his wife and their son in the Taulabe municipality in Comayagua.  Marlon has been selling lime powder and paving stones for 15 years.  He sells the lime powder for domestic use and for construction.  He also has a small grocery store from which he gets other income.

He will use the requested loan of 10,000 lempiras to pay for the labor to make and prepare the lime powder for sale.  He sells by the pound and wholesale.  

His goal is to make an oven with greater lime powder production capacity in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to pay for the labor to make and prepare the lime powder for sale.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda was born in 1971 and is married with 9 children.  She lives at a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour. Her husband is retired. 

Huda sells clothing for children and women. She started selling a small amount of clothes and noted that this was a profitable business.  She has decided to expand her merchandise and wants to add cosmetic and food products. She wants to buy a larger quantity of food products in order to raise her profit.  Huda would like to decorate the room where she offers her products so she can attract more customers.  But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more food products for her business.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is a 37-year-old married woman from Kutaisi district. She lives on the first floor of their house with her husband and parents-in-law, who are provided with a retirement pension. Madona's husband is taxi driver, whose income is the only source for the family. Madona is pregnant and is unemployed at the moment. 

Madona decided to start a family business and requested a loan. She wants to renovate the second floor of the house and then rent it out. She needs $3,000 to purchase raw materials and start renovation. 

Her project is profitable, but it needs the support for further development. The local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Her credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

Madona received the credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Madona plans to make the hostel comfortable for her clients and hopes that the business will be profitable.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is applying for a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business.She is married and has run a farming business since 2000.  She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and drugs.  This loan will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and drugs to improve her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer living in the Kitale area of Northrift, Kenya which is known for a high regional output of maize. She is married and has three children, all of whom are of school-going age. Esther has been a farmer for 23 years, where she produces and sells milk, eggs, maize, and vegetables. She enjoys dairy and poultry farming the most. Her greatest challenges are diseases affecting crops and livestock.

Esther chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because she will be able to get funds to purchase assets that will help her improve her farming activities. Her highest monthly expense is school fees, therefore, through the income from this loan, she will be able to cater to her children's school fees and also improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is from the town of Yerevan.  He has been involved in his retail business for already a year.  In one of the city stations, from a rented store, he trades with shoes.  Due to his nice and kind attitude toward people, he has a good number of customers.  Hayk lives together with his parents and feels very responsible to give them appropriate living conditions. 

Hayk has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stock of shoes for reselling in his store. This will enable him to meet the current demand of his customers and gather more income. 

As this is Hayk's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF.  The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who do not have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. 

Hayk will be very grateful to his lenders for support and the loan is really important for his business.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of shoes to resell

loans.name: Melva Rosa

texts.es:
Melva es una mujer activa y emprendedora, madre de 3 hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que tuvo que afrontar el fallecimiento de su esposo, dejándola con la carga económica y con sus tres hijos pequeños. Vivía en el Valle del Cauca y, luego de hacer el duelo por ese doloroso momento, inició su propio negocio de venta de comidas, ya que le era difícil encontrar oportunidades laborales y debía generar recursos para solventar los gastos familiares, poco a poco su negocio fue creciendo y logró abrir una tienda de abarrotes, pero debido a la violencia que se presentaba en la zona, tuvo que trasladarse para la ciudad donde vive actualmente, donde comenzó nuevamente con la venta de comidas desde hace 6 años y así ha logrado generar ingresos para dar educación y sustento a sus hijos.
Con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos desea reiniciar una tienda de abarrotes, aprovechando la ventaja de no poseer competencia en la cuadra donde vive, para ello solicita el crédito con el que comprará vitrinas, estanterías y surtido al por mayor (granos, pastas, chocolate, huevos, lácteos, entre otros), esto le permitirá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo en el que trabajará diariamente de 6:30 am a 10 pm, para prestar un buen servicio a la comunidad.
De esta forma Melva desea seguir luchando para mejorar el bienestar y la calidad de vida de sus hijos, además pretende posicionar su negocio en el sector para que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable.
texts.en:
Melva is an energetic and enterprising woman who is a mother of three children and head of her household, since the death of her husband left her with the economic responsibility for her family.

She lived in the Cauca Valley; and after a painful mourning period, she started her own grocery business, as it was difficult to find work, and she had to provide for her family.  Little by little, her business grew, and she was able to open a grocery store.   But six years ago, violence in the area forced her to move to the city, where she currently lives.  She started over, opening a new grocery business, and this is how she has managed to provide for her children and give them an education.  

With the goal of improving her income, she wants to open a grocery store again, as she sees that there is no competition on her block, and she would like to make the most of this opportunity.

For this reason she is seeking a loan, which she will use to purchase display cabinets, shelving, and wholesale food supplies (grains, pasta, chocolate, eggs, dairy products, and other similar items). This will make it possible for her to establish her business, where she will work every day from 6:30 a.m. until 10 p.m., in order to provide good service to her community.  

This is the way that Melva wants to continue striving to improve her children’s quality of life and well-being.  In addition, she will try to locate her business in the zone that would guarantee favorable economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase display cabinets, shelving, and wholesale food supplies (grains, pasta, chocolate, eggs, dairy products, and similar items).

loans.name: José Rodrigo

texts.es:
José es un campesino trabajador y humilde, a sus 54 años de edad, es casado y padre de 7 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde que era pequeño aprendió las labores del campo, las mismas que hoy en día le permiten generar ingresos y se han convertido en su alternativa de vida, actualmente se dedica a la producción lechera, cuyo líquido es vendido en el mercado o a los vecinos que poseen tanques de frío, así logra generar recursos para llevar el sustento diario a su hogar. 
Con el ánimo de salir adelante con su familia, José encuentra en el crédito una posibilidad para mejorar su negocio, pues con el dinero comprará dos vacas productoras de leche, así aprovechará al máximo el terreno con pastos que posee y podrá aumentar la producción, dando como resultado un mayor nivel de ventas e ingresos para su familia.
José manifiesta que su propósito es darle continuidad a su labor y dejar un buen legado para que sus hijos también sigan con la tradición familiar, pues esto le ha brindado todo lo que hoy en día posee y nunca les ha faltado el sustento; sin embargo, manifiesta que desea ampliar sus cabezas de ganado para garantizar una estabilidad económica y brindar educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jose is a hardworking and humble farm worker.  He is 54 years old, married, and the father of seven children whom he has gotten ahead with great effort and dedication.

He learned to work in the fields, the same work that allows him to generate income now, when he was very young.  This has become his way of life and he currently produces milk, which he sells in the market and to the residents who have cold tanks.  He is able to generate resources to support his household.

With a motivation to get ahead with his family, Jose sees an opportunity to improve his business with this loan.  He will use the money to buy two dairy cows and take advantage of the pastures he has so he can increase his production.  This will increase his sales and family income.

Jose says that he wants to provide continuity to his work and leave a good legacy to his children and continue with the family tradition because this has provided everything he has and they have never been in need of support.  However he says that he wants to increase the number of heads of livestock to guarantee financial stability and provide an education for his children.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Miladis

texts.es:
Miladis es una mujer activa, dinámica y trabajadora, a sus 47 años de edad tiene su propio negocio con el que genera ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar y para dar sustento a sus dos hijos.
Tiene una miscelánea en la que vende ropa, productos de belleza, accesorios, y además vende productos por catálogo, de esta forma trabaja diariamente sin descuidar su hogar.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor (ropa, accesorios, productos de belleza), esto le permitirá ofrecer más variedad de artículos y así satisfacer los gustos y requerimientos de su clientela, logrando un aumento en las ventas y en el margen de utilidades que recibe.
Miladis manifiesta que su principal anhelo es acreditar y fortalecer aún más su negocio, para mejorar la rentabilidad y así tener la capacidad para dar educación universitaria a sus hijos, mejorar la calidad de vida y bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Miladis is an active, dynamic and hard-working woman who at 47 years old has her own business. With it she earns the income needed to support her husband with the financial burden of the family and to provide for her children. She has a shop where she sells clothing, beauty products, accessories and also sells products from catalogs. She can do this without having to neglect her home.

With the aim of strengthening her business Miladis has requested a loan to buy stock wholesale (clothing, accessories and beauty products). This will allow her to offer a greater variety of articles and satisfy the tastes and demands of her customers. This will increase her sales and the margin of profits she earns. 

Miladis says that her main goal is to strengthen and position her business to increase it's profitability. Then she will be able to provide university education for her children and improve the family's quality of living and well-being.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (clothing, accessories and beauty products).

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
Emad is 24 years old. He lives with his wife and his child in Gaza.

He has a poultry farm, and he earns a monthly income of US $455. He started his business in 2011.

He needs this youth loan to expand his yard, buy poultry feeds, a cage for producing eggs, and build a drinking system for his chickens, which will help him to improve his financial conditions so that he can support the needs of his family and reinvest in his business.

His dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life. Emad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to expand his yard, buy poultry feeds, a cage for producing eggs, and to build a drinking system for his chickens.

loans.name: Dabash Group

texts.en: This group is called Dabash and consists of 4 members. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They are working hard so that they can achieve their goals. Zahra is 35 years old and is the president of the group.  She sells clothes, perfumes and other items. She says that she began with a small business and, thanks to sacrifice and daily hard work, has been able to grow and continually improve her business. She is asking for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to purchase ladies' clothes, perfumes and incenses in order to be able to continue her business. She hopes to one day run a clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' clothes, perfumes and incenses in order to be able to continue her business.

loans.name: Sandra Nohemi

texts.es: Sandra Nohemí tiene actualmente 28 años de edad y desde hace más de 10 años tiene una venta de artículos de plástico en el exterior del mercado municipal de San Martin Jilotepeque. En su venta ella ofrece escobas plásticas, baños de diferentes tamaños. Sillas, bancos, y muchos artículos más. Hace 4 meses dio a luz a su primer hijo y esto la ha motivado aún más a seguir trabajando para darle lo mejor a su pequeño bebe. Sandra sueña con tener más productos surtir más y así poder ofrecerle sus clientes variedad y estilos, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en plastico,esperando nuevamente su apoyo.
texts.en:
Sandra Nohemí, age 28, has been selling plastic goods outside of the San Martin Jilotepeque municipal market for ten years.  She sells plastic brooms, different size tubs, chairs, benches, and many more items.

Four months ago she gave birth to her first child.  This has motivated her even more to continue working in order to give her little baby the best.

Sandra dreams of having more products to stock up on.  This way she will be able to offer her customers variety and different styles.  She is requesting this loan to buy more plastic merchandise.  She is hoping for your support once again.

loans.use: to buy plastic merchandise.

loans.name: Iris

texts.en:
Iris is a 35-year-old lady from Kakamega and married to Wenslans, who is a civil servant. They have three children ages 12, 10, and 7 respectively.
 
She operates a salon and a barber shop, a business she’s done for two years now, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. She is taking out a loan of KES 10,000, her first loan with Vision Fund Kenya to use in buying a blowdrier and chemicals. 

She will use her profits to expand her kinyozi. She has a dream of bringing up a happy family.

loans.use: to buy a blowdrier and chemicals.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella tiene 34 años de edad y tiene tres hijos, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia por lo tanto ella se dedica a alquilar carros y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de los carros.
texts.en: Gladys was born in the city of Quillabamba, but she lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  She is 34 years old and has three children.  She is an enterprising and hard-working woman, who gets her family ahead.  In order to do so, she rents cars.  She now needs the loan to perform maintenance on the cars.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on the cars that she rents.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia is from Getafe, Bohol and is a  married woman with six children . Crescencia has been  employed in a fishing business with her husband for several years now. This is the source of her income.

Crescencia asks for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. With these purchases, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell.

In the future, Crescencia dreams of improving their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Veronica Beatriz

texts.es:
Verónica, es una joven de 22 años de edad, es casada y tienen un hijo de 2 años, ella aprendió de su madre el oficio de confeccionar ropa para ambos sexos, desde hace tres años atiende su sastrería a tiempo completo. No ha tenido ningún problema en atenderlo.
Con el capital comprara telas, zippers, botones hilos, broches, etc., ya que son los materiales necesarios para cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes, espera agilizar su trabajo, satisfacer a sus clientes, aumentar sus ingresos y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Sueña con hacer crecer su negocio para seguir aportando en los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Veronica is 22 years old, married and has a two year old son.  She learned to make men’s and women’s clothing from her mother, has had her tailor shop for three years, and serves customers full time.  She has not had any problems with her business.

She will use the money from this loan to buy fabric, zippers, buttons, thread, clips, etc. because this is what she needs to meet her customer demand.  She expects to speed up her work, satisfy her customers, increase her income, and pay off her debt.

She dreams of growing her business so she can continue paying her family expenses.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 37-year-old hard-working housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, three daughters, and one son. Her husband is a plumber by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to fulfill the household expenses of his family. Therefore, from the past four years, in addition to his profession of plumbing, he also drives a taxi at night. 

But currently he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its' engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. 

Fozia has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for the amount to repair the engine of her husband's taxi. 

With the profit, her husband wants to buy a new taxi in the future. Fozia desires to provide a quality education to all her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business. 

She is very much thankful to Brac.

loans.use: To pay for repairing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en: Ahlam was born in 1982. She is married and has 2 daughters. Her husband is a truck driver. Ahlam has been raising goats and selling their products for 5 years. She started her project selling a few goats and she found it profitable. Ahlam has been facing a problem with feeding her goats as their food is expensive to her. For this reason, she has applied for this loan to bring suitable food to her goats.

loans.use: to buy food for her goats

loans.name: Ilarion

texts.en:
Ilarion is a 46-year-old married man. He lives in a small village called Gordi, in Khoni district. Ilarion has a retired wife, a married son, daughter-in-law and grandchild. 

He has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood when his parents were farmers.   Dairy farming is a traditional activity for the family.  Ilarion has 6 cows and 6 calves. His wife milks the cows everyday and produces cheese to sell. His son is an artisan and gets orders, but his income isn't stable. 

Ilarion decided to start another business to increase the family income. He wants to buy a mini bus to serve the local people. Ilarion applied for the credit with MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of 3,000 GEL will help him to buy a mini bus. 

He thinks this business will be profitable and will give the family an opportunity to live better.

loans.use: to buy a mini bus to serve the local people.

loans.name: Hamse Sicid

texts.en:
Hamse Sicid AwAdan is 20 years old. He studies at the University of Hargeisa, Faculty of Information Technology. 

He needs a laptop to prepare lessons. He requested a laptop from Kaaba as a loan, and now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Hamse will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy items like sugar, washing soaps, cooking oil, rice, and many other things

loans.name: Reshman

texts.en:
Reshman is a 44-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband provides services of whitewash to his customers. He stands in the bazaar with other laborers to look after the customers for providing services. 

Her husband got a new contract for whitewash, but he does not have paint to provide services. Due to lack of funds, Reshman is compelled to take a loan so that her husband can buy paint to keep continuing his services. 

She wants to change this condition of her family and hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her.

She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy cans of paint for whitewash services.

loans.name: Las Lagitas Group

texts.es:
Onaly, tiene 37 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos con su esposa con quien vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias, Lempira. Onaly siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura en el cultivo de maíz y frijoles, tiene sus propias parcelas desde hace 10 años y la producción la vende en la misma zona donde vive. El préstamo solicitado es el tercer ciclo en forma grupal y es por 3,500 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar fertilizantes y abonos para el cultivo de maíz. Los prestamos le han ayudado a mejorar el cultivo y poder vivir mejor con la familia. 
El grupo se llama Las Lagitas que esta formado por 5 personas, quienes viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. Ellos han solicitado un préstamo grupal que suma 17,500 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y darle mantenimiento al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. En la foto esta a la izquierda Esly, Alfredo, Elsy, María y Onaly a la derecha.
texts.en:
Onaly, 37, and his wife have two children.  They live in the rural town of Gracias, Lempira.  Onaly has long made his living from farming maize and beans.  He has owned his land for 10 years and sells what he grows to local buyers.  He will use this 3,500-lempira loan, included in his community bank's third round of funding, to buy fertilizer and manure for his next maize crop.  Past loans have helped him to grow his business and better provide for his family.  
Onaly's community bank, called Las Lagitas, has 5 members, all of whom are local farmers.  They are borrowing a total of 17,500 lempiras that they will divide up to support their own farming businesses.  The members, from left to right in the photo, are Esly, Alfredo, Elsy, Maria and Onaly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for maize farming business.

loans.name: Khawla

texts.en:
Khawla is a divorced woman who was born in 1973. She lives in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour.
