Khawla has been selling kids and women's clothing, in addition to cosmetic products, for two years. She started her project selling a small amount of clothes. She found her project profitable after that, so she decided to add food products to her sales to expand. 

Now she is seeking to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of food products and winter clothes to raise her profit and income to support herself, as she is living alone. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. This is the reason she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and food products for her business

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en:
Nahla was born in 1976. She is married, and a mother of 13 living in a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Her husband is a carpenter. 

Nahla has been running her home mini-market for 1 1/2 years. She started her project selling a small amount of food products; she found her project profitable after that, so she decided to add accessories and home products to her sales in the future to expand her sales. 

Now she is seeking to buy a larger quantity of food products, and to merchandise her mini-market to raise her profit and to be a good financial support for her family. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of food items and merchandise her mini-market

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is a married woman with four children. She describes herself to be strong, determined and God fearing. She operates a farm where she rears chickens and also dairy cows for milk production. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents.

Dorine will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy another dairy cow to increase milk production. Her business goal is to have three more dairy cows and more poultry within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of animal feed

loans.use: buy a another dairy cow to increase milk production.

loans.name: Consuelo Alejandrina

texts.es:
Consuelo Alejandrina tiene 36 años de edad estado civil es soltera tiene tres hijas  de 17, 15 y 3 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC SAN FRANCISCO, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

Consuelo Alejandrina se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para sembrar el maíz. El sueño es comprar un terreno. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar pelota.
texts.en:
Consuelo Alejandrina is 36 years old and is a single mother of three daughters, ages 17, 15 and 3. They live in Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

She is a member of VRC San Francisco, which is located in the Recinto Pantano, and belongs to the Cantón Ventanas and its primary economic activities are agriculture and livestock. 

Consuelo Alejandrina works in agriculture and grows corn. She is asking for a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer. With the help from the loan, she will be able to purchase all she needs in order to cultivate her corn. Her dream is to purchase her own land. The challenges she faces include the plagues that effect her crops. In her free time, she likes to play ball.

loans.use: purchase supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is a 52-year-old, married man from a small village near Qalqilia city. He lives with his wife and four children, three sons and one daughter, in a simple house. 

Mousa sells used items, like furniture and electrical machines. This store was opened ten years ago. It is a good business, but with a nonstable income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mousa would like to improve his store and expand it.

Mousa took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy more used products for his store to resell. By taking this loan, Mousa's store will be improved and his sales will increase. 

Mousa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more used products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen lives in Jermuk town of Vayots Dzor region. He lives with his wife and two-year-old son.  From the rented garage in Jermuk town, Karen provides vehicle repair for locals. For the last year, he works on one or two autos each day and earns a living for his family. Karen is the only breadwinner in the family, so he works hard to sustain his family’s living.

Karen has applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed for his vehicle repair service. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Karen is very grateful to lenders for support.

loans.use: to buy tools and materials for his vehicle repair service.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia vive en casa de sus padres  en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la localidad del Palomar de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña es de artesana ella se dedica al tejido de aguayos y taris. Silvia necesita el crédito para la compra de ganado vacuno y así poder obtener mayores ingresos y poder cubrir  los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Silvia es alpiar su taller de tejido y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Silvia lives with her parents in brick house with a cement floor, located in the Palomar neighborhood of La Paz. She weaves carriers and other things.  Silvia needs this loan to buy cows so she can increase her income and cover her household expenses.

Silvia dreams of growing her workshop and having a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Dildora

texts.en: Dildora was born in 1992. She is young and a hardworking woman. Dildora is not married and lives with her parents. She has her own business growing crops and vegetables. Dildora sows crops 2 times in a year. She mainly sows wheat. Dildora works hard to earn a living as her parents are poor, and she must help them to provide the family with food. She must sow crops but she does not have money to buy fertilizers and seeds. She is asking for a loan of 1200 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is married and the mother of five children. She is from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. For the past five years, she has run a sari-sari (convenience) store, and she is also a dressmaker. Her husband is a fisherman. Narcisa sells various goods and items to the people in her area.

Narcisa is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell, such as rice, canned goods, and soda, along with materials for sewing, such as cloth and thread. With this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as rice, canned goods, and soda, along with materials for sewing, such as cloth and thread

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her university degree and post-graduate studies.

loans.name: María Gloria

texts.es: Doña María Gloria es originaria del área de Chimaltenango y desde hace más de 6 años posee una tienda de consumo en la cual ofrece a sus clientes artículos de consumo diario como lo son: azúcar, frijol, arroz, maíz, pan, golosinas. Doña gloria junto a su esposo han procreado 4 niños y han luchado para darles estudio a sus cuatro niños. Doña Gloria está muy contenta porque gracias a su negocio tiene ingresos para poder cubrir sus gastos. El sueño de Gloria es que sus hijos se lleguen a graduar y  gracias al apoyo de Fape y Kiva lo está logrando. Solicita el crédito para poder surtir más su tienda y así aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria Gloria is from Chimaltenango and for more than 6 years she has owned and operated a grocery store. She offers her customers food products such as sugar, beans, rice, corn, bread, and treats.  

Gloria and her husband have 4 children and they struggle to provide them with a good education.  Gloria is happy because thanks to her business, she has an income to cover the household expenses.  Her dream is that her children graduate from school.  Thanks to the help of Fape and Kiva, this is coming true.  

She is seeking a loan so that she can stock her store and increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy food products for sale.

loans.name: Kapitoline

texts.en:
Kapitoline is 33 years old. She is a mother of five children and three of them go to school. 

She sells different items in her boutique, and she wants this loan to be used for adding more items, mainly maize flour and rice. 

The profits from the business will be used for renovating the house.

loans.use: To buy more maize flour and rice to sell.

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma is a 35-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, along with her family. She is the mother of five children. Three of them go to school, and one of her sons helps in cattle farming. Her husband is a cattle trader and does most of his trading from within his home area. He breeds cattle in his yard at home and sells it at a local market. He has to feed the calf for one or two years until it is grown up and healthy, which is a very lengthy and expensive procedure. 

Her husband wants to buy a heifer to keep the breeding procedure constant, but he already invested all his savings into his current cattle farm. Therefore, Najam requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy a bull calf and heifer for cattle farming. 

Fetal diseases are the major challenge for them. She hopes that she will pay all the installments on time. With their profits, her husband will buy fodder for cattle and cures for diseases.

Najam is very pleased after taking out this loan and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf and heifer for the cattle farm

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a 39-year-old lady from Kakamega who is married to Ezekiel, and they have five children, ages 18, 13, 10, 8, and 6 respectively.

She operates a food stall, a business she has done for the last 10 years, earning an income of KES 2,000 monthly. She is taking out a third loan of KES 10,000 with Vision Fund Kenya, which she will use to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits to add to the business. 

The profits will be used to repay her loan. Her dream is to educate her children to high levels and run a successful business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Kefah

texts.en:
Kefah, who was born in 1973, is married and the mother of 4. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Salt. Her husband is retired. 

Kefah currently works at a hospital and also has been selling detergents from her house for 2 years. She started her project by selling a small amount of detergents and found it profitable. She is now seeking to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of the needed materials for making detergents, so as to be more productive and to be a good financial support for her family. Since she doesn't have enough money to do so, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy the needed materials for making detergents

loans.name: Beneric Community Based Development Foundation Group

texts.en:
Betty (pictured in the front-middle) is a member of this group. She is a farmer who primarily raises and harvests maize and beans. However, Betty is challenged by the uneven and changing weather, limited capital to invest in agriculture and the poor transport network to the markets. In addition to farming, Betty operates a retail shop, which she started to boost the income of the family, in her village. 

Betty is a single mother with three children, all of whom attend school. She has five dependents, including her elderly mother. Betty is requesting a loan to add into her agricultural efforts this season so that she can realize a good return from her harvest at the end of the season. This will put her in position to meet the educational costs of her children and to supply their other basic needs. Betty's dream is eventually to have a permanent residential house and to ensure her children's education through higher institutions of learning.

loans.use: to buy seedlings

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence, 33 years old, is married and has three children. She sells cosmetics and has been in the business for the past two years. Gaudence wants to use this loan to buy more cosmetic products for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy the family medical insurance.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is 42 years old, and he lives with his family in Stepanavan in the Lori region. Armen has a daughter (school-aged) and a son who is a student, who in the future will become a lawyer. His wife works at the kindergarten. 

It has been already 20 years that Armen, together with his parents, has been engaged in cattle breeding. He has his own barn where he keeps 20 cows, and he sells a great amount of milk. He sells it to different dairy-products factories. 

He says that to take care of this kind of big farm is very difficult, but hard work gives its results in the form of a good income. Armen has gathered a lot of hay for his farm cattle for winter, but he says that it will be enough only for half of his farm cattle.

He asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy enough fodder for his farm cattle to keep them fed during the winter.

loans.use: to buy enough fodder for his farm cattle to keep them fed during the winter.

loans.name: Shakila Naz

texts.en:
Shakila Naz is a 23-year-old housewife who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a heart patient and she always worries about his health. 

For 16 years, Shakila Naz's husband has run a vegetable and fruit shop, which is the family's only source of income. All of the children are studying.

Shakila Naz has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Brac Pakistan, to help her husband in purchasing some seasonal fruits and vegetables for his shop. As they have no other source of income, this loan will help her husband to continue his business and to use the net profit to open a new shop in the central bazaar.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 26-year-old single man who describes himself as determined and cooperative. He runs a taxi business and has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are local residents. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy spare parts for his taxi. His business goal is to have more cars within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a good business man with various businesses. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insecurity. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 35-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife in a simple house. He works as an employee in a local firm where he receives a low wage. This is the only source of income for the family. Ahmad and his wife would like to have children and are looking to take all the needed treatments for becoming pregnant. Ahmad took a loan from FATEN to help him pay health expenses related to IVF to increase the chances of his wife becoming pregnant.

loans.use: to pay the health expenses related to IVF/pregnancy issues.

loans.name: Diaa

texts.en:
Diaa is a 32-year-old married man from a small village near Nablus city. He lives with his wife and one small son in a simple house. Diaa has raised sheep in his farm for three years.  It is a good business but with an unstable income. Since this is the only source of income for the family, Ahmad would like to improve his farm by expanding it.

Diaa took a loan from FATEN  to buy more sheep for his farm. By taking this loan, Diaa's farm productivity will increase.

loans.use: to buy more sheep for his farm.

loans.name: Fanice

texts.en:
Fanice is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as ambitious and "a go-getter." She operates a retail business where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for five years. She also owns a tailoring business, where she makes and repairs torn clothes. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is that many customers prefer buying on credit.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more milk for selling, and a sewing machine. Her business goal is to be a leading milk vendor within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be wealthy. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, and more milk to sell

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Elena  tiene 37 años de edad es soltera vive con la familia  con los padres y con el hermano en el Cantón  Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla V.R.C.  Virgen de Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la Parroquia Puerto  Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo esta ventanilla se dedica  a  labores agropecuarias.( siembra de maiz. arroz)

Elena se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz y a la crianza de gallinas.Solicita el crédito para la copra de semillas, fertilizantes, urea y morocho para las gallinas.

 Las compras se realiza en el  Cantón Ventanas cada 15 dias.

Su sueño es comprar mejorar la produccion para que la cosecha sea productiva.

El desafío que enfrenta son combatir con las plagas y enfermedades. En el tiempo libre le gusta reunirse con los hermanos para conversar.
texts.en:
Elena is 37 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and her brother in Ventanas canton in the province of Los Rios. She is a member of the 'Virgen de Guadalupe' communal bank which is located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche, part of Pueblo Viejo canton. The members of this group work in agriculture, growing corn and rice. 

Elena grows corn and rice and raises chickens. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and corn for the chickens. She makes her purchases every fortnight in Ventanas. Her dream is to increase her production so that her harvests are plentiful. The challenges she faces are infestations and diseases. In her spare time she likes to get together with her siblings and talk.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea, and corn for her chickens.

loans.name: Mariela Annabelle

texts.es:
Mariela tiene 27 años de edad es de estado civil unión libre tiene 3 hijos vive con la familia en el Cantón Ventanas  Provincia Los Ríos.

Es integrante de ventanilla Virgen De Guadalupe que se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

Mariela se dedica a la venta de arroz, maíz, a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de gallinas.Solicita el crédito para la siembra de maíz, compra de insumos, semillas fertilizantes insecticidas.

Las compras lo realizan  en el Cantón Ventanas   frecuentemente.Su sueño es mejorar la producción para aumentar los ingresos. El desafío que enfrenta es combatir con las plagas sobre todo con la langosta. En los tiempos libres le gusta cuidar y educar alos hijos.
texts.en:
Mariela is 26 years old. She is in a common-law marriage and has 3 children. She lives with her family in Ventanas canton, in the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the Virgen De Guadalupe communal bank, which is located in the Puerto Pechiche parish in the Pueblo Viejo canton. 

Mariela works selling rice and corn, growing corn, and raising chickens. She is requesting a loan to grow corn and to buy supplies such as: seed, fertilizers and insecticides. She frequently does her shopping in Ventanas canton. Her dream is to improve her crop production so she can increase her earnings. The challenge she faces is to fight against pest, especially locusts. In her free time she likes to teach and take care of her children.

loans.use: plant corn, purchase supplies such as: seed, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio, es separado no tiene hijos dependientes, vive en casa de su hermano la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundaria. Actualmente trabaja de chofer -propietario del Sindicato Señor de Lagunas en la ciudad de El Alto. 
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad (tren delantero ,compra de llantas ,etc).
El sueño de Gregorio es comprar otra movilidad y tener  mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Gregorio is separated and doesn’t have any dependent children.  He lives in his brother’s house, located in the Villa Ingenio area of El Alto.

He has a middle school education and currently works as a private driver for the “Señor de Lagunas” union in El Alto.

He needs this loan to perform maintenance on his vehicle (front drive train, tires, etc.)

Gregorio’s dream is to buy another vehicle and have a better income.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Dúo Amor De Los Amores Group

texts.es:
DUO AMOR DE LOS AMORES
Doña Teresa, es originaria de tecpan, tiene 46 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad estan sus 2 hijos menores de edad, ella  se dedica a la compra y venta de laurel y a la crianza de animales.
Desde hace algunos años ella ha empezado con su propio negocio,  gracias al apoyo de sus hijos ella sigue adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar más su negocio para obtener mejores  ganancias y asi mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de laurel por mayor ella ya a trabajado tres creditos anteriores y no cayo en mora.
texts.en:
DUO AMOR DE LOS AMORES 

Teresa is from Tecpan. She is 46 years old and takes care of her two minor children. She buys and sells laurel and raises animals. Some years ago she started her own business, thanks to her children’s support she continues ahead.

Her dream is to expand her business to obtain better earnings and therefore send her children to school. 

At this time, she is requesting this loan to purchase laurel at wholesale. She has had three previous loans which did not default.

loans.use: to purchase laurel to sell.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 38-year-old married woman who started baking the special traditional Lebanese bread eight years ago to help her husband in making a living and covering their needs, since she is responsible for the care of three additional members of her family.

Zeinab learned this business from her mother, who was skilled in this domain, since a long time ago they used to bake their own bread for living. She is very talented in her specialty and provides her customers a special taste.

Zeinab is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise by buying a large quantity of flour and necessary raw ingredients to make sure that she'll stay ready for the increase in customers' needs during the coming winter and Holy Christmas seasons.

She hopes to keep on developing her business and to open another branch in the future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a large quantity of flour and necessary raw ingredients to make sure that she'll stay ready for increasing customers' needs, especially during the coming winter and Holy Christmas seasons.

loans.name: Jennifer Isabel

texts.es: Jennifer es una joven muy trabajadora y comprometida con ella misma, soltera, trabaja como enfermera general y su actividad comercial es venta de Ropa, Accesorios, Bisuteria y Zapatos, habita en el municipio de la Concepcion junto a sus padres. el credito lo solicita para invertir en su negocio ya que en estas fechas dicembrinas sus ganancias aumentan un poco y desea aprovechar la afluencia de los clientes, Agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Jennifer is a hard-working and responsible young woman. She is single and works as a general nurse.  She also sells clothing, accessories, jewelry, and shoes.  She lives in Concepcion with her parents.  

She is seeking a loan to invest in her business because in December she can take advantage of the increase in demand due to the holidays, and therefore she can increase her income.  She is thankful to Kiva and Afodenic for the support that they are providing her.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, and accessories.

loans.name: Umitoy

texts.ru: Добрый человек, который всегда старается улучшить условию проживания, и надеется на светлое будущее, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Умитой.  Ей 45 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более 15 лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Благодаря хорошему состоянию скота, она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A kind person, who is always trying to improve her living conditions and who hopes for a brighter future, needs financial support. Her name is Umitoy. She is 45 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in a rural area and has a good opportunity to expand her cattle business. She has more than 15 years of experience raising cattle and has loyal customers thanks to the quality and health of her cattle. She wants to expand her business and earn a larger income in order to improve her living conditions. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila nació en la ciudad del Cusco  y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 50 años de edad y tiene tres hijos, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia por lo tanto ella se dedica a la venta de leche y ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar leche.
texts.en:
Lucila was born and lives in Cuzco. She is 50 years old and has three children. She is an enterprising and hard working woman who gets her family ahead by selling milk. 

At this time, she is requesting a loan to purchase milk.

loans.use: to purchase milk.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is 30 years old, a male and married. He has two children ages 1 and 5 years old who he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer and he has a workshop which has lasted for six years now. In his business he earns a monthly income of 9150 KES. He is taking his first loan of 10,000 KES which he intends to use to add stock to his business by buying more wood. Amos will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for the future of his business and family are to expand his workshop and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more wood to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nely

texts.es: Doña Nely, tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, vive en el municipio de Santa Rita, Yoro junto a su esposo e hijos. Hace 4 años tiene su propia tiendita de novedades. Vende juguetes para niños y niñas, colitas y ganchos para niñas, peluches, y cosméticos. Actualmente ha solicitado un préstamo por 25,000 lempiras para surtir de juguetes para niños y aprovechar la temporada de navidad. Su plan es aumentar la clientela para que su negocio logre estabilidad y con las ganancias poder ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nely is 51 years old, she is married, and she lives in Santa Rita, Yoro with her husband and their children.  For 4 years she has owned and operated a small novelty store.  She sells children's toys, hair accessories for girls, stuffed animals, and cosmetics.  

She is seeking a loan for 25,000 lempiras to stock children's toys and get ready for the holiday season. Her plan is to grow her customer base so that her business becomes stable and with the earnings she will be able to help her children.

loans.use: to stock her business with children's toys and to sell them this holiday season.

loans.name: Tugaigahare Group

texts.en:
Scovia is married and has three children, aged 7, 9 and 12, who are all in school. She has a restaurant business which she started in the year 2009 with high hopes that it would generate enough income to cater for the needs of her family. Scovia also sells bananas which forms her other source of income. Her business is located in Ishaka Town in Bushenyi District and her clients are mainly people in and around Bushenyi. 

She would like to use the loan to buy bananas for trade so that her profits can be better than they have always been. Scovia describes herself as a hard working and honest woman who has seen the business grow from one level to another. She is mainly challenged by the high taxes which she pays but she strongly believes that this will stop being a problem if the loan is given and she gets increased profits. 

Her hopes for the future include giving her children the best education so that they can compete with others for better positions and jobs in future.

loans.use: To buy bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients.

loans.name: Julia Evelyn

texts.es: Julia, tiene 29 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con su madre en una colonia del municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de comida, pero hace 3 años logro establecer su propio negocio de un salón de belleza, donde presta el servicio de corte de pelo, tintes, secado, alisado, tratamientos faciales y otros, también vende productos como cremas, champú, tintes, tratamientos y otros. Esta salón lo tiene en su casa y lo ha mantenido mediante la inversión de varios prestamos. Actualmente solicita el séptimo ciclo que es por 5,000 lempiras, para surtir el negocio de cremas, champú, lociones, tintes, tratamientos y otros cosméticos para uso y venta y obtener mas ingresos. Tiene como meta hacer crecer su negocio y poder comprar una casa.
texts.en:
Julia, 29, is single and lives with her mother in a neighbourhood in the municipality of Choloma, Cortes. Previously she worked in food sales but 3 years ago she managed to establish her own business, a beauty salon, where she offers haircuts, colour, blow-dry, hair straightening, facials among other services. She also sells products such as creams, shampoos, hair colour, treatments etc... The salon is located in her house and she has maintained it through the investment of various loans. 

Now she is requesting her seventh loan for 5,000 "lempiras" (Honduran currency) to stock her business with creams, shampoos, lotions, hair colour, treatments and other cosmetic products for use and sale and obtain a better income. Her goal is to grow her business and be able to buy a house.

loans.use: to stock her business with creams, shampoos, lotions, hair colour, treatments and other cosmetic products for use and sale.

loans.name: Al-Najm Group

texts.en:
The Al-Najm group consists of four hardworking women from Sana`a, Yemen. They have requested a group loan and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Fatima is a very active woman from a poor family. Her father is employed and gets a small salary that is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Fatima's father works hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothing. Fatima would like to buy some items for home improvement, but she doesn`t have money. She decided to apply for a loan from AMB to buy furniture and home appliances in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will allow her and her family to feel comfortable so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to buy furniture and home appliances in order to improve the living conditions in her house.

loans.name: Azeza

texts.en:
Azeza, age 58, is a married woman and the mother of six children. Her husband has been successfully running a small toy shop in his community. He offers a variety of toys at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who often shop at his store. Mostly children are attracted to his shop; they insist their parent buy the toys. 

To fully stock the shop, Azeza has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will use the loan to buy more toys to sell in order to meet the increasing demand consistently. Azeza wishes to use part of the revenues to increase business capital. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy toys to resell

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina, who was born in 1980, is married and the mother of 2. She lives in a sector of Jordan called Salt. 

Dina has been selling cosmetic products and perfumes from her house for 2 years. She started her project by selling a small amount of items. She is now seeking to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of cosmetic products and perfumes to raise her sales and to be a good financial support for her family.  Since she doesn't have enough money to do so, Dina has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products to sell

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a widowed man. He has 6 children. He describes himself as stable. 

He operates a retail business where he sells cereals. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are local residents. 

He will use the KES 13,900 loan to buy a gas cooker for his family to use. This will enable them to cook efficiently. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker.

loans.name: Azat

texts.en:
Azat rents a small place in Gyumri's city market where he trades in walnuts, hazelnuts and almonds. Due to Azat's hard work and kind attitude toward people, he was able to gain many clients. 

He lives together with his wife and two little children. As the only breadwinner of the family, Azat realizes the importance of this retail business for the family’s living. He has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase new stock of walnuts, hazelnuts and almonds for reselling to his customers.

Azat has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Azat will be very grateful to his lenders for support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of walnuts, hazelnuts and almonds for reselling to customers

loans.name: Rositas De Chijipina Alta Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSITAS DE CHIJIPINA ALTO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por diez  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Modesta es la Presidenta. El negocio que tienen las integrantes de la asociación comunal es la venta de leche, así mismo unas se apoyan con la elaboración de ollas de barro y tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Modesta es integrante, ella indica que hace es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ollas de barro; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que el mismo fue un negocio familiar, posterior a tener su primer hijo decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de horno) que adquirirá de las comunidades del departamento de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene nueve hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Rositas de Chijipina Alto" communal bank will start their first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional office.  The group is made up of 10 members, and it is led by a board of directors of which Modesta is the president.  The members of the communal bank have a business selling milk, but some of them also support themselves by making clay pots and weaving blankets.

The loan that they are requesting will be used to help small businesses in which Modesta is a member.  Modesta says that this is the first time that they have joined Pro Mujer, having been invited by a sponsor from the institution who visited her at her home.

Currently, she has a business selling clay pots.  She learned this trade from her parents, as it was a family business.  After having her first child, she decided to start her own business. 

The loan that she is seeking will be used to increase her working capital by purchasing an oven which she will acquire from a community in the La Paz district.  She will then sell her products in her store.  This type of work allows her to earn an income to support her family, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has nine children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training that they offer.

loans.use: purchase an oven.

loans.name: Los Triunfadores De Pomacanchi Group

texts.es:
La socia Maria pertenece al banco comunal LOS TRIUNFADORES DE POMACANCHI, el banco se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Pomacanchi, provincia de Acomayo y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 49 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la agricultura, la socia cultiva granos como trigo, cebada entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta formas que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y abono para su chacra.
Los demas socios se dedican a la venta de artesania,venta de pan,venta de muebles,venta de carnes rojas y bodega.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Maria is part of the "Los Triunfadores de Pomacanchi" communal bank.  The bank is located in the Pomacanchi district of the Acomayo Province in the department of Cusco.  Maria is 49 years old, and is married.  In addition to her daily activities, she alternates her time by working in agriculture.  She grows grains such as: wheat, barley and others.  She has worked in agriculture for a long time, and the business has gone well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She sells her crops to her customers that request them.  She is a personable and earnest person, which has allowed her to get her family ahead.  

She is seeking a loan to purchase fertilizers and manure for her ranch.  The other members work selling crafts, selling bread, selling furniture, selling meat and running stores.  She is grateful for the loan and is committed to complying with the payment schedule.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers and manure for their ranch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy computers and a printer.

loans.name: Janeniana

texts.en:
Janeniana is a 23-year-old, married woman. She has one child, aged six years. She describes herself as courageous, a "go-getter" and ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, milk, sugar, soap, and other household items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is high operational costs.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a stock of bread, milk, sugar, soap and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler, within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children and have a happy family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy a stock of bread, milk, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives in Goris town, with her husband and two school-aged children. She works at Vorotan village school, which is 15 km away from Goris town. Together with her work at school, Anush also trades in clothing. She purchases clothing and resells it at Vorotan village, after her work in school. For tackling financial hardships, Anush works hard to help her husband and sustain their family.

Anush has now applied for this loan. She will use it to purchase new clothing, for reselling to customers. Realizing how the retail business helps her family, this loan is very important for Anush.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans, with soft conditions, to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Anush will be very thankful to lenders for their support and goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for new clothing for reselling to customers

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo deals in a business of fresh foods, such as green bananas and vegetables. He has carried out this activity for many years, with the aim of acquiring daily income to meet his family's needs. In addition to that, Tadeo has some rentals that earn him some money, for further development.

Tadeo wants a loan of 1,000,000 UGX to purchase a larger stock of the bananas for his business. This larger stock will boost his income and meet the demand of his customers. He faces challenges that include inadequate capital, competition, and changes in supply due to seasonal changes in availability of fresh foods. The inadequate capital problem is slowly being reduced, with the loans from the Kiva lenders through UGAFODE (according to Tadeo's comment from the previous loan).

His customers are the neighboring residents, restaurants, and people from the town centre. Tadeo is a hard-working man, with robust energy to work, if he acquires enough capital.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell

loans.name: Ortukoy

texts.en:
Ortukoy is 40 years old. She is married and has three children. Her children are non-adults. Ortukoy has a medical education. She has worked more than 20 years in a local hospital as nurse. She has a small salary. This salary is not enough for living. 

She also has a milking cow and sells milk to her neighbors. She has additional income from growing crops. She has rental land. She works hard from early morning till late evening but makes a little income. She must to make a new sowing but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 TJS (somoni) to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian, es soltero no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres la misma se encuentra ubicada en la zona Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto.
El estudio hasta el nivel secundaria. Actualmente trabaja de ayudante de albañil le cancelan semanalmente, para poder ayudar economicamente a su familia. 
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de herramientas de construccion (carretilla, taladro y otros)
El sueño de Cristian es tener sus propias herramientas y mejor su  calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristian is single and doesn’t have any children.  He lives at his parents’ house located in the Villa Ingenio zone of El Alto.

He has a middle school education and currently works as a mason’s helper and is paid weekly so that he can help his family financially.

He needs this loan to buy construction tools (wheelbarrow, drill, and other things).

Cristian’s dream is to have his own tools to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Eglecerio

texts.en:
Eglecerio is a fisherman from Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. He is married and has five children. 

He has been in the fishing business for many years now. This is the source of his income.

Eglecerio is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat. He will then be able to improve his catch which he can sell to the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is from the town of Getafe, Bohol. She is a married woman and has two young children. She is engaged in the fishing business with her husband. This is the source of their income.

Daisy is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items for fishing. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Daisy hopes to make their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks,  and other items for fishing

loans.name: Bertha Alejandrina

texts.es: Bertha  nació en la ciudad del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad, ella tiene 52  años de edad y está casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, aretes, collares y otras cosas más.   En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar regalos como peluches, pulseras, collares, aretes, aros, pintalabios y otras cosas más pues necesita mercadería para esta campaña navideña. Bertha está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: Bertha was born in the town of Cusco and she lives in this same town. She is 52 years old, she is married and she has four children. She sells beauty accessories such as perfumes, earrings, necklaces and other items. In this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy articles such as stuffed animals, bracelets, necklaces, earrings, lipsticks among other items, as she needs more products for the upcoming Christmas season. Bertha is happy with the loan she has received and she commits in complying with the repayment of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy stuffed animals, bracelets, necklaces, earrings and lipsticks.

loans.name: Alphonce

texts.en:
Alphonce, 52 years old, is from Kakamega. He is married to Doricah, who is a small scale farmer in the same county. They have seven children aged 26, 23, 18, 15 and 10 years old.

Alphonce has operated a shoe repair business for the last 16 years, earning an income of KES 14,000 monthly. This is his first loan with Vision fund Kenya. Alphonce wants to use this loan to buy shoe soles, glue and threads for sewing torn shoes. The profits will be used to pay fees and to repay the loan. Alphonce's dream is to open a workshop to make new shoes.

loans.use: to buy shoe soles, glue and threads for sewing torn shoes.

loans.name: Anastase

texts.en: Anastase, 26 years old, is married and has two children. He has been selling rice, cooking oil, soaps and many retail items for the past seven years. Anastase would like to use this loan to buy more rice and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used for making savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more salt, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca, 46 years old, is from Kakamega. She is a widow with two children, aged 26 and 24. She has operated a secondhand clothing business for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

Jesca is taking her first loan of KES 20,000 with Vision fund Kenya to purchase bales of clothes. She will use her profits to repay her loan. Jesca's dream is to become a supplier of bales of secondhand clothes in the region.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 52 years old, a female, and married. She has seven children, aged 21, 20,18,14,12, and 6 years old respectively, whom she supports. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer and she sells makuti (traditional palm-leaf roofing). She has been in this business for two years. In her business she earns a monthly income of  KES 6,650. 

She is taking her first loan of KES10,000 which she intends to use in buying more makuti. Betty will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to open another business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more makuti to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Evaliste

texts.en:
Evaliste is 32 years old. He is married with four children. He owns a salon and has been in the business for the past five years. 

He has requested a loan for buying more salon items such as clippers, shampoo, and many more. He plans to use the profits for saving. He is very thankful for the previous loan, that had helped in restocking the barber shop with advanced equipment and improved the quality of services.

loans.use: To buy more equipment to use in the barber shop.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a conservative woman, so she asked her brother to take her place in the picture. Rana is a married woman who was born in 1977. She lives Karak, Jordan with her husband, five sons, and one daughter. 

Rana has been raising sheep and selling their products for two years. She started her business by selling a few sheep. Now, she seeks to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of sheep in order to raise productivity. This will lead to an increase in sales and income. 

Rana doesn't have enough money to purchase more sheep, so she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more sheep to expand her business

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena, age 51, is a married woman and mother of eight children. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community with the support of her son. Both of them are old but are making efforts to earn income. Zareena offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

Zareena makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She will use the loan to buy more goods like rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower prices. She will then be able to meet the increasing demand. 

She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business. She thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more goods for the general store.

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
This is Nodar from the village of Bakhvi in the western part of Georgia. He is married with one grown son. The only breadwinner in the household is Nodar's son, who is a military contractor and gets a monthly salary. Nodar is unemployed at the moment and is seeking a job, but according to the fact that there is a high unemployment rate in the region, it became hard for Nodar to get a suitable job.
 
In order to generate income and cover the household expenses, Nodar is requesting a loan. If his loan is raised on the Kiva website, Nodar will buy a mini-bus and start working on a line. He will transport passengers from his district to a neighboring town and get a service fee. Nodar is an experienced driver and has the appropriate driving license. 

He hopes he will earn a good income and improve the standard of living for his family members in the near future.

loans.use: to buy a minibus and start working on a line

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida, 43 years old, is a hardworking and independent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, 3 sons and 3 daughters. Her husband is a security guard and his income is not enough to meet the household expenses. 

Khalida has been running a beauty salon for 10 years. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan, because she wants to purchase some more cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon. Khalida will use her profit, first of all, to repay the loan to Kiva and then to build a new room in the salon, as the space in the salon is too congested. She hopes that her business grows more. Khalida is very thankful to both Brac and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetic products and chairs for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school.  She does not take care of additional family members.  She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for one year.  She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more sugar, rice and soap.  She generates additional income from working as a promotions manager. She works in a shop and sells on a retail basis seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include thieves and ever increasing prices of commodities.  She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She joined MCDT-SACCO to acquire more capital. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, rice and soap

loans.name: Manuk

texts.en:
Manuk, who lives in Nor Kharberd village of Ararat region, has been providing taxi service using his own bus for 10 years now. As only a few people in the village own a car, the service that Manuk provides is in high demand. Currently the bus is in not in working condition and needs to be renovated as some parts are seriously damaged. 

Manuk has applied for this loan to renovate the bus and purchase new tires. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

The loan will greatly help this hardworking man to continue providing transportation service to locals and earn more income for his family. Manuk lives with his retired mother and two children.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his bus and new tires

loans.name: Ramiro Antonio

texts.es:
Ramiro es un campesino humilde y trabajador, padre de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con los ingresos provenientes de sus actividades agropecuarias. Aprendió el oficio desde que era pequeño, al lado de su padre quien le inculcó esta tradición familiar y que hoy en día, se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, pues posee cultivo de plátano y además cría y comercializa cerdos, tanto la cosecha como los animales son vendidos en el mercado del pueblo donde reside; de manera alterna también realiza trabajos como jornalero en diferentes fincas de la región, así complementa los ingresos con los que solventa los gastos básicos del hogar y le ha brindado educación a sus hijos.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, pesticidas, larvicidas y concentrado para los animales), esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y además podrá mejorar el margen de utilidades que recibe por la venta de sus productos, pues al comprar en cantidad disminuye el costo de los insumos, beneficiando así las finanzas de la familia.
Ramiro, a sus 46 años de edad, manifiesta que sueña con ampliar sus cultivos y fortalecer el negocio de la comercialización de cerdos, aumentando la producción para tener mayor rentabilidad y estar en la capacidad de brindar educación universitaria a todos sus hijos, además desea disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida en compañía de su amada esposa y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a humble and hardworking farmer.  He is the father of four children who he has raised with the earnings from his agricultural work.  He learned this trade from a young age, having worked side by side with his father who instilled this family tradition in him.  Today, it is his main source of income.  He has plantain crops and he also raises and sells pigs.  The crops and animals are both sold in his town's market.  In addition to this, he also works as a day laborer on different farms in the region, which supplements his income, allowing him to cover the basic expenses of his household, and provide his children with an education.  

The loan he is seeking will be used to purchase agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, pesticides, larvicides and animal feed).  This will allow him to continue his work and increase his profit margin from selling his products.  By purchasing in bulk, he reduces the cost of his supplies, benefiting his family's finances.  

At 46, Ramiro dreams of expanding his crops and strengthening his pig-selling business.  By increasing his production, he will be more profitable and will be in a better position to provide his children with a university education.  He also wishes to enjoy a better quality of life in the company of his lovely wife and their children.

loans.use: Purchase agricultural supplies in bulk (manure, pesticides, larvicides and animal feed).

loans.name: Hazel Estela

texts.es: Hazel es originaria de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Es una joven emprendedora la cual ha cumplido las expectativas que tenía.  Solicita el crédito para la compra de vitrinas y estantes con el objetivo de darle mejor publicidad a sus productos. Su plan futuro es hacer que el negocio crezca cada día más para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Hazel is originally from the city of Chinandega.  By trade she is a businesswoman working in a small grocery store.  She is a young entrepreneur who has fulfilled the expectations she had.  She is requesting the loan to buy display cabinets and shelves in order to better display her products.  Her future plan is to make her business grow more each day so that she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy display cabinets and shelves.

loans.name: Dúo Manos Ayudadoras Group

texts.es:
DUO MANOS AYUDADORAS
La señora Maria Celestina de 47 años de edad, soltera,  desde hace 5 años posee una Tortillería ubicada en la calle principal de la colonia San Rafael de la zona 2 de Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de la señora María Celestina poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz para seguir creciendo con su tortillería.
texts.en:
TWO HELPING HANDS: Maria Celestina is 47 years old and single, and for five years now she has run a tortilla-making business located in in the main street of San Rafael Colony in Zone 2 of Chimaltenango. Through her hard work she managed to establish and improve her dwelling, and through her business, she has maintained and even gotten her family ahead.

Maria Celestina's dream is to be able to improve her and her family's quality of life through the microloans she requests through FAPE. With this loan, she wants to be able to buy corn so that she can continue to grow her tortilla-making business.

loans.use: buy corn to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is 30 years old. He is married with one child. His wife works as a businesswoman.

With the loan, he wants to buy more sugar, packaged milk, eggs, biscuits and mineral waters for sale in his restaurant. The profits from the business will be used for house renovations and to make some savings. 

He was happy with the previous loan, which he says helped in running the business, and he repaid on time.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab, a 50 year old man, lives in Batumi with his large family. He has a wife, two daughters, and one son. His wife and daughter work at a local department of culture in the Khelvachauri district. His son works as a security guard. 

Merab serves local people as a taxi driver. Because of high fuel prices, Merab decided to change the fuel system in his taxi. He applied for a loan through LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo. His request was approved through the Start Up program which is a joint initiative with Kiva that permits rural people to start or re-start businesses. 

Merab needs $600 to install gas equipment in his car. This will decrease expenses as gas is much cheaper than diesel. Merab is an experienced driver and hard-working person who awaits your support.

loans.use: To install gas equipment in his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Sameera

texts.en:
Because Sameera is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Sameera was born in 1962. She is married and has 6 children. All of them are living in a sector in Jordan called Southern Ghour.

Sameera's husband is a retired man who distributes water with his water tanker, which is their only source of income. He is currently facing a problem with running his business because the tires of his water tanker need to be repaired but, as he is facing a financial crisis, he doesn't have enough money to buy new tires. For this reason, Sameera has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to help her husband repair the tires of his water tanker

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
Juan de 29 años de edad, estudio Bachillerato general, es casado; la esposa se dedica a los domésticos, tiene dos hijos.

Juan realiza viajes en un autobús, desde hace 4 años el oficio lo aprendió solo ya que vio la necesidad de poder hacer viajes en el autobús, también don Juan se dedica a la agricultura, el trabajo le queda a una distancia de 30 min en carro la ruta que él tiene es de llevar alumnos de la escuela de la comunidad al municipio, en este negocio solamente él se dedica;  el horario de trabajo es de las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

El préstamo que está solicitando a fundación Campo, es para comprar  llantas al autobús, ya que con la calle fea se le han terminado. El crédito mejorara el funcionamiento de su carro y podrá salir con más confianza a realizar su trabajo. 
Los sueños más grandes, son poder tener más buses en buen estado y más grande, para realizar su trabajo, poder salir a excursiones con las personas, hacerle viajes a lugares más largos, ya que con el que posee no puedo ir por el año del bus; pero con lo poco que le da de ganancias podrá ir ahorrando, para comprar uno en mejor estado y así poder tener más ingresos de alimentos en su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is 29 years old and has a bachelor’s degree.  He is married and his wife is a housewife and they have two children.

Juan is a bus driver and learned this on his own four years ago when he noticed that there was a need for bus service.  Juan also farms in an area 30 minutes away by car.  He takes students to the local school on his bus route.  He is the only one who works in this business.  His work hours are from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm.

He is asking for this loan, through Fundación Campo, to buy tires for his bus since they have been used up because of the bad roads.  The loan will improve his car’s function and he will be able to go out to work with more confidence.

His greatest dreams are to be able to have more and bigger busses in good repair so he can do his work, be able to go out on trips with others, and make trips to places farther away since he can’t take long trips with his current bus because of its age.  But he will be able to save up little by little so he can buy one in better shape and be able to have more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy tires for his bus.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en:
Hanadi was born in 1980. She is married and lives in Dair Alla, Jordan. Her husband is a driver. 

Hanadi has been selling clothes and accessories from her house for one year. She started her business selling a small amount of items. Now, she is seeking to expand her business by buying a larger quantity of clothes and accessories to raise her sales and to be a good financial support for her husband. 

Hanadi doesn't have enough money to increase her inventory, so she has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and accessories for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries like mangos, tomatoes, onions and others

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
From Batumi city, Davit is 24 years old and lives with his wife and mother, both of whom are currently unemployed. Davit's main economic activity is his newly-started café, where traditional Georgian meals and various beverages are sold. His enterprise is profitable, but it needs support for further development. 

Davit decided to expand his business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he didn't satisfy their requirements. He received the credit within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo called Start-up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. 

With a loan of 1800 USD, Davit will purchase inventories such as a display refrigerator, chairs and dishes for expanding his activities. Summertime is the high season for the café business, and Davit believes that the business will be lucrative. His regular customers will be locals and passersby. 

Davit is grateful to all Kiva lenders for helping him expand his activity to make it more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his cafe

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is a single mother of one child and her child doesn’t go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Prossy has a business, selling boiled eggs. She has applied for a loan of UGX 300,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy trays of eggs and charcoal. She sells in markets and also supplies to markets. She sells on a retail basis, seven days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  

Prossy aspires to expand her business to nearby markets and to start rearing eggs herself. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and medication.

loans.use: to buy more trays of eggs and charcoal.

loans.name: Lina

texts.es:
Lina 
Puntarenas


Lina tiene 52,  ha trabajado desde hace 15 años en el comercio y este es el noveno préstamo que adquiere en Fundación Mujer, ha demostrado ser una mujer emprendedora y con su actividad a apoyado el ingreso familiar y el estudio de sus hijos. Ha vendido electrodomésticos traídos de Golfito, ha hecho rifas, ha apoyado a su esposo en el negocio de soldadura y ahora, junto a su hija  comercializa mercadería importada y además viaja a Nicaragua mensualmente para comprar zapatos. Ha demostrado una excelente conducta de pago y su actividad es consolidada en la zona.
Inició con un préstamo de  50.000 colones otorgado por su esposo, en el 2003. Por medio de una charla de información se involucra con Fundación Mujer, apoyando el desarrollo de su actividad desde entonces. A la fecha se mantiene activa y requiere del capital ya que su producto ha tenido mucha aceptación y desea invertir para la temporada de verano en la zona costera donde vive.
 Obtiene una ganancia cercana al 100%, el producto que trae por medio de su hija (bolsos y accesorios) ha tenido una muy buena acogida y genera una gran ganancia, además  los zapatos traídos de Nicaragua son de gran aceptación.
La clienta tiene una amplia experiencia en el comercio, tiene  un producto consolidado en el mercado por lo que mantienen una  clientela estable. Genera ingresos para su hogar y ha realizado mejoras a su casa de habitación producto de su actividad. Ha demostrado una excelente conducta de pago, crecimiento en su microempresa y fidelidad a Fundación Mujer.
texts.en:
Lina is 52 years old.  She has worked in retail since she was 15 years old, and this is the ninth loan she has received from Fundación Mujer.  She has demonstrated that she is an enterprising woman, and has supported her family's finances and her children's education through her work.  She has sold household appliances brought in form Golfito, she has done raffles, she has helped her husband in his welding business, and now, with her daughter, she is selling imported merchandise as well as shoes that she brings from Nicaragua monthly.  

She has shown excellent payment behavior and her business is strong in the area.  She started with a loan of 50,000 colones that was given by her husband in 2003.  After an informational session, she became involved with Fundación Mujer, and they have supported the development of her business ever since.  To this date, she remains active and is in need of this loan because her products have been well-received and she wants to invest for the summer season in the coastal region where she lives.  

She makes a profit that is close to 100%, and the products that her daughter brings (bags and accessories) have been very well-received and generate great revenues.  Additionally, the shoes she brings from Nicaragua are also well-received.  Lina has a lot of experience in retail, and she has an established product in the marketplace that allows her to maintain a stable customer base.  She has demonstrated excellent payment behavior, growth in her business and loyalty to Fundación Mujer.

loans.use: purchase clothing, accessories and jewelry.
